texts.en: Norma, 41, is a very determined woman who lives with Cesar, her husband of 14 years.  Together they have 4 children, but they only live with 2 of them, since their adult children live in the city of Huanuco where they are in college.  As a countrywoman who was born and raised among the green meadows, she learned to take maximum advantage of the teachings of her parents, who gave her agricultural land where she now cultivates potatoes, peas, corn and beans.  "As the result of my work and the help of my parents I now have 6 plots of land to cultivate," she states.  In addition, she has 5 dairy cows, with which she produces cheese, and also 7 bulls to help her plow the land.  She says that in the harvest season she goes to the city of Tarma on the weekends to sell her produce, as well as the cheese that she makes.  She already has regular customers who know the quality of the products that she sells.  Now her main priority is to pay for the education of her children, because an education is the most valuable asset that she can leave to her children.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Jerusalen," and this is the 2nd loan that she has taken with MFP, where she awaits the cooperation of all of you so that she can continue to reach for her goals.  In addition, she is committed to making her payments on time.  Once she receives the loan, Norma will use the money to buy 2 sacks of pea seeds and a number of sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over her next crop of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres, vecinas y amigas, de ciudad del Este se han agrupado, del cual surge el comité denominado Mujeres Unidas, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el 3er. ciclo. Este se forma gracias a la gestión de una de las miembros, ella al enterarse sobre el programa de la Fundación, motivo a sus amigas y vecinas.
Todas ellas tienen un propósito en común, que es el de conseguir mas ingresos para llevar a sus casas. Trabajan incansablemente, todo dentro de un ambiente de unión y cooperación.
La Sra. Clotilde es cocinera, ella se dedica a esta profesión hace ya unos años. Se considera como una cocinera excelente ya que muchas personas vienen a llevar la comida que ella prepara. Sueña con algun dia poder abrir su propio comedor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de carnes, verduras, fideos y demás para la elaboracion de las comidas que elabora.
texts.en:
14 women, neighbors and friends from Ciudad del Este came together to form the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) committee which is currently in its third loan cycle.  The committee was formed thanks to one of its members who found out about Fundación Paraguaya's program and motivated her friends and neighbors to join.

All the members of this committee have a goal in common, that is to make more income for their households.  They work tirelessly in an environment of unity and cooperation.

Clotilde is a cook and has been in this profession for some years.  She considers herself to be an excellent cook as many people come to buy the food that she prepares.  She dreams of some day opening her own eatery.

Clotilde is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, noodles and other ingredients for making the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo José

texts.es: Eduardo hombre de 29 años que vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de dos años, tiene un negocio en el barrio ciudad Jardín de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde distribuye accesorios de celulares. Este negocio lo indicó hace un año, cuando después de hacerse profesional de las finanzas y el comercio emprendió su aventura y se dedicó a importar accesorios para celulares, que  actualmente distribuye a mayoristas de la ciudad. Inicialmente y por sugerencia de un amigo inició aprovechando la experiencia de éste, de la cual se dejó guiar; en un principio hacia pedidos de baja cuantía,  pero poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus utilidades.  Como es un joven trabajador y está empeñado en crecer personalmente y empresarialmente, simultáneamente administra la cafetería de un colegio privado e importante en la ciudad.  En su búsqueda de nuevas opciones en el mercado,  necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo y esta es la razón por la cual ha accedido a un credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará nuevos y modernos accesorios de telefonía celular, pues  los pedidos han aumentado y desea responderle a sus clientes y ser muy oportuno con ellos. Aunque su mayor desafío  es la competencia,   los precios que Eduardo ofrece y su excelente servicio hacen que logre ser competitivo. Mientras construye su sueño de aumentar sus utilidades, se esmera trabajando con un margen no menor de un 50% y rotando sus inventarios cada 25 días.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a man of 29 who lives with his wife and two year old son.  He has a business in the Jardín neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where he distributes accessories for mobile phones. He's been in this business for a year; after getting experience in finance and commerce, he began his adventure and got involved in importing accessories for phones.  He currently distributes these to wholesalers in the city.  Initially, he started by benefiting from the experience of a friend and let himself be guided.  At the beginning, his orders were low-value, but bit by bit he has been increasing his profits. 

He is a hardworking young man and is committed to growing personally and professionally.  He also manages the cafeteria of an important private school in the city.  In his search for new options in the market, he needs to increase his working capital and this is why he has approached Kiva.  This is his first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy new modern cell phone accessories, as orders have increased and he would like to respond to his customers and offer them appropriate items.  

Although his biggest challenge is the competition, the prices that Eduardo offers and his excellent service allow him to be competitive. While building his dream of higher profits, he strives to work with a margin of not less than 50%, turning over his inventory every 25 days.

loans.use: to buy new, modern cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: El señor Francisco, es habitante de municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus pequeños en los estudios , don Francios desde hacía varios años  se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas , ya que este cultivo carece de fertilizante s e insumos necesarios para su mantenimiento , lo cual si no es aplicado de forma urgente puede perder la producción , Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva  a todos los agricultores que no tienen recursos económico para poder tener una buena cosechas .
texts.en: Señor Francisco, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. Regarding his family, his plans are to improve their living conditions and support his little ones through their education. For some years now, Señor Francisco has dedicated his time to growing pineapples. The main difficulty is infestations, because the crop lacks the fertilizers and chemicals needed to maintain it. If these are not applied soon, he may lose the harvest. He is grateful for the confidence and support offered through [field partner] Afodenic and Kiva to farmers, like himself, who do not have the resources to ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; la socia tiene 33 años; la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a la compra y veta de artesanías; la socia también elabora chullos, guantes, chalinas, ponchos de alpaca, también realiza finas mantas con diseños paisajísticos, en la misma manta borda paisajes como arboles, cerros, aves, flores, ríos, animales, en general la flora y fauna de nuestro ande; La socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa desde hace 7 años y venta muy feliz por poder expresar ese bello arte del pueblo como ella lo manifiesta. La socia desea poder comprar lana de alpaca procesada, botones, hilos al por mayor para implementar su negocio y también realiza estandartes, ropa para santos a pedido. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos entre otros.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, in the Huanchac district in the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maribel; she is 33 years old and has one son. The member dedicates herself to buying and selling handicrafts; she also makes chullos (traditional woollen hats), gloves, and alpaca wool ponchos. In addition, she makes fine blankets with traditional designs and embroiders them with country motifs such as trees, birds, flowers, rivers, and animals - all the flora and fauna of the Andes. The member has had a small workshop in her house for 7 years, and is very happy that she can create this beautiful traditional art. She wishes to buy spun alpaca wool, buttons, and needles wholesale, to be able to carry on her business, and also to enable her to make hangings and clothing for saints, to order. The member is seeking a loan to invest in materials for making blankets, hangings, clothing for saints, chullos, and other things.

The member states that she is very satisfied with and grateful for the support offered, and promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in the place agreed.

loans.use: To invest in materials for making blankets, hangings, clothing for saints, chullos, and other things.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé le 09 décembre 2010. Il est composé de membres d'une même famille qui habitent dans le même quartier.

La présidente Coumba, âgée de 41 ans,est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Sur la photo elle est à droite en boubou multicolore.

Elle vend du riz au marché central du village. Elle se ravitaille auprès des grossistes pour le revendre à ses clients. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 03 ans.

Avec son prêt elle veut acheter du riz et le stocker.

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut ouvrir une boutique et aider son mari dans les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom de Jappo Dollé Ndiass was created on 9 December 2010. It comprises members of the same family who live in the same area.

The president, Coumba, is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She is on the right in the multicoloured boubou in the photo.

She sells rice at the Darou central market. She gets her supplies from wholesalers to re-sell to her customers in Darou. She has run this business for over three years.

With her loan, she would like to buy and stock rice.

With her profits, she wants to open a store and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 20 años; nació en el caserío de Punray, donde ahora vive junto a sus padres y sus 7 hermanos a los que apoya económicamente. Todos ellos residen en su casa que es propia. Este valiente jovencito, ayuda en los gastos económicos de su familia, que por ser numerosa realizan muchos gastos. A pesar de su edad, tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir estudiando. Todas las mañanas junto a su padre se dirigen a cuidar de sus cultivos de papa; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que tiene que sacar el máximo provecho éstos terrenos que arrienda para poder producir y tener ganancias. Además es muy hábil en la comercialización de su cosecha, en el mercado mayorista de la localidad de Huasahuasi, “capital productora de papa del país”. Con las ganancias obtenidas, pudo comprar chanchos y toros, éste último le ayuda a arar la tierra, así minimiza costos para dicha tarea, ya que anteriormente tenía que contratar peones. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda seguir adelante. Ronald de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Ronald is 20 years old. He was born in the hamlet of Punray, where he lives with his parents and 7 siblings, whom he helps to support. They live together in a house which they own. This courageous youth helps with his family's living expenses - which are high because there are so many in the family. Despite his age, he has great aspirations to continue his learning. Every morning he goes with his father to take care of their potato crop; he takes great care of the crop because they have to get the best out of the plot of land they lease, so that it provides an income. He is also very adept at marketing his harvest, in the wholesale market in Huasahuasi, “the potato producing capital of the country”. With the money earned, he was able to buy pigs and cattle - the latter to help plough the soil. This minimised the cost of ploughing, as previously they had to hire labourers. Ronald belongs to the "Nueva Jerusalen" ("New Jerusalem") communal bank, and this is his first loan with [field partner] MFP. He hopes for a small loan to help him keep moving forward. On receiving your support, Ronald will invest the money in the purchase of a sack of pea seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Begg Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Fallou est créé le 09 décembre 2010 lors du premier financement du Banc Villageois,il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont solidaires et ont confiance entre elles; la principale activité menée est le petit commerce.

La présidente du groupe de solidarité Khady, âgée de 27 ans, est célibataire sans enfant. Sur la photo elle est debout en couleur orangée tout à fait à droite.

Elle fait de la teinture et de la couture depuis 06 ans. Elle achéte ses tissus dans une grande ville.

Avec son prêt elle voudrai acheter du matériel de teinture et de couture.

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut élargir son champ d'action et épargner plus dans le système.
texts.en:
The Begg Fallou solidarity group of the village loan fund of Jappo Dollé Ndiass was created on 9 December 2010. The group comprises 12 women who live in the same area and support and trust each other.

The solidarity group president, Khady, is 27 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She is wearing orange and standing all the way on the right in the photo.

She has been dyeing and making clothing for six years. She buys her fabric in Touba.

With her loan, she would like to buy dyes and dressmaking supplies.

With her profits, she wants to expand her market.

loans.use: To buy dyes and dressmaking products.

loans.name: Bolivar's Group

texts.en: Bolivar is 65 years old and lives near Otavalo, Ecuador. He is single and lives with his 19-year-old son. Bolivar is a calm person who likes to work. His business is a small carpentry workshop. When he was 20 years old, he began his work in carpentry. He learned his craft little by little and really enjoyed it. It allowed him to support his family and build his own house. Now, Bolivar works alongside a nephew. Bolivar will use this loan to purchase raw materials including wood, boards, and paint to make furniture. This is Bolivar’s first loan and he will be able to buy more material at lower costs thanks to the loan. Bolivar’s dream is to see his son finish school.

loans.use: to buy wood, boards, and paint for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Sop Mame Thierno Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est crée le 09 décembre 2010jour de l'inauguration du banc villageois regroupe 16 femmes qui sont tous du même quartier et ont de bonnes relations entre elles. leur activité principale c'est le petit commerce Awa est la responsable du groupe , âgée de 44 ans, elle est veuve avec 03 filles, un garçon , 4 petits fils.
Awa gère une boutique chez elle avec le prêt elle compte renforcer sa boutique. Elle veut aussi acheter des tissus qu'elle va donner à ses enfants pour qu'elles font la vente marché ambulante.Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans.
Elle va jusqu'à Mauritanie pour acheter sa marchandise. Avec le prêt elle veut promouvoir l’épanouissement et le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on 9 December 2010, the day the local village group fund was established. It comprises 16 women who all live in the same area and have good relationships with each other. Their main activity is running small retail businesses. Awa, the group leader, is 44 years old, widowed, and has three daughters, one son, and four grandsons.
Awa runs a store at her home. With this loan, she intends to strengthen her store. She also wants to buy fabric to give to her children to sell door-to-door. She has run this business for 15 years.
She goes all the way to Mauritania to buy her merchandise. With this loan, she wants to promote the flourishing and well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey du Banc Villageois Jappo Dollé Ndiass est créé le 9 décembre 2010, il est constitué de dix femmes qui sont parentes et qui s'activent dans le petit commerce.

Madame Dieumb la responsable est âgée de 44 ans elle est mariée mère de six enfants dont trois filles et a un petit fils en charge; elle mène une activité de vente de légumes avec une expérience de plus de 23 ans.

Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend au marché central de Darou.

Avec son prêt elle veut renforcer la qualité de ses produits en achetant plus de marchandises.

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut augmenter son épargne et participer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey solidarity group was created on December 9, 2010. It consists of ten women who are related and who work in small trade. The group is part of the Banc Villageois Jappo Dollé Ndiass. 

Mrs. Dieumb is the head of the group. She is 44 years old, married, and a mother to six children. Three daughters and a grandson are in her care. She sells vegetables, an activity she has been practicing for over 23 years.

She gets her stock at the weekly markets and sells the merchandise at the central market of Darou.

She will use her loan to improve her merchandise by buying more of it. With her revenue, she wants to add to her savings and help provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ritza Emelina

texts.en: Ritza lives in Choluteca, Honduras with her husband and two small children. She makes a living selling clothing in a central location in her town. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase merchandise. In her free time, Ritza enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, shoes, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene su actividad que es la venta de tortillas y frijoles. Tiene más de 23 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a sus clientes pues llegan a su vivienda donde está ubicado su negocio, todos los días de la semana en donde empieza a atender desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde que todavía ciertos vecinos llegan en busca de tortillas. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, comal, leña y cal.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel's business is selling tortillas and beans.  She has been in this business for more than 23 years.  She has to get up early in order to serve her customers who come to her home (where her business is located) every day of the week.  She starts serving at 7.00am and finishes at 6.00pm when some neighbors are still coming to buy tortillas.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn, bags, a comal (a special pan for cooking tortillas), firewood and lime.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, a comal, firewood and lime

loans.name: Paulina Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; la socia tiene 42 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia trabaja en el hospital del seguro social, ella es enfermera de profesión y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista la socia trae casacas de la ciudad de Lima y los vende aquí a sus diferentes amigas y allegados, la socia cada 6 meses realiza los viajes a la ciudad de Lima; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ropa de la ciudad de Lima para venderla aquí ahora que se viene el cambio de estación. La saica solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compras de ropa.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, in the Huanchac district in the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Paulina; she is 42 years old and is single. The member works in the public hospital; she is a professional nurse. She also has a small business, bringing coats back from the city of Lima to sell to her friends and acquaintances here. The member makes the journey to Lima every 6 months; on this occasion she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing in Lima to sell here, now that the seasons are changing.

The member states that she is very satisfied with and grateful for the support offered, and promises to comply with the repayment of her loan in the place agreed.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa tiene 23 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener un nivel de vida estable con buena economia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 23 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children, aged 7 and 2, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The "EL DIVINO NIÑO' community bank is located in Estero Lindo, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Ana is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Ana is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to enjoy a stable life, in a good financial position.

Ana enjoys celebrating local fiestas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Yaye Dji Cheikh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 09 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont dans une parfaite harmonie. leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Soda  est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans elle est marié et de mère de 04 enfants. Ella a aussi la charge d'un autre enfant. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes,  Elle est située à droite de la photo avec une écharpe blanche sur l'épaule droite. 
Avec son nouveau crédit Soda va dans les villes pour y acheter des légumes qu'elle vient revendre au niveau de son village. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle veut renforcer son épargne tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge da la famille, par exemple la nourriture, la santé etc.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 9, 2010. It is composed of 16 women in perfect harmony. Their main activity is small trade.

Soda is the group leader. She is standing at the far right in the photo, with a white scarf on her right shoulder. She is 35 years old, married, and a mother to four children. She also has another child in her care.

Soda runs a small business selling vegetables. With her new loan, she will buy vegetables in different cities for resale in her own village. She has been engaged in this activity for 20 years.

With her revenue, she wants to bolster her savings while helping her husband in providing for their family with respect to food, healthcare, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Noreyni Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Noreyni du banc villageois de Sokhna Momy est créé le 09 décembre 2010. Il regroupe 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes du commerce au marché central du village.
La présidente du groupe de solidarité Ndéye Kaba est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Sur la photo elle est à droite en boubou rose et blanc avec un châle noir sur les épaules.
Elle fait du petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle vend ses produits au marché central du village.
Avec son prêt elle va s'approvisionner selon la disponibilité du marché en produits de saison.
Mon mari et moi subvenons aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The  Noreyni solidarity group of the Sokhna Momy village bank was created on December 9, 2010. The group is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighbourhood and carry out business at Darou's central market. The president of the group, Ndeye Kaba, is 49 years old and married with 2 children. In the photo, she is on the right in the white and pink boubou with a black shawl over her shoulders. She has a small business selling seasonal fruit. She sells her products at Darou's central market. With her loan she is going to source seasonal produce in accordance with market availability. "My husband and I provide for the needs of our family"

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 43 años,  vive en el caserío de Punray, ahí formó su familia junto a su esposa con quien convive desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. La zona donde habita, es un paraje alejado, que aparte de poseer un buen paisaje tiene tierras muy fértiles. Desde muy joven comenzó su camino por la agricultura, aprovechando las cualidades de la tierra. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en los sembríos de habas, arveja, papa y maíz, los cuales cuida constantemente, ya que necesita de los nutrientes necesarios para poder adquirir productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus productos, sin embargo teme que tanto sacrifico no reciba buenas ganancias al momento de su comercialización, debido a la variaciones del precio de este producto en el mercado. Por tanto, acaba de iniciar con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y gallinas, que son vendidos a buen precio después de engordarlos; así se genera ganancias extras mientras espera la temporada de cosecha y comercialización de sus productos alimenticios. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde esta contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Además se compromete en ser puntual con las cuotas. Félix sembrará dentro de poco papa de las variedades “canchan y yungay” por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su sembrío, por lo que augura una producción de 200 sacos.
texts.en: Félix is 43 years old and lives in the hamlet of Punray. There he started his family, together with his wife whom he has lived with for 22 years. They have 7 children, whom they look after with great love and tenderness, in their own house. The area they live in is a remote spot, which not only has beautiful countryside but also very fertile soil. When he was very young, Félix began to find his way into agriculture, making the most of the quality of the soil. He now has 5 years' experience sowing beans, peas, potatoes and maize, which he takes care of constantly. He now needs the nutrients necessary to ensure a good quality crop. What Félix likes most about his work is being able to see his produce grow; nonetheless he worries that all the effort may not turn into good profits when the time comes to sell, thanks to fluctuations in the price of products at the market. Because of this, he has just begun raising small animals, such as pigs and hens, which sell for a good price once they are fattened up. In this way he can generate aditional earnings while awaiting the next harvest season and the sale of his produce. He belongs to the “Nueva Jerusalén” communal bank, and this is his 7th loan with [field partner] MFP, where he is happy to know that he can access the financial support he needs. He vows to be punctual in meeting his repayments. On receiving the support, Félix intends to plant potatoes, of the varieties "canchan" and "yungay". He will invest the money in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to begin a successful planting: following this he predicts he should be able to produce some 200 sacks of potaoes.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisca Esperanza

texts.en: Francisca lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she runs a small general store. She has run this small business for the past 15 years and gets up at 5 am each day to open the store. Francisca is requesting a loan of LPS. 8,000 to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juices, snacks, instant soups, fruits, vegetables, beans, corn meal, lard, condiments, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Sop Modou Awa Balla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité  Sop Modou Awa Balla du banc villageois de Sokhna Momy existe le 08 décembre 2010.Le groupe est composé de 06 personnes. Elles sont du même quartier et font du petit commerce.

La présidente du groupe, Khady est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Sur la photo elle est habillée en boubou elle est à l'extrême droite de la photo.

Elle est commerçante.Elle vend des fruits de saison qu'elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaire et revend au marché central de Darou.

Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter des marchandises.

Elle augmente son épargne avec ses bénéfices car la charge de la maison est assurée par son mari.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Modou Awa Balla of the Banc Villageois of Sokhna Momy has been in existence since December 8, 2010. The group is composed of six persons. They are from the same district and have small businesses. The group's president, Khady, is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. In the photo, she is the one dressed in a boubou at the far right. She is a merchant and sells seasonal fruit that she purchases from the weekly markets and resells at the central market of Darou. With her loan, Khady wants to buy some merchandise. She is increasing her savings with her profits, since household expenses are covered by her husband.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, es un hombre valiente y trabajador, tiene 37 años; que junto a su esposa Dina, cuidan de sus 3 menores hijos; Fresia, Frank, y Denis. Los que en armonía familiar viven en su casa propia, ubicada  en el caserío de Yanama Alta. El trabajo que desarrolla desde hace 15 años, es la agricultura; donde siembra diversos productos oriundos como papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir, pues su secreto es la siembra escalonada, que consiste en sembrar diversos productos, para poder contrarrestar las variaciones de  los precios en el mercado. Ahora después de su próxima cosecha, comenzará a sembrar habas, adelantándose a la temporada, de esa manera estabilizará su economía. Aparte de tener 5 toros con los que surca la tierra, ganando así S/. 60 soles diarios, pero esta actividad lo realiza en sus tiempos libres, por lo que, según sus propias palabras es “su pasatiempo”. Los planes de Félix, es adquirir un auto con el que pueda dedicarse al transporte público, además de poder tener sus propios terrenos agrícolas ya que trabaja alquilando grandes extensiones de tierra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama”, y esté es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es un socio activo y comprometido con el trabajo que desempeñan los integrantes de su banco. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Félix, cosechará flor de gladiolo dentro de unos días, por eso de recibir su apoyo está pensando invertir el dinero del préstamo; en la compra de 1 bolsa de semilla de arveja para lo que necesitará también 6 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y así comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Félix is a courageous and hardworking man. He is 37 years old, and along with his wife Dina cares for his three minor children: Fresia, Frank and Denis, who live in familial harmony in their own home, located in the hamlet of Yanama Alta. 

The work he has done for 15 years is farming, in which he grows various crops native to the area such as potatoes, peas and gladioli. What he enjoys most about his work is to be able to invest, since his secret is to plant crops on a staggered basis, which consists of planting a variety of products so as to counteract fluctuations in market prices. Now after his next harvest he will begin sowing beans, ahead of season, and in this way he will stabilize his finances. In addition he has five bulls with which he does plowing, making 60 Peruvian soles a day, but he does that activity in his free time so, in his own words, it is "his hobby."  

Félix's plans are to acquire a car with which to offer public transportation, in addition to being able to own his own farmland since he currently rents large areas of land to do his farming. He belongs to the communal bank "Manantiales de Yanama" [Springs of Yanama] and this is his sixth loan with MFP. He is an active member and committed to the work of the other members of his bank. Thus he hopes for the support of all of you so he may keep pursuing his objectives. 

Félix will harvest gladioli within a few days, and so upon receiving his support he is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of one bag of pea seeds for which he will also require six bags of natural fertilizers, and thus successfully begin his next planting.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds and six bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flip-flops and artificial flowers wholesale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 63 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, sus hijos viven independientemente, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Mario  es brindar el servicio de transporte público, ya que cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo trabaja mañana y tarde movilizando personas que viven en Morropón y también a los distintos caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y realizar algunos arreglos en su casa.  Mario es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 63 years old.  He lives with his wife in his own home and his children live independently.  His home only has electricity.  It is located in Morropón district, in Piura department.  The people in these areas farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Mario's business is providing a public transport service as he owns his own motorcycle taxi.  He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people who live in Morropón and the small villages in the area.  He has his own customer base and is able to cover his household expenses with the income that he makes.

Mario has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and make some repairs to his home.  Mario is very well known in his area because he is always looking out for his family's well-being with the goal of providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to replace some parts

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.en: Iris is a single mother with one child who lives in Choluteca, Honduras. She makes a living by selling candies and homemade cheese from out of her home. She gets up at 6 am each morning to make cheese and attend to clients. Iris is requesting a loan of LPS 5,000 to purchase candy as well as milk for making cheese. In her spare time, she enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of milk and candies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy digital cameras, lights, developing solution, acetic acid and other products

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La comunidad D. Papel Pata se encuentra a unos treinta minutos D. la ciudad principal D. La Convención (Quillabamba). 

En la comunidad D. Papel Pata conocimos a la señora Eva y ella nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad D. Huyro y que tiene 44 años D. edad, ella esta casada y fruto D. esta relación tiene seis hijos D. las cuales cuatro son independientes y dos todavía depenD. D. ella.  Actualmente, Eva vive en la comunidad D. Papel Pata y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Eva se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra D. cacao, café, naranja y otras cosas mas, ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad D. Quillabamba para vender a las personas que se encargan D. revender en la ciudad del Cusco. Eva también tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio, ella desD. las 5 D. la mañana abre la tienda para vender sus productos y permanece abierto el local hasta las 9 D. la noche. Eva en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, y otras cosas más.  

El banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones D. los socios son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Papel Pata del distrito D. Echarate provincia D. La Convención  del departamento del Cusco. (La comunidad D. Papel Pata esta ubicado a unos 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Quillabamba).
texts.en:
The community of Papel Pata is located some 30 minutes from the main city in La Convención (Quillabamba).

The community of Papel Pata is where you would find Ms. Eva, who tells Asociación Arariwa that she was born in the city of Huyro and is 44 years old. She is married and has six children from her marriage, four of whom are independent. The other two are still dependent on her. Currently, Eva lives and carries out her economic activities in the community of Papel Pata.

Eva works in agriculture. More specifically, she plants cocoa, coffee, oranges, and other crops. She brings her products to the city of Quillabamba, where she sells them to people whose job it is to resell the products in the city of Cusco. Eva also has a small grocery store in her house. She opens the store at five in the morning in order to sell her products, and she remains open until nine at night. At this time, Eva needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, and other items.

The "Caminando Juntos" ["Walking Together"] communal bank belongs to Asociación Arariwa (in Cusco, Perú). The group members meet every thirty days in the community of Papel Pata, which is in the district of Echarte, province of La Convención, and department of Cusco. (The community of Papel Pata is located some 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba).

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario de 32 años de edad,  está de pareja con la Sra. Maria de 23 años de edad, ellos tiene dos hijos, de 7 y 9 años de edad, ellos están cursando sus estudios primarios. 
Don Mario se dedica a la compra de chatarra de los recolectores. El se dedica a este rubro hace más de 13 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.998. Comenzó recolectando basuras, y posteriormente chatarras. Ahora  el se encarga de comprar de las otras personas de su comunidad.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora, su oficio es muy sacrificado. Comenta que no tiene vergüenza de lo que hace, es mas, le parece muy digno. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de sus hijos. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno, que esta ubicado a lado mismo de su vivienda, de esta forma estaría ampliando su lugar de trabajo para poder almacenar toda recolección posible.
texts.en:
Mario is 32 years old and lives with his partner, 23 year-old Maria.  The couple have two children aged 7 and 9 who are in elementary school.

Mario buys scrap metal from collectors.  He has been in this business for more than 13 years, since approximately 1998.  He started collecting garbage and then scrap metal.  Now he buys from other people in his community.

Mario describes himself as a very hard-working person.  His trade demands a lot of sacrifice.  He comments that he is not ashamed of what he does.  What is more, it seems a very worthy job to him.  He says that everything he does is for the good of his children.

Mario is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land which is located next to his home.  In this way, he will be able to expand his work space so that he can store as much scrap metal as possible.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land on which he will store his material

loans.name: Luber

texts.es:
Luber de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo. 

La actividad que desarrolla Luber es a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo oferta a sus clientes o a los diferentes mercados de la zona y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus gastos familiares.  Otra forma como obtiene más ingresos es alquilando su mototaxi. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para comprar más animales, especialmente cerdos que su comercialización es más rápida y con los ingresos que obtenga puede tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luber es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y brindarles otras oportunidades académicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luber, age 53, lives with his wife and children in their own house.  The only service the house has is electricity.  It is located in the Parcora district, Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and tourist activities.

Luber raises and sells poultry and pigs.  He has them in the yard behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they grow to their optimum, he sells them to his customers or at different markets in the area.  With the income that he receives he is able to pay the family expenses.  Another way that he gets more income is renting his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).

He has requested a loan of 2,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy more animals, especially pigs.  They sell faster, and with the income that he gets he is able to have a better quality of life.

Luber is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that he wants is for his family to get ahead and to give his children more educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irene   es divorciada, tiene 1 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Morón” grupo  conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Irene trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de prendas de vestir y venta de regalos   en una tienda, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a su hijo y es así que empezó vendiendo ropa en la calle, poco a poco se hizo de un capital, puso su tienda de ropa. Irene nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran su hijo y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijo va a una escuela privada, y sobre todo ella y su hijo tienen una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia (polos pantalones camisas etc), Sabemos que Irene  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Ms. Irene is divorced, has one school-aged son, and is a member of the "Virgen del Carmen de Morón" communal bank, which has seven members who work in various economic activities. For the last three years, Irene has worked selling clothing and gifts in a store. This business had its roots in her divorce, as she had to work to take care of her son, so she started selling clothing in the street. Little by little, she built up some capital and set up her clothing store. Irene explains that she has gained everything she has through a great deal of work and perseverance, and that her son was her motivation. Her desire to succeed was greater than her problems, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she achieved greater profits, her son attends a private school, and above all, she and her son have a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, Irene is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise (t-shirts, pants, shirts, etc.). EDAPROSPO knows that Irene will achieve her goals through her hard work and effort, and that the loans she receives through EDAPROSPO will help her.

loans.use: Para Comprar Prendas de Vestir

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she raises and sells pigs for a living. In addition to raising pigs, Luisa also mills corn to make extra income. She gets up at 5 each morning to open the mill and attend to her pigs. Luisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase pigs as well as parts for her corn mill.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and parts for her corn mill.

loans.name: Arebalo

texts.es: Arebalo tiene 34 años, es un hombre sencillo. Vive en compañía de Julia, su esposa desde hace 14 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los cuales cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Con tan solo 14 años de edad, comenzó su camino por la agricultura. Su buena disposición en el trabajo le ayudó a obtener buenas ganancias. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, habas y zanahoria. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pero le dificulta trabajar sin apoyo, ya que a veces tiene largas jornadas de trabajo, que le disminuye tiempo para comercializar su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él comparte su actividad con el negocio de compra y venta de animales entre ellos; vacas, toros, equinos y ovinos. Asimismo posee  2 toros de raza brown swiss, que es su mayor legado; pero como buen comerciante, una vez al mes tiene que llevar estos animales  a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde los vende a un buen precio. Ahora él se está preparando para comenzar con la segunda y última cosecha del año, donde está seguro que con su esfuerzo y ganas por salir adelante; obtendrá buenos resultados. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además agradece el apoyo brindado por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Arebalo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de arveja y un poco para sus sembríos de papa que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Arebalo is 34 years old and a simple man. He lives with his wife of 14 years, Julia. They have three children together, who they care for with great love in a house that they own in the locality of Palca. When he was just 14 years old, Arebalo started down the agricultural path. His positive attitude towards his work has helped him to earn good profits. His main crops consist of potatoes, peas, beans, and carrots. He takes great care of his crops but it is difficult for him to work without support. Sometimes he has very long work days, which reduces the time he has to sell his harvest at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

He splits his time with another business buying and selling animals like cows, bulls, horses, and sheep. He also has two bulls of the Brown Swiss breed, which are his greatest possession. As a good merchant, he has to bring his animals to the city of Huancayo once per month, where he sells them at a good price. Now, Arebalo is preparing to start his second and final harvest of the year, and he is sure that he will obtain good results thanks to his efforts and desire to get ahead.

Arebalo belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank and this is his first loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. He hopes to receive a small loan to help him achieve his goals. He is very grateful for the support being offered to him and promises to make his repayments on time. When Arebalo receives the loan, he will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for the next time he plants peas, and a little for the potato crops that he will harvest within the next few months.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Julia Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Junia; la socia tiene 42 años; la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia es contadora de profesión y  trabaja en una institución privada, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en su salud, ella requiere ir a un centro odontológico para tratarse los dientes, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la atención de sus dientes. La socia solicita el préstamo  para invertir en su salud. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Choquequirao" communal bank, located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Ms. Julia. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She is an accountant by profession and works at a private business. She would like a loan to invest in her health. She needs to go to a dental center to receive treatment for her teeth. She would like a loan to pay for the dental work. She is requesting the loan to invest in her health.

Julia is very satisfied with and grateful for the support that is being offered to her with this loan, and she promises to repay her debts according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for necessary dental work

loans.name: Fortunata Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 48 años; la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia es médico cirujano  y trabaja en una institución pública, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar equipo médico para implementar su consultorio, la socia va comprando poco a poco sus instrumentales y a futuro desea tener su propio consultorio médico y de este modo independizarse. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo médico propio.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Choquequirao" communal bank, located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Ms. Fortunata. She is 48 years old, married, and has one son. She is a medical surgeon and works at a public institution. She needs this loan to buy medical equipment for her office. She has been buying her instruments little by little, and in the future, she hopes to have her own medical clinic so that she can become independent.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of her own medical equipment. Fortunata is very with satisfied with and grateful for the support being offered to her through this means, and she promises to repay her debts according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase her own medical equipment

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: Diana  vive en el barrio Santa Maria al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 27 años. Desde los 13 años trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico hasta que cumplía los 40  y decidió seguir su sueño de tener un negocio; aprovechando su conocimiento en la elaboración de fritos,   comenzó con una ponchera en la puerta de su casa y posteriormente agregó papas rellenas, pasteles, almuerzos y ahora comidas rápidas; de esta manera ha logrado surgir con su familia, hoy con hijos adultos y dos menores a su cargo, por los cuales se esfuerza para lograr que ellos cumplan sus sueños y sean un día exitosos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una carpa para su carro de perros, y también invertirá en insumos en mayor cuantía, para lograr ahorros en sus compras y trasladárselos a los precios de venta. Su sueño es que sus hijos adultos logren plena independencia y que toda su familia logre  aumentar su bienestar cada dio más.
texts.en: Diana lives in the Santa Maria neighborhood, located in the southwest of the city of Barranquilla. She has five children between the ages of 12 and 27. When she was 13 years old, she started working as a domestic employee, and continued doing so until she was 40 years old. Then, she decided to follow her dream of having a business. She took advantage of her knowledge of how to prepare fried foods and started with just a large bowl in front of her house. She later added stuffed potatoes, pastries, lunches, and now fast foods, and this is how she has succeeded in supporting herself and her family. Today, she has three adult children and two who are still in her care. She struggles for them so that they can achieve their dreams and have successful futures. This credikiva is Diana's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a canopy for her hot dog cart and to invest in purchasing ingredients in larger quantities. She will be able to carry those savings over to her selling prices. Her dream is that her adult children will achieve complete independence and that her entire family will improve its quality of life each day.

loans.use: to buy a canopy for her hot dog cart and to buy ingredients in larger quantities

loans.name: Glenda Yosmary

texts.en: Glenda lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she earns a living by selling homemade baked goods. She primarily makes bread and tortillas. Her customers include neighbors from her village as well as local businesses and restaurants. Glenda is requesting a loan of  10,000 lempiras to purchase ingredients for making bread and tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, firewood, lime, yeast, milk and corn.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras es de la ciudad de Asunción, actualmente esta formado por 20 miembros. Todas ellas están unidas por un objetivo común, que es el de poder generar más ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan vivir dignamente y sin carencias.
El comité es conocido en el barrio pues sus miembros trabajan activamente, siempre en un marco de respeto y cooperación.
La Sra Maria es modista desde hace ya varios años, por eso es muy conocida en el barrio. Tiene mucha demanda ya que sus trabajos son muy buenos. Cometa que todo el esfuerzo que hace es con miras a brindarle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida sin carencias.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y kits de agujas para la utilización dentro de su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank is in the city of Asunción.  It is currently comprised of 20 members.  They are all united for one common cause, which is to be able to generate more income.  That way they will be able to live decently and without deprivations.

The bank is known in the neighborhood by its members who actively work with mutual respect and cooperation.

Maria has been a dressmaker for several years, and she is therefore well known in the neighborhood.  There is a lot of demand in her business because her work is very good.  She says that all of her efforts are done with the vision of giving her family a better lifestyle without deprivations.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, and needle kits to use in her seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and kits of needles.

loans.name: Espíritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Espíritu Santo es el comité formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas se formaron luego de haber oído hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas han asumido el compromiso de mantener reunido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo que todas las integrantes se merecen, actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo con calificación excelente.
Las miembros del comité se definen como mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras, todas ellas trabajan por el bien de sus familias. Sueñan con brindar a sus familias un mejor porvenir del que ellas tuvieron.
La Sra. Antonia tiene una bodega donde vende todo tipo de bebidas, mediante su negocio ha podido mantener a su familia y generar un poco más de ingresos. Su sueño es poder, algún día, ampliar su bodega ya que a veces tiene mucha demanda de bebidas y no tiene espacio suficiente.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas como vinos, cervezas, whiskys y demás tipo de bebidas para el abastecimiento del local.
texts.en:
The “Espíritu Santo” (Holy Spirit) Communal Bank is comprised of 16 women in the city of Paraguarí.  They formed the group after having heard talk about the enterprising women's program.  They have assumed the commitment of staying together and working with the mutual respect that all of the members deserve.  They are currently in their seventh cycle with excellent ratings.

The members of the communal bank can be defined as hard-working and tenacious women.  They all work for the good of their families.  The members dream of giving their families a better future than they had.

Antonio has a store where she sells all types of drinks.  Through her business she has been able to support her family and generate a little more income.  Her dream is to be able to one day expand her store.  Sometimes there is a lot of demand for drinks, and she does not have sufficient space.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks like wine, beer, whiskey, and other types of drinks to stock her place.

loans.use: to buy drinks like wine, beer, whiskey, and other types of drinks.

loans.name: Vicky Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicky de 38 años es una mujer que le encanta la pedagogía y por eso emprendió su actividad dirigida a ofrecerle a niños refuerzo escolar en las jornadas contrarias  en las que ellos estudian usualmente, para avanzarlos en su rendimiento académico. Vicky aprovechando su experiencia como docente, se ha dedicado a esta actividad en la que imprime mucho amor y sobre todo orden y disciplina en su estudio. Ella trabajaba en un colegio y cuando le entregaron su liquidación compró una vitrina para vender dulces y otras mercancías a los niños, y a los visitantes de un parque cercano al sitio donde está ubicada.  Su meta más adelante es adecuar su infraestructura para ampliar su cobertura de clientes que cada dia crecen . Esta es el motivo por el cual requiere su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el , comprará mesas y sillas además de surtir su vitrina con nuevos dulce, los que aspira a a comprar al por mayor  para obtener grandes descuentos. Su meta más adelante es instalarse en un espacio mucho más grande para lograr la comodidad total de sus estudiantes. Mientras esto ocurre, Vicky se esfuerza por lograr construir un capital con el cual, sus dos hijos,   hoy en las edades de 7 y 9 años, puedan en un futuro recibir una educación de calidad y potenciar su éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Vicky, 38, is a woman who loves education. This is why she undertook her work offering children academic support, which she does on a schedule that is opposite when they are usually in school. She does this in order to help them advance academically. Vicky takes advantage of her experience as a teacher and is dedicated to her work, which she carries out with great love and above all, with order and discipline. She used to work at a school and when she received her severance pay, she purchased a case for selling sweets and other merchandise to the children and to visitors to a nearby park.

Her long-term goal is to adapt her infrastructure in order to expand her number of customers, which is growing every day. This is the reason why she needs a credikiva. This is the first loan she will receive through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to purchase tables and chairs and stock her snack case with new sweets, which she would like to buy wholesale in order to receive greater discounts. Her greatest goal is to set herself up in a much larger space in order to make all of her students comfortable. At the same time, Vicky strives to build up enough capital so that her children (who are currently 7 and 9 years old) can receive a quality education and maximize their future success.

loans.use: to buy school chairs and tables and stock her store with sweets

loans.name: Bryan

texts.es:
Bryan es un hombre sencillo y pertenece a una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El necesita un préstamo por el monto de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones),  ya que se dedica a la agricultura por el tipo de zona en el que vive donde la mayoria trabaja en este campo. Bryan necesita este dinero para la compra de semilla de tubérculos, para así ofrecer gran variedad de producto a sus clientes en el momento de la cosecha.Y ademas Bryan destaca que su objetivo es aumentar sus ingresos económicos por medio de esta actividad agrícola, para así poder solventar todo gasto que se presente en su nucleo familiar para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
El pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A.
texts.en:
Bryan is a simple man who belongs to a community in the southern zone of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based in agricultural activities, especially raising tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and cattle.

He needs a loan in the amount of  ₡500,000 (five hundred thousand colones), as he works in the type of agriculture that is typical for his region, as do most of the people who live in the area. Bryan needs this money to purchase seeds for tubers so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers at harvest time. Furthermore, Bryan says that his goal is to increase his income through farming, so that he can meet all of the expenses faced by his immediate family, in order to offer them a better quality of life.

He belongs to the "La Danta S.A." communal bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds for tubers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elsy Orely

texts.en: Elsy lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she earns a living by making cheese and tortillas as well as selling freshly made food. She has a loyal customer base within her village and has seen her business grow. Elsy is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras to purchase ingredients for making cheese and cooking food.

loans.use: to purchase corn, tomatoes, peppers, onions, carrots, cucumbers, meat, milk, firewood, lime and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ganadoras Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Ganadoras” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre estos se encuentran repostería, venta de ropa, bisutería, criadero de gallinas, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Marcela quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha, donde la señalan los demás emprendedores. Se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 10 años. 
Adaptó una de las habitaciones de su casa como su taller, ahí cuenta con tres maquinas de coser, un mesón de corte y muebles para guardar sus insumos. 
Sus confecciones son de ropa, bolsos y accesorios, además realiza reparaciones de ropa. 
Su mercadería la compra en retacerías, en las ciudades de Santiago y Valparaíso.  
Con el crédito comprará un mueble que necesitaba para organizar su negocio, una repisa, cintas, telas, agujas, alfileres, entre otros. 
Sus metas en su negocio son realizar una línea de ropa y accesorios, que se encuentre disponible en el mercado mediante internet, a fines de éste año pretende concretar éste proyecto. Para esto ya cuenta con moldes y diseños.
Marcela vive junto a su novio y su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza ya que es muy asequible para emprendedores como ella. Respecto a las reuniones realizadas en el grupo del banco comunal, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias para su negocio y conocer otras experiencias de socias con sus respectivos negocios. Comenta que existe mucho compromiso por parte de las demás emprendedoras, tanto con sus negocios, como con el grupo. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ganadoras” (Winners) and has 18 members who are engaged in a variety of businesses among which are: pastry making, clothing sales, costume jewelry and raising chickens, among others.  All of them are from the city of Valparaíso.

Marcela, who in the photo is seated second from the left to the right, is being pointed out by the rest of the entrepreneurs.  She is a dressmaker; she’s been in this line of work for ten years.

She adapted one of the rooms in her house as her workshop.  She has three sewing machines there, a cutting table and furniture to store her supplies.

She makes clothes, purses and accessories as well as does clothing repairs.

She buys her merchandise in remnant shops in the cities of Santiago and Valparaíso.

She will use the loan to buy a piece of furniture she needs to organize her business, a shelf, ribbons, fabric, needles and pins, among others.

Her business goals are to fashion a line of clothing and accessories that can be made available to the market via Internet.  She plans to carry out this project at the end of this year.  She already has the patterns and designs for this.

Marcela lives with her boyfriend and her dream is to have a house of her own.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan that Fondo Esperanza granted her because it’s quite accessible for entrepreneurs like her.  With respect to the meetings that take place in the communal bank, they’ve been useful for her to learn new business strategies and to hear about the experiences of other members in their respective businesses.  She comments that the other entrepreneurs are quite committed both to their businesses and to the group.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and seat of the national legislative branch of government.  It is the nation’s main port and it has a variety of beautiful, picturesque places like the home of Nobel Prize winning poet, Pablo Neruda, for example.

loans.use: to buy a piece of furniture she needed to organize her business, a shelf, ribbons, fabric, needles and pins, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, chicken, pork, rice, carrots, green beans, banana leaves, shirts, pants, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Elvin David

texts.en: Elvin lives in Choluteca, Honduras with his wife and two children. For the past three years, he has run a small general store to earn a living. Elvin has requested a loan of Lps. 12,000 to purchase merchandise for his store. In his free time, Elvin raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, condiments, lard, cooking oil, eggs, bread, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, light bulbs, fumigation products, and vitamin products, among others.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos es estudios. Tiene educación primaria.
La señora Angélica es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de frazadas.  Con este dinero comprará 100 Kgs. de lana de todo color para la elaboración de frazadas, las que vende en la ciudad de Puno y Yunguyo.
En el negocio trabaja sola, su mamá le ayuda a cuidar a sus hijos menores y su esposo trabaja de chofer en una empresa de servicio urbano.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y un carro para  transporte urbano.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the “Niño Jesús de Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 36 years old, has a spouse and four children in school.  She went to elementary school.

Angélica is a new member who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She will ask for a 500 new sol loan to invest in her blanket weaving business.  She will use the money to buy 100 kilograms of wool in assorted colors to make the blankets which she sells in the cities of Puno and Yunguyo.

She works alone.  Her mother helps care for her younger children and her husband works as a driver for an urban transportation service provider.

Her dream is to have a good house and a car for urban transport.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 100 kilograms of wool in assorted colors.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is a single mother who lives in the province of Valle, Honduras with her nine year-old son. She earns a living by selling freshly-squeezed orange juice and a local crepe-like dish called a baleada. Esmeralda sells her food near the border between Honduras and El Salvador where there is always a lot of traffic. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 in order to purchase ingredients for making orange juice and baleadas.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, sugar, cornmeal, beans, cheese, eggs, and avocados.

loans.name: Hermes Francisco

texts.es:
Hermes  es un hombre emprendedor vecino de la zona de Pital, de San Carlos, esto en la provincia de Alajuela.  Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país.
El está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de  ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), esto con el fin de sacar a su familia adelante y darle una mejor calidad de vida, por medio de la siembra de piña esto por ser una zona donde se presenta mayormente la actividad agrícola, la cual da bienestar y solidez a las familias de la zona.  Es por esto mismo que Hermes espera que todo le salga bien y para poder ahorrar dinero de todo lo que produzca y coseche con esta siembra para darle el mejor producto a sus clientes, y un techo digno y una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
Hermes pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La trinchera, una de las 110 empresas existentes en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Hermes is an enterprising man who lives near the Pital zone of San Carlos in the Alajuela province.  There is a lot of tourism here since the Arenal volcano is nearby, as well as the cloud forest of Monteverde and the lowlands of the north of the country.

He is requesting a loan of ₡500,000  (five hundred thousand colons) with the goal of pushing his family ahead and giving them a better quality of life.  Since this is an area where there is a lot of agriculture, he will grow pineapple, and thus help the welfare and stability of his family.  That is why Hermes hopes that all comes out well, and that he can save money from what he produces and harvests by giving higher quality products to his customers.  This will help him give a good home and a better standard of living to his wife.

Hermes belongs to the Empresa  communal bank called La Trinchera, one of 100 such businesses in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To grow pineapple

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora es una mujer alegre y amable, tiene 51 años, está casada  con León de 55 años, con quien tuvo 10 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con Silvia, Leo y Analí, todos viven en la tranquilidad de su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Palca. La vida para ella no fue fácil, pero hasta ahora sigue luchando por salir adelante. Ya recuperada de una enfermedad que la mantuvo en cama varios meses Dora cuenta que le gusta mucho alimentar a sus animales, principalmente a las vacas que cría para poder elaborar los ricos quesos. Además nos comenta, que con la producción de 20 litros de leche, obtiene una ganancia de S/. 300 nuevos soles.  Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa y diferentes verduras muy solicitadas en el mercado desde hace 34 años con la ayuda de sus hijos, de esta actividad recibe buenas ganancias económicas que le permite brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, sin preocupación alguna. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el trasporte público, así trae un dinero extra al hogar. Con los años de experiencia que tiene desea para más adelante sembrar follajes en mayor cantidad en busca de calidad. Es por eso que después de la cosecha de zanahoria comenzará con la siembra de culantro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Dora de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en:
Dora is a cheerful, kind woman.  She’s 51 years old, married to León, 55, and has ten children but only Silvia, Leo and Analí still live with her.  They all live together in peace in their own house located in the hamlet of Palca.  

Life for her has not been easy but she continues to struggle to get ahead.  Now recovered from an illness that kept her bedridden for several months
Dora comments that she very much enjoys feeding her animals, especially the cows she raises to make delicious cheese.  She also comments that with the production of 20 liters of milk she earns a 300 new sol profit.  In addition, she has been farming potatoes and various other vegetables that are in high demand in the market for the last 34 years with help from her children.  She earns good profits from this activity too that allow her to provide her family with an adequate quality of life free of worries.

Her husband, who works as driver providing public transportation services, earns extra money for the home.  With the years of experience she’s had she’d like to plant foliage in larger amounts seeking quality.  Because of this, once the carrot harvest is in she will start planting coriander.

She belongs to the “Santo Domingo” communal bank and this is the 7th loan with MFP where she hopes for support from all of you to meet her goals.  Besides, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  

If Dora were to receive your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer for her next planting of potatoes of the “yungay” type.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 68 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Se dedica a la venta D. carne, dice que venD. en un mercado D. la zona.  Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprar seis degollados D. cordero, lo compra D. las ferias D. la localidad y lo venD. en el mercado, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos..
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las utilidades generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en:
Petrona is a member of the “Niño Jesús D. Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 68 years old, married and has six children, all independent.  She never went to school.

She sells meat; she says she sells in a local market.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two cycles.
