loans.name: Olaya Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

En este lugar conocimos La señora Olaya, Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian en colegio. Su esposo es agente vendedor.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en la cual vende cervezas, sodas, aguas y  tarjetas telefónicas. Hace poco también se está dedicando a la venta de ropa por catalogo el mismo que lo hace en su local y a veces también sale a vender a domicilio, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 21h00. Ella  nos cuenta que lleva en sus negocios el mismo tiempo que lleva en el Banco y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cervezas, colas, aguas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque los intereses son bajos.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of Bellavista in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Olaya. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children (ages 17, 15, and 12) who are high school students. Her husband is a sales representative.

Olaya has a small business in her home where she sells beer, sodas, water, and phone cards. She also spends a little bit of time selling clothes through catalogs, which she makes available in her store. Sometimes she will sell from her home. Olaya works every day from 7am to 9pm. She says that she can manage all of her businesses at the same time and still be part of the Communal Bank. She has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy beer, sodas, water, trousers, blouses, shirts, and other items. Olaya is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys being part of her group because of the additional benefits Fundación ESPOIR provides and the low interest rates. Her dream is to see her children receive a good education and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase beer, sodas, water, trousers, blouses, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Elsie has a general store business and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business.

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y aún viven con ella. Su esposo es médico veterinario y trabaja en la Universidad Laica en Manta.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque comenta que también sus clientes llegan hasta su casa a comprar los productos los mismos que deja a  crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Sus productos lo que es ropa y zapatos los compra en Guayaquil y lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa.  Lleva más de ocho años con esta actividad y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos  son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of Bellavista in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Fátima. She is 55 years old, married, and has two grown children who still live with her and attend university. Her husband is a veterinarian and works at Laica University in Manta.

Fátima is a homemaker who earns her own income by selling clothes, shoes, and products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three day a week and generates sales by going door-to-door. Fátima says her customers also come to her house to buy the products, which she offers on credit and then collects payment weekly or every 15 days. She buys the clothing and shoes in Guayaquil and the Yanbal products are shipped to her house. Fátima has been in business for more than eight years and has always done well because she has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and shoes. This is her fifth loan with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the loans are easy to obtain. Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Genny Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos. Cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco  Comunal Bellavista.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Genny, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijas las mismas que ya son mayores de edad y estudian en la Universidad, todas viven en su casa. Su marido vende pollos..

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio. Ellos compran pollos pequeños en Portoviejo para luego trasladarlos hasta otras ciudades,  entregan en granjas y criaderos de pollos. Ellos viajan todos los jueves en la madrugada, ponen los pollos en gavetas, los embarcan en el carro y empiezan su recorrido hacia la provincia del Guayas y Machala que es donde realizan sus ventas.  Además de pollos también venden cubetas plásticas para poner huevos, las cuales entregan en las grajas. Nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ellos son muy conocidos en todos estos lugares y que tienen muchos clientes ya que son más de 15 años que están dedicados a esta actividad.

Este nuevo crédito lo van a invertir en adquirir más pollos y cubetas para huevos. Es  socia  del Banco Comunal desde que se inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben de la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijas sean  profesionales
texts.en:
The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of Bellavista in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

The staff of Fundación ESPOIR spoke with Sra. Genny. She is 43 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three grown daughters who are university students. They all live at home. Her husband sells chickens.

Genny is an excellent homemaker and manages the family business with her husband. They buy small chickens in Portoviejo and transport them to poultry farms and chicken farmers in other cities. Every Thursday at dawn, Genny and her husband load the chickens in crates and transport them by car. The journey begins in the province of Guayas and concludes in Machala, where they conduct their sales. In addition to chickens, they also sell plastic cartons for holding eggs and deliver them to the poultry farms. Genny says that she is well-known in all of these places and has many customers. She has been in business for more than 15 years.

This new loan will be invested in more chickens and egg cartons. Genny has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the support she has received from Fundación ESPOIR. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to see her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and egg cartons.

loans.name: Mercedes Aurora

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16, 13 Y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para su negocio y su vida personal.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la venta de de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas tanto nacionales como extranjeras. Además de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos Yanbal los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que empezó por la necesidad que tenia de ganar algo propio y como no había trabajo empezó con su negocio que en la actualidad le deja buenos ingresos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Mercedes. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 13, and 8). The two older children are in high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a merchant. Mercedes has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have been very important to her business and for her personal life.

She is an excellent homemaker who also sells clothing through catalogs of various national and foreign brands. In addition, Mercedes sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week. The Yanbal products are shipped to her house and she acquires the clothing from a distributor. Mercedes has been in business for four years and has done very well. She says that she started her business out of necessity because she had to earn her own income. Since she did not have a job, she decided to start this business and now earns a good income.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing of all types. Her dream is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Lourdes Mireya

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lourdes, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es estilista. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Ella para ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener el hogar hace varios años se dedica a realizar trabajos tanto de costura como de pintado de uñas.  También se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y productos naturales. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, en su casa y en el salón de belleza que tiene su marido, trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades, nos cuenta que lleva tres años con sus ventas y en sus trabajos de belleza y costura mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, bisutería y productos naturales.  Este es el segundo ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lourdes. She is 30 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children (ages 11, 10, 7, and 2). The three older children are in school. Her husband is a stylist. Lourdes learned sewing and dressmaking at an academy in the city of Portoviejo.

To help her husband with the difficult task of maintaining their home, Lourdes has worked several years taking in sewing jobs as well as painting nails. She also works as a merchant. Lourdes sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories) as well as natural products. She sells this merchandise by going door-to-door, offering them from home, or by displaying them at her husband’s salon. Lourdes works every day in all of her businesses. She has been selling merchandise for three years and has been sewing and painting nails for much longer.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, accessories, and natural products. She is participating in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. Her dream is to open a large sewing workshop.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, accessories, and natural products.

loans.name: Josefa Alegria

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefa, tiene 50 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tienen  dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven en su casa. Ella es licenciada en enfermería y trabaja en el IESS (Instituto Ecuatoriano de Bienestar Social).

Además de trabajar de enfermera también se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días tanto en su  trabajo como en sus ventas, nos cuenta que una vez que ella sale de su trabajo se va a visitar a sus clientes y también  vende en su lugar de trabajo. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva  4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien, nos dice que le encantan las ventas y además gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.  Este es el quinto ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño  seguir adelante en su trabajo y en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Josefa. She is 50 years old, divorced, and has two grown children who still live with her at home. Josefa is a licensed nurse and works for IESS (Ecuadorian Institute of Social Welfare).

In addition to her job as a nurse, Josefa also works as a merchant. She sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Josefa works every day, both at her job and in her sales business. She says that as soon as she leaves for work, she visits with her customers and also sells products where she works as a nurse. Josefa offers her products on credit and collects payment every 15 days. She has been in business for four years and has done very well. Josefa says that she enjoys selling and earning extra money.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories. She is receiving her fifth loan from the Communal Bank and enjoys the services provided by Fundación ESPOIR. Her dream is to move forward in her job and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es natural de Huancas, toda su vida ha vivido en su tierra natal y hoy en día a sus 50 años  vive al lado de su esposo y su  hijo. Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, sus cultivos principales son trigo, papa, cebada, arveja y maíz; así como también cría vacas y toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. Cuando llega la temporada de cosecha, sus compradores mayoristas son quienes la buscan en su misma chacra para comprar todo lo que ha producido. Así se genera las ganancias y se ahorra el gasto de transporte hacia el mercado central de su ciudad. Durante este tiempo, ella y su esposo han visto que  es una buena opción el trabajo que realizan, pues las dificultades fueron superadas a lo largo de los años, logrando cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y por ello seguirá trabajando con mayor ahínco para mejorar su calidad de vida. Lleva varios años trabajando de manera grupal con MFP y siempre ha demostrado su responsabilidad frente a los créditos e impulsa esta misma actitud con sus demás compañeros de su grupo comunal, porque tiene como experiencia el logro de una buena inversión de los créditos. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en el alquiler de terrenos de cultivo en zona de riego donde sembrará verduras.
texts.en: Carmen is originally from Huanca. She has lived in her birthplace her entire life and today, at 50 years of age, she lives with her husband and her son. She has worked in agriculture and cattle farming since she was 20 years old. Her primary cultivations are of wheat, potatoes, barley, peas, and corn. She also raises cows and bulls to sell them at the livestock fairs. At the time of the harvest her wholesale buyers come to her fields to purchase everything that was produced. This is how she generates an income for herself and she is able to save on the transportation costs associated with the trip to the central market of the city. She and her husband have realized that their business is a good field of work especially because the difficulties they have encountered throughout the years have been overcome and because they have managed to improve the quality of their life. She has been working with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) for many years and she has always demonstrated responsibility with her loans and she inspires the same attitude among the other members of the group. She has earned the experience of a successful loan investment. This time she will invest her loan in the renting farm land in an irrigation region where she will plant vegetables.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land.

loans.name: Oscar Walter

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a don Oscar, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y tres están en colegio y escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.

Para ganarse la vida y que a su familia no le falte nada él se dedica a diversas actividades, por las tardes y noches se dedica a conducir un taxi y en las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja  en su casa. Compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños, los cría de dos a tres  meses y luego los vende en pie a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o por libras a los vecinos y a  tiendas de la localidad, dice que sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día, en la actualidad compro otro terreno y allí espera construir otro galpón para meter más pollos.
p>
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales de construcción para construir otro galpón y así tener capacidad para meter el doble de pollos de lo que en la actualidad tiene. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque con los créditos cada dia va aumentando su producción.
  
Su sueño es  tener  una granja  más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "Amor y Felicidad, meaning "Love and Happiness" meets every two weeks in sector known as El Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi which has been known for many years at the city of the true tamarinds.

Here we meet Oscar. He is 47 years old, married common-law, and he has 5 children, two of whom are grown and three are in school. His wife is a merchant.

He takes on various activities to earn a living and not have his family want for anything. IN the afternoons and the evenings he drives a taxi and in the morning she raises poultry from a small coop on his property. He buys boxes of chicks and he raises them for two or three months. He later sells them to merchants who come to his house or as butchered meat to the neighbors and neighborhood stores. He says that his poultry sells quickly because he feeds them corn, producing meat that is similar to Creole poultry. He works every day two or three hours per day. He purchased another plot of land where he hopes to build another coop from where to raise more poultry.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to build another coop, to double the number of poultry from what he has now. He has been with his communal bank since its inception and he appreciates it for the loans that help him increase production daily.

His dream is to have a larger farm.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials with which to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: María Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos. Cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco  Comunal San Valentín.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 28 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, el mayor esta en colegio y la menor en jardín de infantes. Su marido es agente vendedor.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos de hogar todos los días por las tardes se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y hot dog, tiene una carreta en la cual vende sus bocadillos, trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por más de cuatro años y que le va muy bien. En ocasiones o casi todos los sabados se desplaza hasta lugares donde organizan bailes ya que allí vende muchos de sus productos y se queda hasta más tarde en la noche.

Este crédito es para comprar pan, carne molida, salchichas, sodas, entre otras cosas necesarias en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "San Valentin" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo. It is the capital city of Manabi and for many years it has been known as the city of the true tamarinds.

Maria is the founding member of the communal bank and she is the payment official. She appreciates it because the interest rates are lower from other lending institutions. She is 28 years old and she is married common law. She has two children, aged 11 and 4. The eldest is in school and the youngest is in kindergarten. Her husband is a sales agent.

She is a very good house wife and she helps her husband with the household expenses. Every day in the afternoon she sells hamburgers and hot dogs. She has a cart from where she sells her snacks, working every day from 3pm to 8pm. She tells us that she has been in business for more than four years and it has gone very well. On special occasions and almost every Saturday she relocates to where dances are being held because she is able to sell many of her products and she even stays until later at night. 

The loan is to purchase bread, ground meat, sausages, soft drinks, and other necessary products for her business.

Her dream is to have a large restaurant from where to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase bread, ground meat, sausages, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: María Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos. Cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco  Comunal San Valentín.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad  los mismos que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es Abogado.
 
Ella para ganarse algo propio y sentirse útil se dedica a la venta de  ropa, carteras y zapatos,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan cada vez que tiene mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la envían desde los Estados Unidos o si no compra en el país pero productos Norteamericanos. Lleva cinco  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos, carteras y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y agradables.
 
Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de ropa o una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "San Valentin" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo. It is the capital city of Manabi and for many years it has been known as the city of the true tamarinds.

Here we meet Maria. She is 36 years old and she is married common-law. She has two children, aged 15 and 6 and they are both in school. Her husband is a lawyer.

She sells clothing, wallets, and shoes to earn her own money and to feel employed. She sells from door to door although the majority of her sales take place from her home. Her clients visit each time there is a new arrival of merchandise. She works every day and she completes her sales on credit, collecting payments every two weeks. She has her merchandise shipped from the United States or she buys from within the country, but choosing only North American products. She has been in business for five years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes, wallets, and all types of clothing. She has been with her communal bank since its start and she enjoys especially because her colleagues are very responsible and friendly.

Her dream is to have a clothing distribution center or a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, wallets, and clothing.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja vive en su tierra natal con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de su familia. Tiene 15 años de experiencia compartida con su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, cultivan primordialmente papa, trigo y cebada, junto con su esposo  comparten estas arduas tareas tanto en la época de siembra y cosecha. De esta manera  cuando se recoge la cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias  sin intermediarios que por lo general  pagan un precio que no compensa el gran esfuerzo. Maruja  y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas por lo que aumentaran su  producción viendo las posibilidades de adquirir terrenos propios y arrendados que les servirá para expandir su siembra. Se admira del tiempo de permanencia del trabajo con MFP, que a través de su banco comunal ya suman 10 oportunidades de crédito en las cuales ha mantenido su integridad  de puntualidad en sus pagos e inculca esta misma actitud a los demás miembros de su grupo. Con el dinero comprará semillas y será una cuota del pago de un terreno que esta comprando.
texts.en:
Maruja lives in her birthplace together with her husband and her children in a family home. She shares her 15 years' experience in agricultural work with her husband. Basically they cultivate potatoes, wheat, and barley. She shares this arduous work with her husband both during the planting state and during the harvest. this way when the harvest is collected from their cultivation it is sold directly to the merchants in the central market of the city. This is how they earn better earnings without middlemen who generally pay a price that is not commensurate with the great effort. Maruja and her husband wish to continue with their work. They will increase their production When they see the opportunity to acquire their own land and rent other land with an expanded plantation.

She is impressed with the time she has been with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). It was through her communal bank that she has had 10 past opportunities to access a loan. She has maintained her payment history with integrity and she inspires the same attitude in the other members of the group. With these funds she will purchase seeds and she will make one payment on a plot of land she is in the process of buying.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to make the first payment of a plot of agricultural land that she is buying.

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Súper Bankito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive su hija menor que es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años. Su esposo es mecánico pero ya no trabaja por motivos de enfermedad.

Nuestra amiga sufre de discapacidad pero esto no le impide ganarse sus sustento diario, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. el nombre de su tienda es “Mini Marquet Mechita “allí   trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, su esposo trabaja con ella y su hija cuando no está ocupada también  le ayudan en su trabajo.  Nos cuenta que  lleva más de 30 años con su tienda  y le va muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren porque en su local encuentran de todo y sobre todo una muy buena atención.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the Super Bankito community bank meet every fornight in the citadel of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of Los Reales Tamarindos since colonial times. 

Here we meet Mercedes, 58 years old, who is married with five children, all of them grown up. Her youngest daughter, who is a single mother of a girl of 4, lives with her. Mercedes' husband is a mechanic but he no longer works due to an illness. 

Mercedes is disabled, but this doesn't prevent her from earning a living. She owns a grocery store which she runs from her home. She sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.. The name of her store is "Mini Marquet Mechita". She works there every day from 6am to 10pm. Her husband works with her and her daughter also helps whenever she isn't busy. She says she's had her shop for over 30 years and things are going well.Her customers prefer her shop because they can find everything and above all get a very good service. 

She's planning to use the credit to buy more stock for her shop. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats and other staples. She's been with her community bank for 5 cycles and she enjoys it because she's made friends within the group. 

Her goals are for her business to get ahead and her store to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats and other staples.

loans.name: Grace Eulalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Súper Bankito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grace, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de  18, 16 y 11 años de edad, las dos menores estudian en colegio, la mayor este año termino el colegio y espera ingresar a la universidad muy pronto. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una buena ama de casa que también realiza trabajos domésticos en una casa en la ciudad. Realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual él pone de martes  a domingo un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, trabaja desde las 4h00 hasta las 18h00 ya que muy temprano él se desplaza al mercado o hasta las playas de Manta para comprar el pescado y tener lo mejor para ofrecer a sus clientes, nos cuenta que por épocas las ventas son muy buenas así como también en otras bajan por los tiempos de veda de este producto. El lleva tres años en este negocio y le va bastante bien.
 
Este crédito es para  comprar pescado para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudar a su esposo y su familia.

Su sueño es ver que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The community bank Bankito Super meets fortnightly in the citadel of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of Los Reales Tamarindos since colonial times.

Here we meet Grace, 37, who is married with three daughters aged 18, 16 and 11. The youngest two go to school and the eldest has finished school and is hoping to start university very soon. Grace's husband is a trader. As well as a good housewife, she also does some housework at a house in the city. She is requesting the loan for her husband, who sells fish in a market stall from Tuesday to Sunday. He works from 4am to 6pm, and he goes to the market or to the beaches in Manta to buy the fish very early so he has the best produce to offer his customers. She says that depending on the season the sales can be very good, although they decrease out of season. He has been in this line of business for three years and the business is going quite well. 

The loan is to buy fish to sell in the market. She has been with the community bank for 3 cycles and she enjoys it because with the loans she can help her husband and her family. 

Her dream is to see her daughters have a career.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Digna Viviana

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Viviana tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 12, 5 y 2 años, los mayores  estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su marido es profesor de un colegio de la ciudad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la actual tesorera del banco y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y le facilitan su labor como tesorera.

Ella para ganarse algo propio y con el fin de lograr un mejor futuro para su familia hace seis años empezó con su negocio de imprenta y papelería, después aumento lo que es  trabajos en computadoras, en su negocio también vende útiles escolares, libros y otros materiales que los estudiantes utilizan para su aprendizaje. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00, en esto  le ayudan su mamá, su hermano y su esposo cuando este está desocupado, también realizan trabajos de mantenimiento de computadoras en su local.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más útiles escolares, papel, tinta, entre otras cosas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Viviana is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has three children aged 12, 5 and 2.  Her eldest are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a teacher in a school in the city.  Viviana has been a member of her community bank from the start and is currently the bank's treasurer.  She likes it because her fellow members are very responsible and they make her job as treasurer easier.

In order to earn her own money and achieve a better future for her family, six years ago Viviana started her own printing and stationery business.  She then also added a service typing documents on a computer.  In her business she also sells school supplies, books and other materials that students use in their studies.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.  Her mom and brother help her in her business, as does her husband when he has time free.  They also do computer maintenance work on their premises.

Viviana will use this loan to buy more school supplies, paper, ink, etc.  Her dreams are to continue to get ahead in her business and to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Angela Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella  junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de producción y venta de helados. Trabajan todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 17h00, ella en las mañanas se encarga de fabricar los deliciosos helados de distintos sabores,  luego su esposo sale a vender en un carro  por la localidad y también se desplaza hasta los campos donde sus helados son muy apreciados y apetecidos, también en su casa vende sus helados. Además de esto por las tardes pone un pequeño local en el cual vende  meriendas, allí prepara platos al gusto de sus clientes que llegan en gran número a su pequeño local. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio  20 años y que a pesar de la competencia les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, saborizantes y víveres para preparar las meriendas. Ella está en el Banco Comunal hace ya nueve años y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez que los reciben salen adelante y aumentan su producción.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Here we meet 55 year-old Angela who is married and has four children who are all now adults.  Two of them still live in her home.  Her husband is a salesman.

Together with her husband, Angela owns a business making and selling iced treats.  They work every day, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  In the mornings, Angela takes charge of making the delicious iced treats in different flavors, then her husband goes out to sell them in town.  He also travels to the countryside where their iced treats are very much appreciated and enjoyed.  They also make sales from their home.

In addition to this work, in the afternoons Angela sets up small premises where she sells afternoon meals.  She makes dishes to please her customers who arrive at her small premises in large numbers.  She tells us that she and her husband have been in this business for 20 years and, in spite of the competition, things are going very well.

Angela will use this loan to buy sugar, flavorings and food products for preparing her afternoon meals.  She has been a member of her community bank for nine years now and she likes it because every time she receives a loan she gets ahead and increases her production. 

Angela's dreams are to continue working and enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavorings and food products

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la tiene  dos hijos de 2 y de 1 año. Su marido ameniza fiestas pues tiene un disco móvil.

Ella para ganarse sus propios recursos y lograr algo por si misma emprendió hace seis años su propio negocio, nuestra amiga tiene un bar en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, en el cual  vende variedad de bocadillos o comida rápida, lo que más vende son los ceviches, el pan de almidón, empanadas, yogurt granizado, colas, refrescos, café y té. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 y de 17h00 hasta las 20h30 y los sábados solo de mañana. Ella aprovecha que su mamá les cuida a sus pequeños hijos para ella dedicarse a su trabajo que es muy sacrificado pero tiene que hacerlo para darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar ceviches, sodas, pan, empanadas, yogurt entre otros  productos que ella vende en su bar. Es  parte del Banco Comunal hace cinco ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde vende es alquilado y tiene que pagar una mensualidad a la Universidad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Here we meet 27 year-old María who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 2 and 1.  Her husband works making parties more enjoyable as he owns a mobile disco.

In order to earn her own money and achieve something for herself, six years ago María started her own business.  Our friend has a snack bar in the Universidad Técnica de Manabí where she sells a variety of sandwiches and fast food.  What she sells most of are 'ceviches' (a seafood dish), cassava bread, empanadas, iced yoghurt, cola, soft drinks, coffee and tea.  María works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 11.00am and then from 5.00pm to 8.30pm.  On Saturdays, she only works in the morning.  She makes the most of the fact that her mom looks after her young children in order to carry out her work which is very demanding but which she has to do in order to provide her children with a good future.

María will use this loan to buy 'ceviches', sodas, bread, empanadas, yoghurt and other products that she sells in her snack bar.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because of the ease with which she can obtain loans and for the help which she receives from the loans.

María's dream is to own her own premises since she currently rents her premises and has to pay a monthly fee to the university.

loans.use: to buy 'ceviches', sodas, bread, empanadas, yoghurt, etc.

loans.name: Blanca  Filerma

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Blanca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero la menor  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes pues son de muy buena calidad y son muy apreciados por sus clientes. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Blanca is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than those offered by other loan institutions.  Blanca is 62 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has five grown-up children from her relationship.  Her youngest still lives with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Blanca is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own income, sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door and works three days a week.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that what she sells most of are the perfumes because they are very good quality and her customers like them a lot.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.

Blanca will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

Blanca's dream is to continue getting ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Vicenta Aida

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solo la ultima que es menor de edad es quien vive en su casa y estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos y chanchos, compra los pollos pequeños en Portoviejo en una incubadora y los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y con buen peso, luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar tanto a los pollos como a los chanchos o si no los lleva a entregar en las tiendas del lugar. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado de sus animalitos unas tres horas por día pero cuando tiene que vender los pollos a veces trabaja todo el dia, nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y le va bien a pesar de que a veces ha tenido pérdidas pero ha sabido seguir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar pollos, alimento  y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Este es su segundo ciclo y está muy a gusto con la institución ya que dice le han ayudado mucho.
 
Su sueño es que su familia goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Vicenta who is 56 years old, married, and has six children from this relationship.  Five of them are now adults and independent; only the last child is a minor living in their home and studying at school.  Her husband dedicates himself to farming. 

She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs.  She buys the chicks in Portoviejo in an incubator, and cares for them for about two to three months until they are ready and at a good weight.  Later, she gives them to merchants who go to her house to buy both the chickens and pigs and, other times, she takes them to the stores in the area.  She works every day caring for her little animals for about three hours per day however, when she has to sell the chickens, she sometimes works all day.  She tells us she has been in business for more than 15 years and things have gone well despite a few losses, but she has known how to continue forward.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicine so they will develop well.  This is her second cycle, and she is very happy with the institution as she states it has helped her a great deal.

Her dream is for her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: buy chickens, feed and medicines for animals.

loans.name: Ivonne Del Rocío

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ivogne, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 21, 16 y 10 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en Universidad y los otros en  colegio, todos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es Ing. Civil.

Ella es una gran esposa y ama de casa que junto a  su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, aceites, lubricantes y llantas, tiene un local en su casa el cual junto a sus hijos y su esposo cuando este no esta ocupado en sus obras atienden, nos cuenta que son más de 20 años que tienen este negocio y que poco a poco  a crecido a base de mucho trabajo y ahora es uno de los mejores almacenes de repuestos de sus localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites y todo tipo de repuestos para automóviles. Lleva dos ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y amigables.
 
Sus sueños es seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Ivogne who is 42 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship ages 22, 21, 16 and 10.  The two older children are studying at the University, and the others are in school and still living with her.  Her husband is a Civil Engineer.

She is a great mother and homemaker and, together with her husband, dedicates herself to commerce.  They have a business selling car replacement parts, oils, lubricants and tires.  It is located in their house and she tends it along with her children and husband when he’s not busy with his tasks.  She tells us she’s had the business for more than 20 years and that, little by little, it has grown with a great deal of hard work.  It is now one of the best replacement parts stores in the locality.

This loan is for the purchase of tires, oils, and all types of replacement parts for cars.  She has two cycles with the cooperative bank, and likes it because her associates are very united and friendly.

Her dreams are to continue growing her business and for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: buy tires, oils, and replacement parts for cars.

loans.name: Kathy Gioconda

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Katty, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 5 años, la mayor este año termino el colegio pero no pudo ingresar a la universidad y los otros estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es maestro de un colegio de la localidad.
 
Ella como mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante hace varios años se decidió a la venta de productos Sayson (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería) y hace más de un año también empezó a vender carteras y lo hace al mismo tiempo que realiza sus otras ventas, nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días y que sus productos los  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella  aprovecha las ofertas para comprar más barato y luego vende al precio real con lo cual se gana un dinero extra.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y carteras. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y  le gusta  por las charlas que le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Katty, 38 years of age and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children ages 17, 15, 14 and 5.  The oldest finished school this year but wasn’t able to enroll at the university, and the others are still in school.  Her husband is a teacher at a school in the area.

She is a very hard-working woman and, due to her great desire to get ahead, she decided to sell Sayson products (beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry).  About a year ago, she also started selling purses, which she does at the same time she’s selling her other products.  She tells us that she works every day and that she delivers her products on credit and charges every fifteen days.  She takes advantage of offers to buy more cheaply and then sell at retail with which she earns extra money.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and purses.  She has been in the cooperative bank for three cycles, and she enjoys it because the discussions help her a lot in her daily life.

Her goal is to continue forward with her sales.

loans.use: buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and purses.

loans.name: Lucia Patricia

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro de una escuela de la localidad.

Ella además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa también dedica su tiempo a realizar una actividad productiva, ella tiene una pequeña fábrica de chifles en su casa, trabaja todos los días y a veces contrata a una persona para que le ayude en la producción de sus productos y también su esposo le ayuda cuando termina su jornada laboral, nos cuenta que lo que produce lo venden en el mismo dia ya que a mas de vender en su fábrica también entrega a distintas cevicherias y picanterías del cantón. Lleva 7 años en su negocio y que le va bastaste bien.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, aceite y sal para preparar los chifles. Este es su segundo ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios con que cuenta en el grupo. 

Sus sueños son que su empresa sea mucho más grande y tener más maquinarias para producir mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo (May 24th) canton (smaller region within a province) is located in the Manabí province and this is where the San Jose communal bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful landscapes and hard-working people who work in agriculture and raising animals.

Here we met Patricia.  She is 33-years-old, married, and has two children from this relationship who are six and 12-years-old.  The oldest is in school.  Her husband is a teacher in the region.

In addition to being a very good mother and wife, she also dedicates her time to productive activities.  She has a small plantain chip factory in her house where she works every day and sometimes hires someone to help her producing her products.  Her husband also helps her when he finishes his work day.  She tells us that what she produces is sold the same day because as well as selling from her factory she also delivers to different bars and restaurants in the canton.  She has had this business for seven years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy plantains, oil, and salt to prepare the plantain chips.  This is her second loan cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the group has.  

Her dream is that her business be much bigger and that it have more machines to produce in greater quantity.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Angela Moserrate

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras se llevan muy bien y son como una familia. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 11 y 7 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro tapizador.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse algo y así contribuir con los gastos de su familia se dedica a realizar los quehaceres domésticos en una casa de su ciudad, pero además también nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha los momentos que tiene libre para ofrecer sus productos y que tiene gran cantidad de clientes ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y además porque les da facilidades de pago.  Lleva más de tres años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien a pesar de la crisis que golpea a nuestro país.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo Canton is found in Manabí Province.  The San José communal bank meets here.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard working people who are farmers and who raise livestock.

Ángela is a founding member of the communal bank.  She’s its financial overseer and likes it because all her fellow members get along real well with each other and are like a family.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children who are 16, 13, 11 and 7 years old.  The three oldest are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband is a master upholsterer.

She is a great housewife who, in order to generate income and contribute to her family’s expenses, works as a domestic employee in a house in the city but in addition, our friend is also a merchant.  She sells all sorts of clothes door to door and based on prior orders.  She tells us that she takes advantage of her free time to offer her products and that she has a large number of customers since her products are of good quality and also because of the easy payment plans she gives them.  She’s been in commerce for over three years and has done well despite the crisis the country is undergoing.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, viven por el cantón Sigsig, este cantón es muy visitado por la belleza de sus paisajes y por su naturaleza, la mayoría de su gente se dedica a fabricar sombreros de paja toquilla, también trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y con una gran hospitalidad.
 
Doña María tiene 36 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 15 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo transporte pesado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María tiene una tienda de comestible en la que trabaja hace 6 años, su tienda la atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. También desde muy niña se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, embutidos, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Toquilleras Communal Bank.  The members live in the Sigsig canton.  This canton is frequently visited for it beautiful scenery and its landscape.  Most of its inhabitants make panama hats.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  They are very amiable and hospitable people.

María, age, 36 is married and has three children.  They children are 16, 15, and 9 years old.  The first two are in high school, and her last daughter attends a school in the area.  Her husband is a driver, and he works driving heavy transport.  Through their joint efforts they have managed to build their own house.

María has a grocery store, and she has worked there for six years.  She tends to the store from six in the morning until ten at night.  Also, she has been making panama hats since she was a young girl.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, sausages, detergent, and other basic needs items.  She will do this to stock her business more.

Her goal is to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, oil, sausages, detergent, and other basic needs items.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, viven por el cantón  Sigsig, este cantón  es muy visitado por la belleza de sus paisajes y por su naturaleza, la mayoría de su gente se dedica a fabricar sombreros de paja toquilla, también trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y con una gran hospitalidad.
 
La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 18 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, sus dos últimas hijas estudian en un colegio del lugar. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y en el área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica desde muy joven a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en el cantón de Gualaceo. También se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla ya que esta actividad aprendió desde muy joven y en su casa también vende todo tipo de ropa.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un almacén para vender la ropa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Toquilleras Communal Bank.  The members live in the Sigsig canton.  This canton is frequently visited for it beautiful scenery and its landscape.  Most of its inhabitants make panama hats.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  They are very amiable people who are very hospitable.

María, age, 59 is married and has three children.  They children are 26, 18, and 14 years old.  Her first daughter is married and independent.  The last two daughters go to high school in the area.  Her husband works in agriculture and as a bricklayer in construction.  Through their joint efforts they have managed to build their own house.

María has raised chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs since she was a young girl.  She sells them in the Gualaceo canton.  She also makes panama hats, which she learned how to do when she was very young.  She also sells all types of clothes.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes in order to stock her business.

Her goal is to have a store to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Julia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, viven por el cantón  Sigsig, este cantón  es muy visitado por la belleza de sus paisajes y por su naturaleza, la mayoría de su gente se dedica a fabricar sombreros de paja toquilla, también trabajan en la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y con una gran hospitalidad. 

Doña Julia tiene 44 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 24, 22, 21, 18, 15, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo y tercer hijo son casados e independientes, su hijo de 18 años está estudiando en un colegio del sector, su hijo de 15 años trabaja ya que no le gusta el estudio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo de los dos han construido su casa propia.
 
La Señora Julia se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla desde que tenía 8 años de edad, esta actividad aprendió y heredo de su madre, sus sombreros los vende en su casa. También se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. que son para su consumo y también para la venta
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es crecer en cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Las Toquilleras Communal Bank.  The members live in the Sigsig canton.  This canton is frequently visited for it beautiful scenery and its landscape.  Most of its inhabitants make panama hats.  They also work in agriculture and raise animals.  They are very amiable people who are very hospitable.

Julia, age, 44 is married and has seven children.  They children are 24, 22, 21, 18, 15, 11, and 7 years old.  Her first child works and helps her financially.  Her second and third are married and independent.  Her 18 year old goes to high school in the area.  Her 15 year old works because he does not like school.  The last two children are in school in the area.  Her husband works as a bricklayer in construction.  Through their joint efforts they built their own house.

Julia makes panama hats, and she has been doing this since she was eight years old.  She learned and inherited this business activity from her mother.  She sells her hats from her home.  She also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.  They are for her consumption and also to sell.

This is her second loan in her communal bank.  She will use it to buy chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to grow in each one of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeurn lives in Siem Reap Province. She has a small piece of land for rent for parking when villagers come to buy anything in the local market. From this business, she can make a profit of approximately $1.50 each day. 

She has a life partner in her husband who sells modern clothes modern for teenagers and cooking materials. They have two children who are studying in the school. Mrs. Choeurn will use the loan to purchase a used motorbike for her husband to transport cooking materials and also to buy additional cooking material to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike and to buy additional cooking materials to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one school-aged child.

Ruth has a service-based business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

Ruth has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand his service-based business and purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Liza Jane

texts.en:
Liza Jane is married with two children. Liza Jane is 22 years old and lives in El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Liza Jane has a general store business. She has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns approximately 12,000 PHP. She has requested for 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Liza Jane has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Liza Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en: Maylene is 24 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. She has had a retail store for almost one year. Her monthly net income is 7,000 PHP and she has also a livestock business wherein she raises some hogs to earn more income. She's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell. She felt glad that her business income now is enough to support her family's daily needs. She would like to continue availing loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future and she hopes that her income will gain continuously.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Chom

texts.en: Mrs. Chom is a 44-year-old married woman who has been living in Arnlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells materials to make a fire used for cooking meals and earns around US $3 each day. She has other financial earnings from her husband who works as a doctor in his community and has a formal salary. Recently, their existing motorbike broke during the driving process. He really wants to buy a new motorbike but he doesn’t have enough funds to buy one. So Mrs. Chom would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City, Mrs. Res, 41, is a businesswoman who sells different kinds of items in the front of her house. She sells some goods such as fast food, cooking ingredients, soft drinks, cosmetic products and other essential items. She has over five years experience in her selling business and she can make around $5 each day to support her whole family with other expenses. 

Mrs. Res is a widow and now she lives with her two single children who still depend on her. She will be using a loan in the amount of $600 to decorate and repair her old house.

loans.use: to decorate and repair her old house.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim is a 64-year-old married woman and the mother of four children: one is single, the other three are married and live in their own houses. Mrs. Yim is a rice farmer who has been planting a mixture of crops for nine years. She also relies on income from her husband who is a doctor. Mrs. Yim is concerned that she faces transportation difficulties. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To resolve this, Mrs. Yim has requested a loan to buy a new motorcycle so as to not have to hire taxis.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Mrs. Khut lives in a village in the province of Kompong Cham. She sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drink, sweets for kids and some cooking supplies. She earns an average income of $2.50 each day to cover her family’s needs. She is a single mother who has a school-aged child. Recently, Mrs. Khut’s inventory has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to build up her inventory so she can continue selling.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Mrs. Thuch is a resident of Kampong Chhnang, a province of Cambodia. She is the mother of two kids who are already enrolled in primary school. To make a living, Mrs. Thuch has been planting a variety of crops on her fertile land. She then harvests and sells the crops. Her husband works with her on the farm as well as collecting firewood to sell in the mobile place. In addition, Mrs. Thuch has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. The pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Thuch and her family. Mrs. Thuch has, therefore,  requested a loan to buy additional piglets to raise for sale and to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and to purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 30-year-old Mrs. Dang’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product, vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she was very well known in this sector from before she was married. Her husband assists her with the farm work. The family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. She has only one kid who is still unemployed and helps on the farm. Mrs. Dang will be using the loan to purchase a few pigs to raise and sell when they are big enough.

loans.use: to purchase a few pigs to raise

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mr. Than, 48 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where he sells soft drinks and coffee. He typically makes around US $5 in profit each day to ensure that his family has a comfortable life. His wife is a good homemaker and a domestic rice cultivator. He is married with six single children. Three of the children are employed in the garment industry as garment factory workers and have a specific salary each month and the other three attend school. Mr. Than is running his business smoothly because he has skills in public relations, which he uses with his customers. He also faces a problem: his shop is too old and not attractive to the customers. To solve this obstacle, Mr. Than would like to request a loan to decorate his shop, which will allow him to add new customers to his clientele.

loans.use: to decorate his shop.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly, 37 years old, owns a small shop in the local Ornlong Veng Market where she sells many kinds of goods for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically makes around $4 profit each day to provide what her family needs. To generate extra income, her husband sells coconuts next to the market. The couple is blessed with two kids who live under their care. They are fantastic parents who have tried to send both children to attain the highest education. Mrs. Ly will be using this Kiva loan to purchase essential goods to sell. With this loan, she will make more net income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods to sell

loans.name: Rodencio

texts.en: Rodencio is 53 years old, married and blessed with five children. He has been engaged in farming rice for almost 31 years. His net income last cropping was 50,000 PHP, and he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. Rodencio hopes to improve his family's living conditions through hard work and support. He hopes to send his young children to college and renovate their house to live more comfortably. He would like to continue to acess loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Chup

texts.en: Mrs. Chup, 23, is the mother of a young kid who is not in school. She used to sell fixed items in the market, but now she is employed in the local restaurant as a staff member and gets a fixed salary each month. Her husband is an internal staff member of an entertainment club to help be responsible for the family. Mrs. Chup would like to request a Kiva loan to buy a motorbike to drive to her work location. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to repair her broken house. In the future, she plans to enlarge her present house and to support her kid to complete a high degree of education.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for driving to her work location.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Balwang, Goleo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Victoria sells fish in the community to earn a living and has run her business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 10,500 PHP to buy a motorboat for fishing. Victoria has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for one month. In the future, she hopes to have more fishing boats for her business.

loans.use: to buy motorboat for fishing.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn, 31, is a resident of Kompong Chhnag Province. She is a vendor who sells produce in the busy local market. She sells different kinds of vegetables and earns an average of $3 a day. She is married to Tith, 41, who is in the military and they have three school-aged children. Sorn will be using a Kiva loan to purchase some pig-feed and piglets for breeding. She will use a part of her loan to buy planks and stone pillars for reconstructing her old house which is getting older and older.

loans.use: to purchase some pig-feed and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 54 years of age, married and blessed with four children. His family is harmoniously residing at the village of Naganacan. Rogelio has been engaged in rice farming for almost 20 years. His net income last cropping was 40,000 PHP. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. Rogelio would like to continue requesting loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI so that he can work towards his goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng is 35 years old and a resident of Kompong Chhnag Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Roeng, aged 33, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has two children who are of school-age. They also work on the farm when they are free from studying. Mrs. Cheng says she planted rice over 2 months ago but it is still not growing well because they need more fertilizers.
