Therefore, Mrs. Cheng has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing costs: she hires the machine but it is on credit.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of fertilizers and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Mrs. Him is a 41-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids; one is a motor repairer in Phnom Penh City while the other one attends the public high school. Her husband, Leng, is 46 and works in the farming business. Mrs. Him inherited farmland from her grandmother and she and her husband grow different kinds of crops on it. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Mrs. Him doesn’t have the capital needed for her farm.  Mrs. Him is, therefore, looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting. She will use some of the money to buy a few pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, seeds for planting and to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Pilar has a general store business. She has run this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Pilar has been a member of PMPC just for this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy, 43, is a married woman and the mother of ten children.: seven of them are married and living independently while the other three are single and work in different jobs. Her husband, Seng (47), sells chickens next to his house and makes around $1.25 every day. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Mrs. Huy is applying for this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to pick up chickens; to buy seed and fertilizer so that the family can grow crops; and also to buy additional chickens to sell. Mrs. Huy and her husband are shown together in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to pick up chickens, to buy seed and fertilizer, and  to buy additional chickens

loans.name: Emelena

texts.en:
Emelena is married with eight children. She is 51 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Emelena has a a boarding house and internet cafe business. She has run this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase materials for her boarding house. Emelena has been a member of PMPC for over two years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house.

loans.name: Kruy

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Kruy, is a 36-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been planting the rice crop – that is her annual business. Her husband helps with the business, as well as providing a plowing service for his neighbors and other local farmers. Mrs. Kruy is looking for a loan to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland and to purchase fertilizer and rice seed. Mrs. Kruy has three children, two of whom are attending school and one works in a factory as a sewing worker.

loans.use: to buy a cow to plow the farmland and to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Prey Chor is a district in Kompong Cham Province. Most of the people who live there are able to make an income from farming. Mrs. Huy, age 49, is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of her children are single and depend on her and one of them is a sewing worker who is employed as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents years ago. In addition, she hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to the lack of money, Mrs. Huy decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer and other supplies to begin a farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en:
In the beginning of 2005, Mrs. Chhung built a small store in the Reussey Keo commune in Phnom Penh City. In her shop, she sells a few snack products, fast foods, sweets and grocery items to people near her store and those who pass by. Mrs. Chhung is 42 years old and mother to five children. Four of her children are single and work in a variety of occupations, and one is married and has already started a new family. 

Mrs. Chhung's husband is a motor taxi driver who has spent almost his whole life in the motor taxi service. Mrs. Chhung will use the loan to buy a vehicle for her kids to drive to their workplace so they won’t pay for a motor taxi anymore.  She will use the rest of the loan to repair the parts of her house that are broken down.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle and to repair her house

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng is a 37-year-old farmer who lives in Reussey Keo commune. Mrs. Eng is married to Mr. Khive, aged 45. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has four children: all of them are single, two are employed. Mrs. Eng also breeds pigs behind her house. The pig-raising business is a very profitable one so Mrs. Eng is seeking a loan of $600 to buy some piglets to raise for sale when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: From the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Ngoun is 48 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or she buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Mr. Chey, 44, who fishes in and around the lakes of his community. Mrs. Ngoun has also been planting rice crop after the dry season and rainy season. Mrs. Ngoun would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seed so she can start to plant her crops. Mrs. Ngoun is blessed with five children: four are single and are attending school and one is married.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoem has been in the crop-planting business for years. She plants various crops and normally generates an income of 2.5 per day. Her husband is a used-goods buyer. He buys all kinds of secondhand goods from villagers in rural areas who want to sell their old things. Then he sells them to generate income. This couple has been married for years and has six children. All of the children are teenagers; one of them is employed as a domestic garment worker. Mrs. Chhoem will use her Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Nao is a local farmer who has been living the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She has been planting different kinds of crops for many years. She also depends on income from her three children who work as seamstresses. Her husband also assists her on the farm. As this is the rainy seaS., it is good for planting her crops. Nao would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. Her aspirations are to buy a small wooden store from where her daughters can run a sewing service, to buy a cow to support her in the field and to repair her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Sek is a 30-year-old fish vendor and the mother of three children. Every day, early in the morning, she buys fish from the fishermen and then she hurries to bring her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. She is single as she has been divorced from her husband since her kids were young. Mrs. Sek is handling her investment smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to earn extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase more fish. With some percentage of the funds, she wants to buy a used motorbike to replace the broken one she uses to pick up her fish every day.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike and to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pham

texts.en: The photograph shows Mrs. Pham who lives in the Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Pham makes her daily revenue by working as a local farmer in the village. Her husband is employed as a policeman in his community and he gets a monthly salary. This couple has given birth to an only child who is single and living under their care. Mrs. Pham will use the loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work as his existing one is now broken.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhem is 55 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province where she earns a living raising ducks and chickens in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks and chickens to produce eggs and to slaughter them. She sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is married. One of her children is already married and three are single. One of them is a motorbike driver. Her husband works as a policeman in their village. Mrs. Chhem has applied for an $800 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional ducks and chickens to raise. With the rest of the loan, she will build a new cage to feed her animals.

loans.use: to purchase additional ducks and chickens and to build a new cage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his taxi's insurance and licensing to ensure his business is ongoing.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and has one daughter. He lives in Anabta village near Tulkarem City in Palestine.
Tareq saved money to purchase a piece of land. He was still in need of $2,000 so he borrowed this amount from Kiva partner, FATEN. Tareq is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary in addition to his work in construction. He wants to own a plot of land to use it in the future when he has the money to start a farm or build a house. Tareq is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to complete the purchase price of a plot of land.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From Baray district in Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Eng is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been in the fixture business since 1992. In her village, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of miscellaneous materials. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, and some fast foods, soft drinks and cooking ingredients, gasoline and other items necessary to people who come to buy anything in the market. Mrs. Eng is married to 46-year-old Mr. Sear, who makes furniture such as chairs and tables. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is still enrolled in school. In order to earn extra profit and to make her husband’s business successful, Mrs. Eng will be using the loan she requested for her husband to buy additional poles for making tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy additional poles for making furniture

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 29-year-old young woman who  is married and has five sons and two daughters. Amal has taken out a loan for $2,000 to pay the expenses of car insurance and licensing for her husband's taxi. Amal's husband is a taxi driver in the city of Rafah in Gaza Strip. He transports passengers in the city and to cities outside Rafah. The taxi is the only source of income for Amal's big family. Amal's husband is photographed here instead of his religious wife.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi insurance and licensing.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak is a 47-year-old widowed villager who lives in Prey Chor district in Kompong Cham Province. She is the mother of six children. Three of her children are married and the other three are single. Her husband died of senility years ago. Hak is a domestic rice farmer and she always uses her farmland to plant a few kinds of crops. She has done this activity at least twice a year. Another source of income comes from her two children who are working at different occupations. Hak will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint the walls and install the tiles in her new house so that she can move in by the end of the summer.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 45 years old and lives in Ijevan with his wife and two school-aged sons. His wife works at the Ijevan Electric Power Station.
Hamlet has been dealing with watch repairs and sales for 24 years. He sustains his family thanks to the income from this business. He pays 12,000 AMD per month to rent his business space. Hamlet says that his work requires high concentration and attentiveness during the whole work process. With these qualities of nature watchmakers are able to do their work well.
Hamlet has previously taken nine loans from Nor Horizon (once through Kiva) and has never made delinquent repayments. He needs a 500,000 AMD loan to add to his assortment of watches, wall watches, wristlets, spare parts and watch crystals.

loans.use: to add to his assortment of watches, wall watches, wristlets, spare parts and watch crystals.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: The woman sitting on the bed in the picture above is Mrs. Bun, a 42-year-old farmer residing in Prey Chor Province. Since 1995, she has experience in the crop-planting business. Her husband earns a daily income by providing horse cart service to all villagers and others passing by. Mrs. Bun is looking for a $600 loan as capital in order to purchase a piece of farmland from her neighbors. She can use this land to enlarge her crop planting. She has four children who are married already and most of them live in separate houses.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Mrs. Yea, 53 years old, is a married woman who lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She owns a small store in her village. The village is full of passengers and other villagers who pass by, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit of approximately US $1.50 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Her husband has been a domestic rice cultivator for many years. This couple has five married children. Mrs. Yea will be using the requested loan money to purchase seed, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan was born in 1965 in Yerevan. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Ruzan’s daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Ruzan’s husband is a shoemaker and had his own workshop, but because production in Armenia was not so profitable, he and Ruzan decided to get involved in trade.
For more than 15 years, Ruzan and her husband have been engaged in a shoe sales business. For about seven years they have been renting a stall in the one of the biggest subway stations in Yerevan, where they sell children’s, men’s and women’s shoes. They buy merchandise from Georgia and Yeravan’s wholesale fair. Thanks to their own business, Ruzan and her family have improved their living conditions and bought a car, which helps them to decrease their business expenses.
Ruzan is requesting a 450,000 Armenian drams loan to add to her shop's shoe assortment, especially children’s shoes. She intends to spend her future income on children's and students' shoes, which she will purchase ahead of the academic year.

loans.use: to add to her shop's shoe assortment, especially children’s shoes.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mrs. Uth is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in the Chey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Uth and her husband work together in the farming business. They has been spending most of their lifetime in the crop-planting business and earning an income of about $3 each day to use for their financial expenses. They have three children. Two of the children are single and one is married. Two of them are employed in different jobs to make money. Mrs. Uth will use the loan to buy some piglets to feed. With this loan, she can make more income. Mrs. Uth and her husband are pictured in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy piglets to feed.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mr. Keo is 57 years old, married and devoted to his six children. Four of the children are single and the other two are married. He has been planting fruits trees on his own land to earn an income. His wife assists him in the same business. From this, they can make an average profit of $1.87 each day. Mr. Keo would like to request a loan to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home accessories and appliances for her store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children age 9 and 6.  Alicia and her husband are both farmers.  They till land in Trinidad, Bohol. They grow rice crops and vegetables on their land.  According to Alicia, their current earning is 4,000 PHP per month.

Alicia has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and to pay for the labor of those they hired to help till their farm.  Alicia is hoping for this loan to help increase their harvest.  Alicia wants to be able to send both her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak is 37 years old.  He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and three children: two school-aged daughters and a three-year-old son. 
Vaghinak manages his own business, which consists of selling men’s shoes.  Recently he has started to produce shoes by himself and now he sells not only purchased shoes, but also he sells and distributes to other sellers, shoes which he makes by himself. 

Vaghinak makes shoes to order as well.  With the income from his business, Vaghinak is able to solve his family's needs.  Vaghinak is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy shoe lasts, soles, leather and imitation leather for his shoe production.  This is Vaghinak’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and his second one from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy shoe lasts, soles, leather and imitation leather for his shoe production

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and married.  She has 4 children – the oldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 18.  Catalina’s husband works as a farmer.

Catalina makes and sells “bahalina’ (coconut wine).  She has been running this business for 6 years.  Catalina works hard to help provide for their household needs and to send her children to school.  She requested a loan to buy more containers and other materials she needs for her business. 

She will also buy school supplies for her children.  In the future, Catalina hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more containers and school supplies

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a hard-working farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  He is married and has 9 children.  He tills his own land where he grows rice and vegetables.  Dionesio sells his harvest in nearby towns.

Dionesio plans to use his loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor of the farmers he hired to help tills his land.  In the future, Dionesio hopes to manage a bigger farm and have enough money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and is a married woman with 5 children.  The oldest child is 26 years old while the youngest is only 1 year old.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol.  She has been growing rice for 15 years.  Jocelyn sells her harvest to rice traders.  She earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.  She requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  She will also pay for the labor of those she hired to help till her farm.

Jocelyn hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who tills land in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 4 children. Jose has been growing rice for 20 years. He earns about 5,000 PHP per month from farming. Jose works hard to support his family.

Jose requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to have a stable business and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en:
Ranulfa is 44 years old and married. She has an 18-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer.

Ranulfa has been in the hog-raising business for 6 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs. 

In the future, Ranulfa hopes to expand her business. She also hopes to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Bolu

texts.en:
Bolu is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow and has seven children, three of whom still live at home and attend school.  She did not attend school herself.

For the past twenty years she has been selling dried goods, chillies and oil from a table in the market.  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, peppers and vegetables for her business.  In the future, she plans to complete her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, peppers and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 29 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 7 and 2.

Russel is in a food vending business. She cooks viands (meat dishes) that she sells to the people in her community. She also provides prepaid mobile phone load credits. Russel is also an AVON dealer. She plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken meat and spices. She will also buy more mobile phone load credits to sell.

In the future, Russel hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as pork, chicken meat, spices and more mobile load to sell

loans.name: Deka

texts.en:
Deka is 43 years old and married with one small baby who lives at home with her. She did not attend school herself.

For the past four years, she has been selling lappa (traditional clothing).  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than finding good supplies at reasonable costs.  Her best trading comes at traditional holidays and Christmas.

She is requesting a loan to expand the range of things she sells. She also wants to start selling food.  In the future, she wants to support her children and buy some land.

loans.use: to expand the range of things she sells

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, a 32-year-old mother of one child, has a sari-sari store in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, selling items such as canned goods, bread and eggs to the people in her community. Sarah is requesting a loan of 11000 PHP to buy more store items including noodles, canned goods and bread. She will also start a new business buying fresh fish to sell. Sarah hopes to send her child to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, bread and fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava in bulk to reduce the need to travel.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a 46-year-old married woman with six children ranging in age from 26 to 10 years. A farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol, Zenaida has been growing rice for 10 years, earning about 6000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, and she hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le, a 54-year-old mother of two, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living selling hand-made bamboo products such as baskets, furnishings and ornaments, a business they began four years ago.

Le requires a loan to purchase larger quanities of bamboo supplies and related equipment and accessories to produce and sell a larger quantity of bamboo products. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and enables her to improve her family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, accessories and equipment to make and sell hand-made furniture and ornaments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger bales of used clothes to reduce her costs.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hoa and her husband have been raising cows for meat and milk for six years. In order to raise larger cows and produce larger quantities of higher quality meat, Hoa would like to receive a loan to purchase high quality food for her cattL.. She hopes that this will enabL. her to significantly increase the profit margin of her animal-rearing business. Hoa hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase high quality food for cattle.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 46-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
To earn a living, Hue and her husband buy water morning glory, a kind of vegetable, and cut it into small pieces to sell to food stands and markets. They have been engaged in this business for nearly ten years. This business brings in a minimal income to support the family because they have to buy at retail prices. Hue would like to deal with wholesalers who own water morning glory growing ponds so that she could sell her products at lower prices. She would like to take a loan to invest capital for this purpose. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water morning glory at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses for her business.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
For the past ten years, Giang and her husband have made money by buying and selling charcoal, cutting and selling morning glory at a local market, and by raising pigs. To earn more money to support her family, Giang intends to take a loan to buy more pigs and charcoal so that she can increase the turnover of her businesses. She hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 28-year-old married woman with four daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a truck driver.
For the past nine years, Loan has been making an income to support her family by selling socks, accessories, masks and shoes for women. She would like to take a loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses, especially education fees for her daughters. Loan hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy socks, accessories, masks and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 41-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Loan and her husband own a soft-drink shop and run a small street-side karaoke coffee house. Loan has been involved in these activities for six years. She would like to take a loan to purchase beverages and food for her customers. This will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses, especially education fees for her daughters. Loan hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and food for resale.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 40 years old. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hong's husband sells electrical goods. Hoang earns an income to support her family by selling clothes as a vendor. She has requested a loan to invest in their businesses by buying a larger range of electrical goods and clothes to sell. She hopes that this will enable them to better serve their current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of their businesses. Hong hopes their businesses run smoothly and will help her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Nga and her husband make money by selling a kind of dessert made with sugar, coconut and beans from their street-side stall. They have been running this business for five years. Nga would like to take a loan to improve her stall by buying more furniture, glasses and spoons and to open one more stall for her daughter-in-law. Nga hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy furniture, glasses and spoons for her dessert stall and open a second stall.

loans.name: Madeha

texts.en:
Madeha is a 28-year-old young woman who is married and has two daughters and four sons, Madeha owns a taxi, which her husband drives in the city. Madeha has taken out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to pay for quarterly car maintenance that she is not able to cover from the taxi's income.
Madeha is a conservative woman therefore her husband is photographed instead of her next to the car.

loans.use: to cover quarterly taxi maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is 53 years old. She is married and and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a job that brings in an irregular income.
Cuong started a noodles sales business in 1991 in order to generate a stable daily income for her family. She is requesting a loan to repair her noodle stall, buy more furniture and buy raw materials for her business. Cuong hopes that through the loan her business will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to repair her noodle stall, and buy more furniture and raw materials for her noodle business.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 49-year-old woman who is married and has one son. She lives in Gaza City in Gaza Strip, Palestine. Fatema's husband is a taxi driver in the city. He couldn't cover his annual car licensing and insurance, therefore she took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to cover the expenses, which can be repaid in smaller amounts he can afford on a monthly basis.
Fatema's husband is shown in the picture here next to the taxi he drives as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to pay for a public transportation taxi insurance and licensing.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 53 years old and has two children. Her husband is a mechanical worker. Huong has been earning a living by operating a general store from the side of their house for the past 11 years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectionary, snack foods, and basic household necessities. 

Huong is requesting al oan to expand her business to better meet the needs of her customers by purchasing a greater variety of goods to sell in her general store. Huong hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 48 years old and has two children. Her husband is deceased. Hoa supports her children through the income she earns from her general store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a variety of goods such as confectionery, toys for kids and everyday necessities. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different everyday goods such as confectionery and snack foods to stock her general store and better meet her customers' needs. She also would like to use a portion of the loan to repair her store. 

Hoa hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair and buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ibtihaj

texts.en:
Ibtihaj is a 41-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and is photographed next to the car. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Ibtihaj has taken out a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, FATEN, so that her husband uses it to pay for taxi insurance and licensing fee. The loan Ibtihaj took which she will repay over 18 months to avoid exhausting the family financially.
Ibtehaj is a conservative woman, which is why she is not shown in the picture, and her husband appears instead.

loans.use: to cover taxi insurance and licensing fees.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 36 years old, married and has a daughter. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.
Thao and her husband earn a living by making clothes. Thao intends to take a loan to buy an overlocking machine, fabric and materials. This will enable her to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs. Thao hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking machine, fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 20-year-old young man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Mohammed took out a $1,000 loan from FATEN to cover part of his wedding expenses. He needs this amount to pay for hall rent and car rental. Mohammed saved money and covered the house furniture and other expenses and needs this money for the wedding expenses only.

Mohammed lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip- Palestine and is photographed in the picture in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for wedding hall and car rental fees

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan, a 27-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi M. City. His wife works as a saleswoman. Tuan earns an income to support his family by sewing sports shoes.

Tuan requires a loan to purchase better quality sewing materials and an industrial sewing machine that will enable him to make better quality shoes for his customers. He hopes that a better sewing machine and sewing materials will permit him to increase his productivity and make more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality sewing materials and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en: Vachagan is 34 years old and he lives in Gagar village, Lori region. He is married and has two small sons. For more than 15 years, Vachagan has been engaged in farming. With his parents help he breeds cows and cultivates land. But the main line of Vachagan’s occupation and principal source of his family’s income is beekeeping. He likes beekeeping very much and he enjoys it.  As a result of his hard work, Vachagan always gets high quality honey in large quantities and he sells his production in Vanadzor city market. Vachagan needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow him to transport and to resell his honey in other cities of Lori region.

loans.use: to buy a car, which will allow him to transport and resell his honey in other cities

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang, 49, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a general store in front of her house for the past 8 years. Her husband is a barber. Hoang lives with her 3 daughters and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoang sells many kinds of products in her general store such as candies, snack foods, detergents, soaps, and beverages. Hoang requires a loan to buy a range of different products in bulk for her general store. This will allow her to restock her store at a lower price and increase the range of products that she offers to customers. She hopes that this will attract additional customers and increase the income of her business.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate sufficient additional income to further expand her business, improve her family's living conditions and save money for her daughters' education fees.

loans.use: to buy a range of basic products in bulk to sell in her general store

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen, a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a truck driver. Quyen earns an income to support her family by operating a general store in front of her house. The products that Quyen sells include shampoo, toothpaste, and snack foods. She has been running her store for 10 years.

Quyen requires a loan to repair her store and purchase more basic products, such as toiletries and snack foods, to stock her store and offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that will permit her to earn more income and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to repair her general store and purchase basic goods to stock the store

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel was born in 1957. He lives in Hovk village in the Ijevan area with his wife and son.

For a long time Samvel has worked as a livestock expert in different villages. Now he has his own farm where he keeps cattle and cultivates land. His wife and son help him in this hard work and thereby support their family. Samvel appreciates his family’s help very much.
 
Now Samvel has five newborn calves and he needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for them and for his other farm animals. A part of his loan he will use to buy two cows for his farm. 

This is Samvel’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. He has never delayed his loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and also to buy two cows for his farm.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram was born in 1972 and he lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has a son and two daughters. 

Since 2000, Aram has been engaged in the shoe trading business in a rented place in the Ijevan city market center. At the same time, Aram and his father make shoes to order and per month, they produce approximately 60 pairs of shoes. 

Thanks to his business profit, Aram was able to repair his apartment. 

Aram has taken nine loans from Nor Horizon and one from Kiva, and he has never been delinquent in his repayments.

Aram asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy summer shoes and sandals to resell and materials for his shoe production as well.

loans.use: To buy summer shoes and sandals to resell and materials for his shoe production as well.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more land to expand his tea farm.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, a 59-year-old unmarried woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income to support herself by selling many different kinds of rices in front of her house. She has been engaged in this business for seven years.

Ha requires a loan to purchase rice in bulk from wholesalers and to repair her sewing machine to make clothes. She hopes that by buying larger quantities of rice in bulk she will be able to reduce her costs and offer her rice at more competitive prices to her customers. She also hopes to increase her capacity to make and sell clothing by repairing her sewing machine. 

Ha hopes that through the loan she will increase the turnover of her businesses, increase her income and save money for any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, a 42-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband no longer works. Anh earns an income to support her family by selling many kinds of beads and hair pins in front of her house. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Anh requires a loan to repair her store and to purchase a range of different products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to provide for her customers. She hopes that will permit her to attract more customers, earn more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beads, hair pins and different products for selling and to repair her store.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung, 39, lives with his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. They have two children, a son and a daughter. His wife helps him to run a cafe in front of their house, which they have run for 10 years. 

The income generated by the cafe is the only source of income for the family and is needed to cover all the family's expenses. 

He plans to take a loan to buy more furniture and foods to better serve his customers in the local community. He hopes that by expanding his cafe and increasing the range of foods that he offers, he will attract more customers. He also hopes that this will increase his income and will enable him to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to expand his cafe and to buy more food to serve.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María de 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

María desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y vacuno (vacas), sus corrales se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  También cuenta con una hectárea de terreno que le a dado en herencia su padre para que la trabaje, siembra limón y mango, una vez que cosecha comercializa sus productos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para engordar a sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.  María es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es poder salir adelante junto con su esposo y tener otras comodidades.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old and lives with her husband in a home of their own.  The home does not have running water or electricity and is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande, part of the Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and arts.

María has been raising and selling sheep and cattle.  Her pens are appropriately spacious and located a few minutes from her home.  She provides balanced feed and natural grasses so that her animals will grow to the optimum size and she can offer them to customers at the different markets within the zone.  In this way she generated a good income to cover the daily household expenses.  She also has a hectare of land that she inherited from her father, where she raises lemons and mangos and sells her harvest.

She has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, so that she can buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals and be able to sell them for better prices.  She will be able to repay the loan with the income she obtains, and also provide a better quality of life to her family.  María is a very hard working and dedicated person who only wants to get ahead with her husband and have some comforts.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 51-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. She and her husband run a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of rice to people in the local community.

Huong requires a loan to purchase rice and a range of different products including basic packaged foods and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and additional products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rocio Liliana

texts.en: Rocio lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she sells high-quality cosmetics for a living. Rocio has a reliable customer base and works very hard to support her family. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, lipstick, eyeliner, moisturizer, foundation, deodorants, artificial nails, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural de la provincia de Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Desde hace algún tiempo María se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral (pavos, gallina y gallos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes y con las ganancias poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  María con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y poderles brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en: María is 45 and lives with her husband and children in her own home, in the rural province of Pacasmayo, La Libertad.  This region is known for its agriculture, livestock and tourism.  For some time, María has raised poultry (turkeys, chickens and roosters) in pens behind her home.  She feeds them balanced grains, and once full size she sells them to clients in local markets to provide for her family.  She now seeks a credit from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 nuevos soles to buy more birds and feed, to satisfy client demand.  She expects profits to allow quick repayment of the loan and also to cover for her family's needs.  María also hopes that her hard work results in better academic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry and feed

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 46 years old and married. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a profession that doesn't always provide a regular source of income. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Le has been running a general store in front of her house for four years. She sells a variety of basic goods such as shampoo, cooking oil, sweets, and beverages to people in the local community.

Le requires a loan to purchase more products to stock her general store and to buy a motorcycle for her husband so that he can work as a motortaxi driver transporting passengers from place to place. 

She hopes that through the loan she and her husband will be able to increase their family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase products such as foods and beverages to stock her general store and a motorbike for her husband to work as a motortaxi driver.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años Rogelio labora en la actividad agrícola como trabajador de campo, realizando surcos y preparando las tierras para colocar la semilla, es conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza,además cuenta con su propia clientela que lo contrata por el buen trabajo que realiza, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado  un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar herramientas de trabajo para mejorar y con mayor facilidad la labor que realiza, al contar con mayor clientela sus ganancias aumentan para poder pagar su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida de los suyos.    Rogelio por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y  de confianza siempre lo contratan, además lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 41, lives with his wife and children in his own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in a rural part of Morropón which belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Rogelio has been working in farming as a field hand preparing the soil for planting for several years now.  He is known in the area for the work he performs.  Besides, he has his own clientele that hires him because of the good work he does.  With income he earns he’s able to cover family expenses.

He has requested a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy work tools to improve the work he does and to be able to do it more quickly.  Having more clientele will lead to increased profits to repay the loan and improve his and his family’s quality of life.  Rogelio is a hard working, responsible, trustworthy person who is always being hired.  All he wants is that his family gets ahead.

loans.use: to buy work tools to continue digging furrows.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 55 years old and married. She has three children, two sons and a daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired and has been helping her to run a business of selling instant noodles. They started this business five years ago.

May requires a loan to purchase a greater quantity and greater variety of instant noodles to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her current customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am is a 49-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Am and her husband have run a general store in front of their house for the past 5 years. They sell a small range of products such as cooking oil, beverages, sugar, detergent, and cooking sauce.

Am would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity, and range, of basic goods to stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic goods such as food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Isabel Adelita

texts.es:
Isabel de 46 años es madre de familia, vive en su casa con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona   se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera de sus pobladores.

Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropa, accesorios y zapatos para damas, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, pero también deja mercadería en otros caseríos y cobra cada fin de mes, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Isabel que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en especial la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel, 46, is married and lives in her home with her husband and children, where they have electric service and water, located in the district of Pacanga belonging to the department of La Libertad. This region is characterized by the crop and livestock farming of its inhabitants. 

Isabel earns a living selling clothing, accessories and ladies' shoes, a business which she set up in her home some years ago. However she also leaves merchandise in other hamlets and collects at the end of each month, in an effort to have greater customer demand and thus be able to obtain more earnings for covering household expenses. 

Having observed that her business is more prosperous day by day, Isabel believed it necessary to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 Peruvian soles, in order to purchase a large quantity of merchandise and stock her shop with innovative products. Her goal is that her clientele would keep growing so that she may pay off her loan and improve the quality of life of her family, and especially of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of merchandise for stocking her business.

loans.name: Rosa Celinda

texts.es:
Rosa  de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Oyotun que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Rosa se ha dedicado a la venta en su tienda de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Rosa es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, lives with her husband and children in their own home where they have only water and electrical service, located in the district of Oyotun which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. This region is characterized by the farming and livestock business and handicrafts. 

For an approximate number of years Rosa has earned a living selling in her store products which are used daily such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs and drinks. She set up her business in her own home for convenience and safety. With her earnings from the sale of her products she tries to cover all her expenses and improve the standard of living of her family. 

In order to be able to expand her business she requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to purchase more merchandise, with the sole hope that her business would grow and have more products to offer her clients, and thus cover her loan payments and her household obligations. Rosa is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who would like to provide more conveniences to her husband and children.

loans.use: to purchase more daily use products for her shop.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 41 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Benito es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa.  También comercializa aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y de alimento balanceados para sus aves de corral, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Benito es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y que sus hijos tengan algunas comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Benito, 41, lives with his family in his own home, which has only electrical service, located in the district of Tambogrande belonging to the department of Piura. The region is characterized by the farming and livestock business and handicrafts. 

Benito is in the farming business and has his own farmland where he grows limes and mangoes. Once his products are harvested he offers them for sale in the various markets of Piura, so as to obtain income for covering his household costs. He also sells poultry. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy fertilizers to improve his lands as well as his product, and commercial feed for his poultry, with the aim of selling them at a better price to the merchants, and thus improve financially. Benito is a father who would like things to get better for his family and for his children to have some conveniences at home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to improve his farmland and his crops.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algún tiempo Filomena se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral (pavos,gallina y patos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.  También cuenta con una mototaxi que es de su propiedad, la cual la maneja su esposo para tener otro ingreso.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados, una vez que engorden poder ofertarlos a sus clientes y con las ganancias pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Filomena con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y su deseo es brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Filomena, 36, lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her house does not have basic utilities; it is located in a rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For some time now, Filomena has been selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks.)  She raises them in corrals that she has in the back of her house.  She feeds them with nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they are fully grown, she sells them to her customers or in different markets in the area, and with the income she is able to pay for her family's basic needs.  She also has a mototaxi that she owns; her husband drives it to generate another income.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 600 Peruvian soles to buy poultry feed.  Once she fattens her poultry, she will be able to offer them for sale to her customers, and with the earnings she will be able to pay off the loan and improve her family's standard of living.  Filomena has managed to get ahead gradually with hard work and effort.  Her desire is to provide her children with other academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: buy nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains for her poultry business

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 3 años Roman se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (ovejas, chanchos, cabras y aves), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar animales, su respectivo alimento y realizar algunos arreglos en sus corrales, para que estén espaciosos para la comodidad de sus animales y con las ganancias pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su nivel de vida.  Roman con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y su deseo es que su negocio siga creciendo para mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Roman, age 28, lives with his wife in his own home. They only have electricity. Their home is located in a rural zone of the Morrope district, which belongs to the Lambayeque department. This zone is characterized by agricultural, livestock, and crafting economic activities.

For three years Roman has sold barnyard animals (sheep, pigs, goats and birds). He raises them in corrals which are located in the back of his home. He feeds them balanced food, grass and natural grains. Once they are fully grown, he sells them to his clients or in the various markets of the area. With his income, he is able to over his household costs.

He has requested a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase animals and their feed, and to make some improvements to his corrals so that they are more spacious for his animals' comfort. With his income, he will repay this authorized loan and improve his living conditions. With work and determination Roman has been able to get ahead bit by bit. He wants his business to continue growing in order to improve economically.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and feed for said animals.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, 41 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lanh's husband earns money as a bricklayer. Lanh supports her family by sewing masks at her house. Lanh intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production of masks and also to make small repairs to her house.

Lanh hopes her business runs smoothly and that will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric, materials and repair her house

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 42 years old, is married and has a son. She lives with her husband and her son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Her husband earns money as a builder. Hien supports her family with the income that she earns washing laundry and repairing old clothes in her local community. She intends to use her loan to buy a washing machine to expand her business.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 33 years old and is married. She has 2 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Chi's husband earns money as a taxi driver. Chi earns an income to support her family sewing clothes and selling rice and beverages. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater quantity of different kinds of rice and beverages to expand the size of her general store.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice and beverages to sell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 33, is married and earns a living to support her family by sewing and selling children's clothes. Her husband is also involved in this business. She lives with 2 sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong and her husband started the business 5 years ago. Huong would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to buy fabric and good materials that will enable her to make better quality clothes for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials to make clothing for children

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his son and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For six years he has operated a general store in front of his house.

Be would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and other products such as packaged foods to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers.

Be also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and basic household goods to stock his general store.

loans.name: Siyaya

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Siyaya; la socia tiene 19 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos por catalogo; la socia vende productos de belleza en diferentes instituciones, ella trabaja con sus catálogos y deja en una empresa al día siguiente pasar para recoger y ya están los pedidos con los nombres de las personas que desean los diferentes pedidos y anotan lo que desean; la socia estudia contabilidad en la universidad Andina del Cusco; la socia se ayuda con el ingreso que reúne de la venta de catálogos, la socia desea invertir en sus estudios; La socia pagara sus mensualidades del  semestre. La socia solicita invertir en sus mensualidades de la universidad. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Siyaya, 19, belongs to the “Choquequirao” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and is a catalogue cosmetics merchant.  She sells beauty products at various institutions.  She works via catalogue.  She places orders at a firm and the next day returns to pick them up and they are ready with the names of the people who placed each order and they record what they want.

She is studying Accounting at the Andina del Cusco University.  Income from her catalogue sales helps her out.  She wants to invest in her studies and will pay her monthly tuition fees.  She needs to pay her monthly university tuition fees.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene  67 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia compra y vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad; como arroz, fideos, harinas, aceites, gaseosas, entre otros; la socia también la socia también es dueña de un lava autos y engrase de vehículos. La socia requiere  el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, harinas, aceite y todo lo referente a la implementación de la tienda de abarrotes; La socia solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 67 years old, single and has two children.  She runs a grocery store.  She buys and sells all sorts of basic need items like: rice, noodles, flour, oil and soft drinks, among others.  She also owns a car wash and lubrication service.  She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, oil and everything related to stocking her grocery store.  She is asking for the loan to buy basic need items.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio; el socio tiene 54 años; el socio es soltero; El socio tiene 1 hijo; El socio trabaja en una institución pública como preventista, el hace todas las preventas de productos diversos orientados al rubro de abarrotes, el socio trabaja desde hace 10 años trabajando directamente con los almacenes para hacer el pedido y transportarlo a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes. El socio hace las preventas de galletas, harinas, leche de polvo y tarro en cajas, entre otros.  El socio desea invertir el crédito en los estudios de su hijo en la superior. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en las mensualidades de su hijo en sus estudios superiores. 

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

He is 54 years old, single and has a son.  He works for a public institution as a presale agent.  He makes all the presales for various products related to the grocery business.  He has worked for the last ten years directly with warehouses to place the orders and transport them to the various grocery stores.  He makes presales of cookies, flour, powdered milk and canned goods, among others.  He wants to use the loan to invest in his son’s higher education.  He requests the loan to pay his son’s higher education monthly tuition.

He is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay his debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay for his son's higher education monthly tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 77 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes, la socia aún apoya en los estudios superiores de sus hijos y ella se dedica a la compra y venta de plantas, al socia tiene bellísima jardinería y cultiva bellas y exóticas plantas, la socia requiere el crédito para poder compra semillas de rosas, tulipanes, hortensias entre otras. La socia vende en una esquina en casa las plantas algunos sábados y domingos los lleva a vender a la plaza principal de Tupac Amaru, a la socia generalmente la buscan sus amigas y conocidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Amauta communal bank.  This bank is in the Huanchac district in Cusco province in the Cusco department.  

She is 77-years-old.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are independent.  She still supports her children in their higher education and she works buying and selling plants.  She has a beautiful garden and grows beautiful and exotic plants.  She needs the loan to be able to buy seeds for roses, tulips, and hydrangeas among others.  She sells the plants in a corner of her house some Saturdays and on Sundays she takes them to sell in the main square of Tupac Amaru.  Generally her friends and acquaintances look for her there.  She is requesting the loan to invest in seeds.

She is very satisfied with and thankful to the support that they give her through this medium and promises to comply with the payment of her debt in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 65 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia es cesante del área de salud; la socia trabajaba toda su vida en el área de salud; la socia ahora se dedica a la artesanía, la socia realiza bisutería, la socia hace aretes, collares, pulseras, la socia   trabaja con mostacillas, alambres, ganchitos, la socia también confecciona cojines para salas, comedores, manteles en todo tipo de tela y bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de bisutería.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 65 years old, single and has three children.  She is a former health care worker.  She worked her whole life in the health field but now she is a craftsperson.  She makes costume jewelry: earrings, necklaces and bracelets.  She works with beads, wire, little hooks.  She also makes living room and dining room cushions, all kinds of tablecloths and embroidery.  She is asking for the loan to buy supplies to make the costume jewelry.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 70 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia es docente de profesión,  la socia  trabaja como profesora de secundaria en el colegio de varones ciencias, la socia requiere solo este año para completar su tiempo de servicio, para pasar a jubilarse, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda y mejorar su casita, la socia repintara sus paredes para ello requiere comprar pinturas, brochas y contratar a dos pintores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 70 years old, single and has two children.  She is a Teacher.  She teaches Science at a boy’s secondary school.  She only has this year left to complete her term of service and retire.  She needs the loan to invest in home improvements; she will repaint the walls and needs to buy paint, brushes and hire two painters.  She is asking for the loan to invest in her house.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 73 años; la socia es soltera; La socia es docente de profesión, la socia ya es cesante, ahora ella vive de la renta de sus habitaciones, la socia también alquila sus tiendas en el centro y le renta bien, es solo que ella está dentro del banco comunal desde hace 13 años y siempre es un buen motivo para ver a las viejas amistades y ellos se reúnen una vez por mes, hacen sus actividades como comidas y se reúnen a compartir, ella en esta ocasión saca el crédito para su uso personal, la socia que es una señora muy jovial nos comenta que con ello se comprara unas camisas y chompa, pagara los recibos de sus vivienda. La socia ira pagando a su banco comunal poco a poco con el dinero de sus rentas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 73-years-old and single.  She is a teacher by profession but she’s now retired.  She lives off room rental income.  She also rents stores downtown and does well.  But she’s been in the communal bank for 13 years and it’s always a good reason to see old friends when they meet once a month.  They have activities like lunches and they get together to share.  On this occasion, she needs the loan for her personal use.  She is a very jovial woman and she comments that she’ll use the loan to buy some shirts and a sweater and to pay her home’s utility bills.  She will repay the communal bank little by little with money from her rentals.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy shirts, a sweater and to pay her utility bills.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 26 años; la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a la atención de su taller mecánico propio,  la socia tiene junto a su esposo este negocio y el socio vende repuestos en el barrio de San Sebastián; la socia trabaja atendiendo el negocio de la venta de repuestos, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la  compra de repuestos para aumentar  su mercadería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
