texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Amauta" communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is 26 years old, married and has a son.  She owns a car repair shop that she runs herself.  She owns the business with her husband and sells spare parts in the San Sebastián neighborhood.  She works tending to her spare parts shop.  She is asking for the loan to buy spare parts to increase inventory.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 33-year-old young woman who is married and has four sons. Faten is a taxi driver and needs to pay taxi insurance and licensing, but with the decent income the taxi returns, she had to take a $1,000 loan from FATEN to cover the fees. 

Faten's husband transports the passengers inside the city and works on being hired by an agency that transports passengers inside and between cities to have a better income.

Faten is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead of her next to the car.

loans.use: To pay for taxi insurance, licensing and repairs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Urubamba, Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año D. 1940; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son independientes;  La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicha y refrescos, la socia elabora en su casa chicha D. maíz, ella compra la chicha la prepara cn difrentes ingredientes que solo ela tiene la receta exsacta, la socia lleva a vender a las diferentes ferias y también prepara refresccos, la socia trabaja solo para comprar ella sus diferentes cositas como las D. consumo personal, pago D. algunos recibos D. luz o agua, pago D. limpieza publica, y otros pequeños gastos, la socia en esta ocasión requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, manzanas, canela, clavo D. olor, maíz morado, piña, limones entre otros; La socia desea invertir en la compra D. sus ingredientes para preparar sus refresaco y llevarlos a vender durante el mes. La socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en sus negocio minorista D. venta D. refrescos y chichas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank that belongs to Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She was born in 1940, is married and has five children who are already independent.  She sells chicha (corn based beverage) and soft drinks.  She makes the corn based chicha at home.  She buys the chicha and then prepares it with various ingredients that only she knows the exact recipe for.  She takes it to sell at various street markets.  She also makes other beverages.  She works just to be able to buy herself the few little things she needs for her personal use, to pay some of her utilities like electricity or water or street cleaning and other small expenses.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy ingredients like apples, cinnamon, cloves, purple corn, pineapple and lemons, among others.  She wants to invest in the purchase of her ingredients to prepare her beverages and sell them during the month.  She needs the loan to invest in her retail beverage and chicha sales business.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to invest in her soft drink and chicha sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año de 1972; la socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos;   La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja cada 6 meses a trer ropa al por mayor para señoritas, señoras, señores; la socia trae ropa según la estación y los cambios que en el año se encuentran, la socia tambien tiene un stand en el terminal terrestre de venta de todo tipo de abarrotes principalmenten galletas, acaramelos, chocolas, gaseosas jugos en cajas, kekes, agua mineral, sandwich entre otros. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra de mercadería productos para implementar sus stand en el terminal de Uurbamba. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el stand.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She was born in 1972, she has a life partner, and she has five children.  She buys and sells clothes.  Every six months she travels in order to get women’s and men’s wholesale clothing.  She gets clothes according to the season and the changes that are found during the year. 

This member also has a stand at the bus terminal.  She sells all types of groceries.  She primarily sells cookies, candy, chocolates, soft drinks, juice boxes, cakes, mineral water, and sandwiches, among other items.

She wants the loan to buy merchandise (products) in order to stock her stand.

She is very content and grateful for this support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nestor; el socio nacio el año de 1967; el socio  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo , el socio es ododntologo de profesión y tiene su cponsultorio odontologico particular, en su casa, el sociosiempre invierte en la compra de instrumental medico especificamente todo lo que concierne a la salud dental, el socio en esta ocasión esta deseosos de mejorar su consultorio y adquirir algunos nuevos equipos para mejorar su servicio, el socio viajara a la ciudad de Lima a ver los equipos y poder invertir en uno de ellos. El socio solicita el prestamo paara invertir en la compra de equipo ,medico para el area de odontología.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank that belongs to Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Nestor.  He was born in 1967.  He has a spouse and a son.  He is a Dentist by profession and has a private dental office at home.  He always invests in the purchase of medical equipment, specifically that having to do with dental health.  On this occasion, he wants to improve his dental office and acquire some new equipment to improve service.  He will travel to the city of Lima to look at the equipment and be able to invest in one of them.  He requests the loan to buy dental equipment.

He is satisfied and very grateful for the support he’ll get and commits to repay his debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy new dental equipment.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and has two daughters. Zainab is a housewife in addition to working on her farm growing vegetables and selling them to the local stores. One of Zainab's daughters is a teacher and helps her take care of the household expenses. Zainab wants to change the 39-year-old furniture in her house and paint the walls. Therefore, she took out a loan from FATEN to cover the expenses.

Zainab is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for home furniture and painting the walls

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
El socio; El socio nacio el año 1984; el socio es soltero;  El socio se dedica a la administración de sus propio gymnasio, el sosico tiene su gymnasio desde hace 5 años en el bellisimo valle sagrado de los inkas, el socio a futuro desea tener su cadena de gymnasios en todo el valle y Cusco, el socio es entrenador personal y el mismo se dedica a que todos sus clientes salgan satisfechos con los logros obtenidos y la asesoria de el mismo. El socio desea el credito para poder implemetar y comprar maquinas para hacer pesas; el socio desea invertir en su gymnasio. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en su gymnasio y comprar un par de maquinas para hacer pesas.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

This member was born in 1984, and he is single.  He manages his own gym, which he has had for five years.  It is in the beautiful sacred valley of the Incas.

In the future he wishes to have a chain of gyms in the entire valley and in Cusco.  This member is a personal trainer.  He devotes himself to all of his clients.  The clients leave pleased with the achievements they have obtained and pleased with his advice.

He wants the loan to be able to equip his gym and to buy weight machines.  He wishes to invest in his gym.  This member requests the loan to invest in his gym and to buy a pair of weight machines.

He is very pleased and grateful for the support of the loan, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in his gym and to buy a pair of weight machines.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio; El socio tiene 66; el socio es casado y tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya estan todos independientes;  El socio tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado el Cienciano ubicado en Urubamba; el restaurante del socio es atendido por su esposa y sus hijos, el socio es trabajador en el área administrativa de educación en Urubamba y con todos sus ahorros puso este restaurante para que su familia trabaje y puedan tener otro ingreso extra, les ha ido muy bien y con lo que ahorran pueden comprar al por mayor los productos requeridos por la demanda de insumos, el socio desea el crédito ahora para comprar cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor, para implementar el negocio familiar y de este modo mejorar las ventas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank belonging to Urubamba District, Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He was born in 1945, is married and has 8 children who are all now independent.  He has a small restaurant called “El Cienciano” located in Urubamba.  His restaurant is tended to by his wife and children.  He’s employed as an educational administrator in Urubamba and used all his savings to open the restaurant so that his family would have work and extra income.  They have done very well and with their savings they are able to buy at wholesale the products and ingredients they need to meet demand.  He needs the loan to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale to stock the family business and improve sales.  He’s asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

He is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay his debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año 1972. La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta útiles escolares y pasamanería, la socia trabaja ene ste negocio desde hace 10 años y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lapicerosm reglas, borradores, papeles, papelotes, escuadras, album, folders y otros útiles más para implementar su librería. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de utiles para implementar su librería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the “TERCER MILENIO” communal bank, located in the Urubamba district and province, within the Cusco department.

She was born in 1972, is in a live-in relationship, has two children, and has been selling school supplies and decorations for ten years.  Things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She needs this loan in order to buy notebooks, mechanical pencils, rulers, erasers, paper, scratch paper, T-squares, albums, folders, and other utensils for her store.  She is asking for this loan to invest into her store.

She is very happy and grateful for the support she has gotten through this method and she is committed to making her payments on scheduled.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia nació el año de 1982, la socia es soltera y es docente de profesión; ella trabaja en un colegio y la socia a encontrado la manera de alternar su trabajo con otro, ella también es proveedora de instrumentos odontológicos, la socia tiene un cuñado que es odontólogo y debido a que el trabaja en su consultorio y está muy ocupado ella le trae de Cusco los instrumentos y los materiales odontológicos que el requiere y de este modo ella pasa a ser su proveedora, la socia es una joven es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muy buenas ideas del futuro, ella por ahora desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital de trabajo y de este modo seguir ahorrando su dinero para comprar sus cosas poco a poco; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales odontológicos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) communal bank.  The bank belongs to the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

She was born in 1982 and is single and a teacher by profession.  She works in a school and has found a way to supplement this job with another.  She is also a supplier of dental instruments.  She has a brother-in-law who is a dentist and as he works in his office and is very busy, she brings the dental instruments and supplies that he needs from Cusco.  In this way she became a supplier.  This member is a young and very hard-working woman who has ver good ideas for the future.  Right now she would like the loan to use it as working capital and in this way continue saving her money to buy things little by little.  She is requesting the loan to invest it in the purchase of dental supplies.

She is very satisfied with and thankful for the support that she has been given through this medium and she promises to follow through with the payments on her debt in the set time period.

loans.use: to buy dental materials.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru:
Эдуард  женат. Его супругу зовут Эдита. У них двое маленьких сыновей.  Семья очень положительная, отношения построены на любви и уважении.

Эдуард имеет свой бизнес. Он изготавливает кованые изделия уже 8 лет.  Эдуард смог найти хорошее торгово-производственное место. Он трудолюбивый, целеустремленный и энергичный. У него хорошая репутация. Эдуард намерен дальше развивать свой бизнес.
 
Эдуард просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 7,000 гривен на улучшение рабочих условий в арендуемой мастерской. Доход пойдет на улучшение условий проживания семьи.
texts.en:
Eduard is married. His wife's name is Edita. They have two small sons. Their family is very positive and their relationship is based on love and respect. 

Eduard has own business. He manufactures forged products for eight years now. Eduard was able to find a good commercial and industrial place. He is a hardworking, purposeful and energetic person. He has a good reputation. Eduard plans to further grow his business.

Eduard is asking to provide him with a loan in the amount of 7000 hrivnas to improve the working conditions in the rented workshop. His income will go towards improving the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to improve the working conditions in the workshop

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and has one daughter and two sons. He owns a shop selling sanitary tools in addition to his work in agriculture on his small land next to his house where he plants vegetables. Wissam took out a $1,000 loan from FATEN to install a dripping irrigation network on his land. Wissam is having the drip irrigation network to save time and to save water, as Palestine suffers from a water shortage. 

Wissam appears in the picture above.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a drip irrigation system

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with one grown daughter. For the past thirteen years she has sold various electrical supplies at a downtown market in the city of Zaporozhye. She offers good quality products at affordable prices, and this fact, as well being in a good location, has brought Irina many repeat clients.

Irina would like to borrow 9,600 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her inventory.

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
44-year-old Yayah is married and has two children aged nineteen and sixteen. His dependent father also lives with him.

In 2001, Yayah began selling garri (cassava flakes) because he needed to alleviate his domestic difficulties. His business is the only source of livelihood for him and his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 7,600,000 SLL every month. The rising cost of transportation is his major challenge, though, and competition is extremely high.

Yayah would like a loan of 3,000 SLL in order to buy more garri to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly income by approximately 751,000 SLL.

In the future, Yayah plans to purchase and install a garri processing machine in his village and to give his children a quality education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garri to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda donde vende mantas,gorros,chompas y muñecas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,ella tiene una estación del distrito de Ollantaytambo que los trenes salen al distrito de Machupicchu,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor como materiales para hacer las muñecas.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” (The Ollantaytambo Friendship) Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

This member is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling handicrafts.  She has a store where she sells blankets, hats, sweaters, and dolls.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has a station in the Ollantaytambo district where the trains go to the Machupicchu district.  Through this business she has gotten her children ahead.

This member wants to expand her business of selling handicrafts.  She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale arts and crafts like materials for making dolls.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale arts and crafts like materials for making dolls.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 80 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y también cultiva pasto que se alimentan las vacas y cuyes, la socia vende el maíz y el pasto en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to “La Amistad de (The friendship of) Ollantaytambo” communal bank, located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She is 80 years of age, married, and has 6 children. Daily, she spends her time in her agricultural business. She has crop land where she sows corn and, also, grass for feeding cattle and guinea pigs. She sells her corn and grass as a street vendor, from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm. From this business she is able to advance her children. She wants to expand her agricultural business.

She requests a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop lands.

She is pleased about the loan and accepts responsibility for meeting the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her fields of corn and forage.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar colchas, sabanas, y comprar una calefacción para implementar el hospedaje.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo."  This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which is in the Ururbamba province in the department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, lives with a partner, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her guest house business. She works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business she is able to support her children.  She wants to better outfit her guest house, and so she requests a loan to buy bedspreads, bed sheets and a heater.  

She is pleased to be getting this loan, and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets and a heater

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 35 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías, el socio vende chompas, polos, pantalones y muñecas, el vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de Ollantaytambo,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como muñecas, polos, pantalones, chompas y aretes.
                                                                                                                                                                    
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to “La Amistad de (The Friendship of) Ollantaytambo” communal bank, located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. 

He is 35 years old, single and has 2 children.  Every day he sells artisan goods, including sweaters, polo shirts, pants, and dolls, as a street vendor in the plaza of Ollantaytambo. He wishes to expand his artisan goods sales business.

The member requests a loan to buy merchandise such as dolls, polo shirts, pants, sweaters, and earrings. He is pleased  about the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dolls, polo shirts, pants, sweaters, and earrings to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y aceite y también vende la socia artesanía en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos y venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como muñecas, chompas, polos y pantalones y también comprar azúcar, leche, fideos y aceite para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 53 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles and oil.  In addition, she also sells handicrafts as an itinerant vendor.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand and improve both her grocery store business and her business selling handicrafts.  She is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts such as dolls, sweaters, tops and pants.  She will also buy sugar, milk, noodles and oil to stock her grocery store.

The borrower is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as dolls, sweaters, tops and pants.  She will also buy sugar, milk, noodles and oil to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 75 años de edad y es casado; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de habitación y también es profesor cesante, el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, el alquila a diferentes turistas nacionales e internacionales, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar las habitaciones y comprar sabanas y colchas.
                                                                                                                                                                     
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This man belongs to the communal bank "Tercer Milenio."  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, which is part of Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

He is 75 years old and is married.  He alternates his daily activities with his business renting rooms.  He also used to work as a teacher.  In his business renting rooms he rents to many different national and international tourists.  Through this business he provided for his children.  He wants to expand his business renting rooms.  He requests a loan to set up his rooms and to buy bed sheets and bedspreads. 

He is pleased to be getting this loan and is committed to making all of the payments.

loans.use: to set up rooms to rent and to buy bed sheets and bedspreads

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Charles. He is married and has 4 children, ages 18, 15, 12 and 8. He has 2 additional dependents who are his parents. 

In 2001, Charles established his rice business. He began his business to enhance his independence. It is his only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 9,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy rice (big bag) 2,500,00 SLL, (small bag) 1,500,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Charles plans to own a larger shop, and give his children quality education. The current rate of inflation is his major business challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice for his business

loans.name: Anonymous

La socia  tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion,ella vende cemento,ladrillos,fierros,clavos entre otros materiales de construccion,por medio de este negoció la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción al por mayor como fierros, clavos, pinturas y ladrillos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 56 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling building materials and supplies.  She sells cement, bricks, metal and nails, among other construction supplies.   Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the business of selling construction materials and is asking for a loan to buy building supplies, like metal, nails, paint and bricks, at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

She is 32 years old and has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with selling groceries.  She sells basic need items like rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles.  She works from 8am until 6pm and is able to support her children through this business.  She wants to expand her grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy such products as rice, sugar, oil and milk.


She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He wants to expand the piñata business and needs a loan to buy such items as piñatas, plates, balloons and candles for birthday parties.                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                     
He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 75 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de manualidades, ella hace bordados en hilo y también la socia es profesora cesante, los trabajos que hace en hilo y lana lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos y palitos de tejer.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Amauta" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 75 years old, single, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her handicrafts business.  She makes embroidered items.  She is also a retired teacher.  She makes items from threads and yarn and sells them as an itinerant vendor.  Through this small business she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials such as yarn, thread and knitting needles.

The borrower is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as yarn, threads and knitting needles

loans.name: Mayah

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mayah. He is married and has 3 children, ages 12, 8, and 6. 

In 2006, Mayah established his beverage business. He began his business because he wants to generate funds to further his education and that is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 20 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy soft drinks, stout, Maltina and parrot brand drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mayah plans to further his education, take good care of his parent and to give his children a quality education. The persistent increase in the general price level is his major business challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, stout, Maltina and parrot drinks for his business

loans.name: Manuela Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Manuela tiene 54 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella.  Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque la han ayudado mucho con los créditos y le han dado sin pedirle tantos requisitos a pesar de que es madre soltera.

Ella en sociedad con su hijo tienen una fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), allí su hijo junto con dos ayudantes a quienes se les paga un sueldo semanal  se encargan de fabricar los ladrillos,  luego ellos mismos entregarlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta el sitio para luego llevarlos a los puntos de venta al por menor o directamente a las construcciones donde necesitan de este material muy utilizado en toda la provincia, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y esto lo vienen realizando desde hace mas de 14 años y nos cuenta que les va bien a pesar de que en la actualidad está a un precio bajo, pero siempre es así ya que hay temporadas a buen precio y otras en que baja el precio de sus productos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar estos productos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar sus productos directamente a las construcciones.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like straw hats that are famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.

We met Manuela, 54, here.  She’s a single mother of one son who is now an adult but still lives with her.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and likes it because they have helped her much with loans that they have granted her without asking for so many requirements even though she’s a single mother.

In partnership with her son she has a brick factory (material used to build houses).  Her son, together with two helpers that earn a weekly salary, are in charge of making the bricks.  They, themselves, then see to delivering them to the various merchants who come by the place to later take them to their places of wholesale and retail sales or directly to construction sites where this material, that’s widely used throughout the province, is needed.  They work Monday through Saturday from 8am until 4pm and have been doing this for over 14 years.  They tell us that they do well despite the low prices prevalent nowadays.  However, it’s always been that sometimes there are seasons with high prices and sometimes those when the price of these products drops.

This loan is to buy firewood, sawdust and hearts of palm which are the materials used to manufacture these products.  Her dream is to own a vehicle so that she can transport her products directly to construction sites.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust and hearts of palm to make bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones, ella alquila habitaciones a diferentes lugares como turistas, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar camas, colchones y sabanas para implementar las habitaciones.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 50 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with room rentals.  She rents rooms to different people, like tourists.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy beds, mattresses and sheets to furnish the rooms.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy beds, mattresses and sheets to furnish rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, lápiz labiales, cremas y polvos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al publico general, la socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos como perfumes, lapiz labial y cremas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 51 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with cosmetics sales.  She sells perfume, lipstick, cream and powder.  She sells independently going to various places like institutions and to the general public.  She wants to expand the beauty products sales business and is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics like perfume, lipsticks and creams.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Inés Virginia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  16, 13, 9 y 8 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar desde hace varios años trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta.  Ella realizar los créditos con la finalidad de que su esposo y su papá puedan sacar adelante un negocio de fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), allí trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00, nos cuenta que una vez que han elaborado una gran cantidad de ladrillos hasta su fabrica llegan los comerciantes quienes les compran y estos los leven a otros lugares para su venta.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua, palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ayuda a su papá y a su esposo al mismo tiempo.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su trabajo y que la fabrica siga mejorando
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.


We met Inés, 32, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 16, 13, 9 and 8 years of age.  The two oldest are in secondary school and the younger ones go to elementary school.  Her husband’s an artisan.


Our friend is a very tenacious woman who, in order that her children not lack for anything and to help her husband meet household expenses, has been working in a factory in the city of Manta for several years.  She is negotiating these loans in hopes of her husband and father being able to make a brick manufacturing business (materials used to build houses) successful.  They work there Monday through Saturday from 8am until 4pm.  She tell us that once a large number of bricks are manufactured merchants come by the factory to buy them and take them to other places to be sold.


This loan is to buy firewood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm which are the materials used to make bricks.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she can use the loans to help her father and her husband at the same time.  Her dream is to continue working at her job and that the factory continues improving.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm to make bricks.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Abie. She is a widow and has 2 children, ages 26 and 23 years. 

In 2007, Abie established her used electronic items and drinks business. She began her business because she has to enhance her independence. This business is her major source of income. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Abie requires a loan in order to buy DVD players, amplifiers and drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Abie plans to establish a modern electronic and drinks shop, to own a house, and to also embark in international business. The current high rate of inflation is her business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy DVD players, amplifiers, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Mariana Gillermina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

En este lugar  conocimos a la señora Mariana tiene 45 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella, el estudia en la universidad en Manta.  Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad con la que trabajan en la institución.

Ella trabaja en una casa realizando quehaceres domésticos, pero también en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que  además sus clientes le  realizan pedidos. Trabaja todos los días desde las  6h00 hasta las 15h00 realizando sus labores dentro de la casa en la que trabaja pero en las noches ella visita a sus conocidos para ofrecer su mercadería las mismas que  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos o tres pagos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar una vez al mes a  Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños, entre otras prendas.
 
Su sueño es algún dia tener un local bien surtido de mercadería.
texts.en:
The  members of the communal bank, La Dolorosa del Pechiche,  meet every two weeks in the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, known domestically and internationally for its great variety of typical crafts, such as Panama hats.

Here we meet Mariana, 45, single mother of a son who, although no longer a child, still lives with her.  He is studying at the university in Manta.  She has been with the communal bank for three years and she likes the serious way the institution functions.

She works at home doing housework, but also in her spare time she sells all kinds of clothing door to door.  She tells us that her customers also give her orders.  She does housework daily from 6 am until 3 pm but she visits her acquaintances in the evenings offering them merchandise on credit.    They make two or three payments to purchase the items.  She goes once a month to Guayaquil to buy merchandise and she tells us that she has been selling this way for the past 7 years and it’s going very well.

Mariana will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts, children’s clothing, and other items.

Her dream is to have a stand in the future supplied with merchandise

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Alfarina Diofilda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

La señora Alfarina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace 16 años y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado mucho con los créditos. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero el menor aun vive con ella y estudia en universidad, con ella también vive con una nieta de 5 años de edad que es como su hija y que estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella se dedica tanto al hogar como también al comercio,  vende productos naturales de la marca Obnilife, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus productos ya son para entregar ya que tiene muchos clientes que utilizan sus productos para mejorar su salud y su estado de ánimo,  nos cuenta que ella tenía una fábrica de botones pero por motivos de enfermedad tuvo que darle esta fabrica a uno de sus hijos ya que ella no podía hacerse cargo de este trabajo, ahora lleva más de 7 años en el comercio y le está yendo muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales, como vitaminas, adelgazantes, entre otros productos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Alfarina is a founding member of the communal bank.  She’s been in it for 16 years and likes it because they have always helped her a lot with the loans.  She’s 52 years old, married and has four children who are all adults now but the youngest one still lives with her and is attending university.  A five-year-old granddaughter, who is like a daughter to her, also lives with her and is going to school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She is both a housewife and a merchant.  She sells Omnilife brand products door to door although most of her products are for delivery because she has lots of customers that use these products to improve their health and their state of mind.  She tells us that she used to have a button factory but due to illness had to leave it to one of her children because she could no longer do the work.  Now, she’s been a merchant for over 7 years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy natural products like vitamins and weight loss products, among other things.  Her dream is to stay in business and that her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy natural products like vitamins and weight loss products.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Fatmata. She is a widow and has a 14-year-old child. She has 5 additional dependents who live with her because she wants them to help her with her business.  

In 2007, Fatmata established her uniforms and other clothing business. She began her business because it helps enable her to care for her parents and her only child. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy poplin, check, shatting and siphon materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own a house, embark in international business, and give her child the education he needs. The rising cost of stock is her challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy poplin, shatting, check and siphon materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

La señora Juana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, nos cuenta que son muchos años que ha estado en este banquito y le gusta porque con los créditos su familia ha podido salir adelante con su pequeño negocio. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 5 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 8 años los mismos que estudian  en  colegio y escuela y son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo  se dedica al comercio y además es artesano.

Ella realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en el negocio con el cual siempre ha mantenido el hogar, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que sus esposo se dedica a la venta de verduras y legumbres para lo cual recorre la localidad en un triciclo, trabaja tres días en sus ventas pero el resto de la semana de dedica a trabajar en una ladrillera del sitio donde vive, nos cuenta que con una sola actividad es muy difícil mantener un hogar por eso es necesario trabajar en todo lo que sea posible.
 
Este crédito es para comprar, habas, habichuelas, frejol, y todo tipo de legumbres y verduras para vender  a sus clientes. 

Sus sueños tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products like the straw hats famous both nationally and internationally, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Juana is a founding member of the communal bank.  She tells us that she’s been in the communal bank for many years and likes it because the loans have made it possible for her family to get ahead with their small business.  She is 42 years old, married and has 7 children.  Five of them are adults and two, who are 16 and 8 years of age, are in secondary and elementary school respectively and still live at home.  Her husband’s a merchant and an artisan.

She is taking out this loan so that her husband can use it in the business which has always supported the household.  Our friend tells us that her husband crisscrosses the town on his three wheeled cart selling vegetables and legumes.  He works three days a week selling but the rest of the time he works at a brick factory where they live.  She tells us that it is very difficult to support a household with just one activity and this is why it’s necessary to work in everything possible.

This loan is to buy Lima beans, kidney beans, broad beans and all types of legumes and vegetables to sell to customers.  Her dream is to stay healthy and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy Lima beans, kidney beans, broad beans, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isatu. She is married and has 2 children, ages 12 and 8 years. In 2006, Isatu established her groundnut and beans business. She began her business because she wants to actualize her dream of independence and that is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 9,560,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy groundnut (2,000,000 SLL) and beans (1,000,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 1,075,960 SLL. 

In the future, Isatu plans to own a supermarket, erect a house and give her children a quality education. The persistent increase in the general price level is her major challenge, and competition is minimal. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and beans

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
56-year-old Shola is married, and has four children aged 33, 30, 28, and 25. His dependent father also lives with him.

In 2001 Shola began his spare parts business because he needed to take care of his family adequately. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, he earns about 12,000,000 SLL every month. The rise in prices coupled with limited funds are his challenge.

Shola would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. With this he would buy 1,750,000 SLL of engine oil, 625,000 SLL of spark plugs, 650,000 SLL of gaskets, 600,000 SLL of brake oil and 375,000 SLL of brake pads. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 820,000 SLL.

In the future, Shola plans to establish a larger spare part shop, to own a house and to have spare part branches across the country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos de 18, 17,  15, 11 y 9 años de edad, tres de sus hijos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela el mayor no estudia recién termino el colegio. Su esposo es chofer y realiza fletes en su carro.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y también ciertos productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los recibe en su local en su gran mayoría y algunos los compra en Manta y Montecristi. Tiene más de cinco años con su negocio y nos cuenta que fue con uno de los créditos que empezó con su tienda y que la ha ido mejorando.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products, such as for example Panama hats known both within and without the country, the members of the communal bank Madres Unidas [United Mothers] gathers every two weeks. 

In this place we met Mrs. Ana. She is 37 years old, married, and from this relationship has five children who are 18, 17, 15, 11 and 9 years old. Three of her children study in high school and the youngest in elementary school. The eldest no longer studies as he recently finished high school. Her husband is a driver and uses his car to carry out trips for hire. 

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of staples such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents and also certain types of hardware. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and at times later. Her children and husband help her in her work when they are not busy. The great majority of her products are delivered to her store and some she purchases in Manta and Montecristi. She has had her business for more than five years and she tells us that it was with one of the loans that she began her store and that it has been improving. 

She will use this loan to further stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples. She has been in the communal bank for ten years. She is the treasurer and likes it because she has made more friends in the group. 

Her goals are to keep progressing in her business and that her store would grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples.

loans.name: Jenny Johanna

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  seis años  de edad y estudia en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. Ella estudia para Lic.  En enfermería en la universidad de Manta.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  trabaja tres días a la semana por su casa aunque todos los días lleva para vender a sus compañeras en la universidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que empezó por que una amiga la invito a formar parte de Yanbal y  fue con uno de los créditos que pudo comenzar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the lowlands of  Montecristi, a city known for the great diversity of its traditional products such as the woven Panama hats that are famous inside and outside of the country, the communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Jenny, 22, who is married and has a 6 year-old child who is in school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.  She is studying to become a licensed nurse at the University of Manta.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own income, has a business selling clothing from a catalog and selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.)  She sells door-to-door, and she works 3 days each week from her house, although every day she takes her products to sell to her classmates at the university.  She sells her products on credit, and collects every week or every 15 days.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and it is going very well.  She tells us that she started out because her friend invited her to work with Yanbal, and with a loan she was able to get started.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothing.  She has been in her communal bank for more than 2 years, and she is the secretary of the bank.  She likes it because of the easy credit terms on the loans. 

Her dream is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija la cual es  mayor de edad y está casada pero vive en su casa con el esposo y sus pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años. Su esposo es agricultor.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos  a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesite. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó con el primer créditos que recibió del banco ya hace muchos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren a ella a pesar de que hay mucha competencia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 18 años y  le gusta por la ayuda y los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the lowlands of Montecristi, a city known for the great diversity of its traditional products such as the woven Panama hats that are famous inside and outside of the country, the communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Juana, 59, who is married and has a grown daughter who is married but lives in her house with her husband and their small children who are 8 and 3 years old.  Juana's husband is a farmer.

Juana has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door and also sells from her house where she has set up a small store.  She works 3 days a week, mostly in the mornings. She sells her products on credit, and collects every 15 days.  Every time she needs merchandise she goes to buy it in Guayaquil.  She tells us that she started this business many years ago with the first loan that she received from the bank, and that it has always gone very well because she has a lot of customers that prefer her business even though there is a lot of competition.  

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it was started 18 years ago, and she likes it because of the help and the benefits she receives from the institution.

Her dreams are to carry on and continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Marina Asunción

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marina, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos de  21, 17,  14,  10 y 5 años de edad,  los dos mayores no estudian y uno está en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es trabajador eventual.

Nuestra amiga es artesana, ella elabora cintas para reinados y decoraciones para fiestas infantiles, bautizos, quinceañeras entre otras cosas, todos  estos trabajos los elabora bajo pedidos de personas que solicitan de sus servicios, además de esto en su casa tiene una pequeña heladería en la cual pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo ya que allí mismo elabora sus artesanías. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a esta labor y que casi nunca le ha faltado trabajo  porque sus obras son las mejores comenta.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar helados y materiales de manualidades para elaborar sus obras. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y  le gusta porque los pagos son cómodos.
 
Sus sueños son tener una gran heladería y una empresa de manualidades.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as, for example, the straw hats known both within and outside the country, the members of the communal bank Madres Unidas (Mothers United) meet every two weeks.

In this place we meet Señora Marina, who is 36 years old. She is married, and from this relationship they have five children, ages 21, 17, 14, 10, and 5 years old. The two older ones are not in school, one is in secondary school, and the two youngest are in elementary school. Her husband is a temporary worker.

Our friend is a craftsperson. She makes sashes for beauty queens and decorations for children's parties, baptisms, and quinceañeras (15th birthday parties), among other things. She makes all these items on order for people who request her services. In addition to this, she has a little ice cream stand in her house, where she spends the majority of her time, since she makes her handicrafts there. She tells us that she has been doing this work for more than 8 years and that she has never lacked work, because her products are the best, she comments.

She will use this loan to buy ice cream and craft supplies to make her products. She has been in the communal bank for four loan cycles, and she likes it because the payments are convenient.

Her dreams are to have a large ice cream stand and a crafts business.

loans.use: to buy materials for crafts and ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eufemia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es electricista.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para conseguir algo por sus propios medios hace 10 años empezó con un negocio de venta de ropa el mismo que continua hasta la actualidad, trabaja tres días más que todo por las mañanas y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a todos sus clientes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella deja sus productos a crédito  y cobra semanalmente o en tres partes. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo en un lugar que encuentra buena mercadería y a buen precio. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende es la ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 16 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Madres Unidas” (Mothers United) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Eufemia. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children (age 17, 14, and 8). The two older children are in high school and the youngest one attends elementary school. Her husband is an electrician.

Eufemia is an excellent homemaker who starting selling clothes 10 years ago so that she could earn her own income. She continues with this business and works three days each week, mostly in the mornings. The evenings are when she meets with all of her customers. Eufemia sells by going door-to-door and taking orders. She offers her products on credit and collects payment either weekly or in three installments. Eufemia buys her merchandise in Portoviejo at a place that offers quality products at a good price. According to Eufemia, women's clothing is what she sells most.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Eufemia has been with the Communal Bank for 16 years and likes being a member because the loans helped her to start her business. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Gladis Olaya

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

La señora Gladis es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y la mayoría se mantienen hasta la fecha en el banco, son como una gran familia nos cuenta, nuestra amiga tiene 58 de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo  y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días en las ventas y cobra los días domingos ya que ella deja sus productos a crédito. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes y si necesita pues a veces ha tenido que viajar hasta dos veces al mes, nos cuenta que viaja hasta Guayaquil porque ala consigue mejor variedad y a muy buen precio. Lleva en este negocio 10 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir con sus ventas ya que le encanta vender.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Madres Unidas” (Mothers United) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

Sra. Gladis is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys being part of the group because she is very close with her fellow members and most of them have remained with the group to date. She says that they are like a big family. Gladis is 58 years old, married, and has seven grown children. However, one of them still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Gladis is an excellent homemaker who generates her own income and helps her husband with the household expenses. She is a merchant who sells all types of clothing. Gladis goes door-to-door to generate sales. She works three days a week and collects payment on Sundays since she offers her products on credit. Gladis buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month, but sometimes she will travel twice a month if needed. She says she travels to Guayaquil because it offers the best variety and the prices are better there. Gladis has been in business for 10 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dream is to be in good health so that she can continue working because she enjoys making sales.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y la ayuda que siempre han recibido de la institución. Ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella, dos de ellos ya casados y con sus familias. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, el mismo que se dedica al comercio, vende frutas, legumbres  y granos, su forma de venta es ambulante él recorre el  mercado Tarqui en Manta donde  vende sus productos a las personas que asisten todos los días hasta este lugar para realizar sus compras diarias, trabaja 4 días a la semana y esto lo viene realizando desde hace 36 años casi toda una vida y es con esto que él ha podido darle una vida digna a su familia, nos cuenta que han pasado momentos duros pero que gracias a los créditos ellos han salido adelante.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar legumbres, frutas, frejol, lenteja entre otros granos que vende.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda en su casa para ayudar más a su esposo.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Madres Unidas” (Mothers United) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

Sra. María is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits and support that Fundación ESPOIR always provides. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children who are already grown. All of them still live with her. Two of them are married and have families. Her husband is a merchant.

María is a good wife and has taken out a loan for her husband’s business. He sells fruits, legumes, and grain as a street merchant. María’s husband travels through the Tarqui Market in Manta, where he sells his products to the people who come every day to make their regular purchases. He works four days a week and has been in business for 36 years, almost his entire life. Through this business, her husband has been able to provide a decent life for their family. She says that they were able to get through the hard times because the loans helped them to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy legumes, fruits, beans, lentils, and other grains that her husband sells. María dreams of opening a store in her house so that she can help her husband even more.

loans.use: to purchase legumes, fruits, beans, lentils, and other grains.

loans.name: Josefina Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefina, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad  e independientes, con ella vive su mamá que es discapacitada. El marido trabaja de chofer pero en forma ocasional. 

Ella para  ganarse algo propio y con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo  y tener para los gastos propios y los de su mamá  hace mas de 12 años vende toda clase de frutas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ella alquila un carro en el que se desplaza hasta Calderón para comprar a agricultores de esta zona, luego  vende por toda la localidad, esto lo realiza dos veces a la semana y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que lo que compra los vende el mismo día. 

Este crédito es para comprar frutas plátano, naranjas, papayas, limones, etc. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener camión en donde pueda realizar sus compras y ventas sin tener que pagar alquiler del carro.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Josefina. She is 54 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children who are already grown and independent. Her mother lives with her since she is disabled. Her husband works as a driver, but only occasionally.

Josefina began selling all types of fruits twelve years ago so that she could earn her own income, help her husband with their expenses, and cover the expenses of her mother. She says that she rents a car so that she can drive to Calderón to buy fruit from the local farmers. Josefina then sells all of the fruit in her town. She travels twice a week and says that she has done very well because of her ability to sell everything she purchases the same day.

This loan will be used to buy fruits such as bananas, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the ease of making her payments. Her dream is to own a truck so that she can buy and sell fruit without having to rent a car.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products.

loans.name: Eliana Yanina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eliana, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante.
