Ella trabaja como promotora en el INFA  (Instituto Ecuatoriano de Niño y la Familia) ya hace un tiempo atrás. Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio de su marido, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual tiene un puesto en el Mercado Tarqui en Manta, nos cuenta que él trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00 y que lleva diez años con su negocio, los productos los compra en el mercado a mayoristas o si no a agricultores de la zona por donde vive.

Este crédito es para comprar legumbres, naranjas, papayas, limones, entre otras cosas. Lleva un año  en el Banco Comunal es la fiscal de pagos del mismo y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien terminada y mas grande.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Eliana. She is 29 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 12 and 8) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Eliana has worked as a promoter for INFA (Ecuadorian Institute for Children and Families) for some time. She is taking out a loan for her husband’s business. He sells fruits and legumes from a stand at the Tarqui Market in Manta. Eliana says that he works every day from 5am to 4pm and has been in business for 10 years. He purchases his products either at the wholesale market or directly from the local farmers.

This loan will be used to buy legumes, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other items. Eliana has been with the Communal Bank for one year and is in charge of collecting payments. She enjoys being a member because the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. Her dream is to have a finished house that is larger.

loans.use: to purchase legumes, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other items for her husband's business.

loans.name: Javier Fabian

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

Aquí conocimos a Javier él es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y en la actualidad aun vive en la casa de sus padres.

Se dedica al comercio, él vende frutas  y para esto primero se desplaza a los campos a recolectar de los agricultores sus productos, luego los lleva al mercado de Tarqui en Manta donde vende sus productos a las personas que asisten todos los días hasta este lugar para realizar sus compras diarias, esto lo realiza los fines de semana pero el resto de la semana en su casa el elabora figuras en tagua, las mismas que luego las lleva a vender en las playas de Manta y también viaja hasta Ambato donde vende sus productos a turistas y personas de estos lugares que aprecian sus obras.

Este crédito es para comprar plátanos, naranjas, papayas y tagua para elaborar sus obras. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y seguir trabajando para tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Javier. This hardworking young man is 24 years old, single, and currently lives at home with his parents.

Javier is a fruit merchant. First, he goes to the fields to collect his merchandise from the farmers. Javier then brings his merchandise to the Tarqui Market in Manta where he sells to the people who come every day to make their daily purchases. He sells fruit on the weekends, so during the rest of the week, Javier is at home making figurines out of “tagua” (a material derived from a certain palm tree that has the appearance of elephant ivory). He sells the figurines on the beaches of Manta. Javier also travels to Ambato to sell his figurines to tourists and to locals who appreciate this type of work.

This loan will be used to buy bananas, oranges, papayas, and tagua for making his creations. Javier is participating in his second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance that the loans have provided. His dreams are to own a house and to continue working in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, papayas, and tagua.

loans.name: Manuela Petita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es controlador de buses.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y poder ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos se dedica a la venta artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras, entre otras cosas), nos cuenta que ella en las mañanas se dedica a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada fin de semana, pero en las tardes ella instala una mesa en las afueras de su casa y allí vende las deliciosas empanadas de verde, mochines de yuca, corviches  y gaseosas. Trabaja todos los días y lleva realizando esta actividad dos años y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien, ella empezó su negocio con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras y víveres para elaborar los bocadillos. Lleva diez años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para poder comenzar en sus negocios.
 
Su sueño es ver realizados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Manuela. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 17, 12, and 11) who are in school. Her husband is a bus traffic controller.

In order to earn a living and help her husband and children, Manuela sells household appliances (blenders, irons, toasters, and other items). She says that she goes out in the mornings to offer her products in every part of town. Manuela sells her products on credit and collects payment every weekend. In the afternoons, she has a table set up in front of her house where she sells delicious vegetable empanadas, cassava fritters, fish fritters, and sodas. Manuela works every day and has been in business for two years. She says that she has done very well. Manuela started her business with one of the loans she received from Fundación ESPOIR.

This loan will be used to buy irons, blenders, and ingredients for making her snacks. Manuela has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years and enjoys being a member because the assistance she has received helped her to start her businesses. Her dream is to see her children develop.

loans.use: to purchase irons, blenders, and ingredients for making her snacks.

loans.name: Lidia Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 7 y 1 año de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva seis años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que le dan.

Ella es una ama de casa que desde muchos años atrás se ha dedicado al trabajo con el fin de ganarse algo propio, nos cuenta que ella trabajaba en una fábrica de botones de tagua y que con los créditos que ha recibido poco a poco fue comprando lo necesario para poder poner su propia empresa y fue hasta hace tres años que al fin empezó a elaborar botones de tagua por su propia cuenta, empezó con muy poco y en la actualidad ya cuenta con dos maquinas que sirven para elaborar estos productos, nos comenta que todas las semanas ella entrega sus productos a comerciantes que luego los venden a exportadores para que los lleven  a otros países y les den el terminado a los botones. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de una hermana a quien le paga un sueldo mensual.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua y otros mariales para elaborar los botones.

Sus sueños son tener una empresa mucho más grande y maquinarias para dar un producto terminado.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Lidia. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 1). The two older children are in school. Her husband is a merchant. Lidia has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys the convenience of requesting loans and the help they provide.

She is a homemaker who has worked for many years to earn her own income. Lidia says she worked at a factory that produces buttons made of “tagua” (a material derived from a certain palm tree that has the appearance of elephant ivory). Using the loans she received, Lidia gradually bought what she needed to start her own business. Three years ago, she started making tagua buttons on her own. Lidia started with very little and now she has two machines that are used for making her products. Every week she delivers her products to merchants who eventually sell them to exporters that ship them to other countries where finishing touches are added to the buttons. Lidia works Monday through Saturday with the help of her sister, who is paid a monthly salary.

This loan will be used to buy tagua and other materials for making buttons. Her dreams are to have a much larger business and to acquire machines for adding finishing touches to her products.

loans.use: to purchase tagua and other materials for making buttons.

loans.name: María Erminda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 11 y 10 años de edad, el mayor de edad este año termino sus estudios en el colegio y espera ingresar en la universidad, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller donde fabrica muebles.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, nos cuenta que lo que más elaboran son camas las mismas que elaboran bajo pedido que le realizan los clientes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y su hijo mayor le ayuda en su negocio, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él lleva más de 10 años en su negocio y que le va muy bien y gracias a Dios nunca le falta trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pega y clavos para elaborar las camas. Lleva 10 años en el banco  comunal y le gusta ya que con el primer crédito su esposo empezó con su taller el mismo que les ha servido para el sustento de su familia.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que no le falte trabajo a su esposo.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 18, 11, and 10). The oldest child is finishing the last year of high school and hopes to enter the university. The younger children are also enrolled in school. Her husband has a workshop where he makes furniture.

María is a good wife and is taking out a loan for her husband’s business. She says that the products he manufactures most are beds since they are often requested by his customers. He works Monday through Friday and her oldest son also helps with the business. María says that he has been in business for more than 10 years and has done very well thanks to God always providing work.

This loan will be used to buy wood, glue, and nails for making beds. María has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years. She enjoys being a member because the first loan she received was used to start her husband’s business, which has allowed them to sustain their family. Her dreams are to move forward and to hope that her husband is never without work.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue, and nails for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Huayna Capac, vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gastronomía es muy variada y existen varios platos típicos, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. 

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido un hijo de 22 años que trabaja y ayuda a la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora como vendedor ambulante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Rosa desde una muy corta edad trabaja como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. En unos terrenos que tiene se dedica a la cría de  pollos, chanchos y cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, chanchos, cuyes y en su alimento. 

Su meta es  tener algún tipo de negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Capac”. She lives in El Centro in the city of Ciudad, which is known for its architecture, natural beauty, the varied cuisines, and traditional dishes. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 41 years old, married, and has a 22-year-old son who works and helps with the household finances. Her husband works as a traveling vendor. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Sra. Rosa has worked as a domestic employee for only a very short time. She works Monday through Friday from 8am to 3pm. Rosa has some land on which she raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

She is receiving her second loan from the Communal Bank and will invest the funds in the purchase of chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to have some type of business, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Blanca Anatolia

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Huayna Capac, vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gastronomía es muy variada y existen varios platos típicos, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Blanca tiene 35 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una tienda de comestibles, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Blanca trabaja con su esposo en la tienda que tienen desde hace 5 años, laboran de 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad  para surtir su tienda. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is a member of the communal bank Huayna Capac. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for its architectural and natural beauty. Its gastronomy is very diverse, and there are a number of typical dishes. Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora. Blanca is 35 years old. She is married and has a son who is 11 years old who attends a city school. Her husband works in a grocery store. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Doña Blanca works with her husband in the store, which they have had for 5 years. They work from 7 in the morning until 9 at night.

She is participating in her second loan cycle with the communal bank, and she is going to invest her loan in the purchase of basic products to stock their store.

Her dream is to have their own house.

loans.use: to buy basic products to stock their store.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Huayna Capac, vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gastronomía es muy variada y existen varios platos típicos, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. 

Doña María tiene 45 años de edad, es divorciada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 29, 27, 16 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera y vive independiente, su segundo hijo es casado e independiente, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de repuestos eléctricos para vehículos y también tiene un taller eléctrico de vehículos, se dedica a esta actividad hace 14 años, trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche de domingo a domingo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de un probador de baterías.
 
Su meta es  comprarse un vehículo y agrandar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank Huayna Capac. She lives in the centre of Cuenca, a city that is renowned for its natural and architectural beauty. Cuenca boasts a variety of traditional meals and a varied cooking style, and its people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Maria is 45 years old, divorced and has four children who are 29, 27, 16 and 12 years of age. Her eldest daughter is single and lives independently, her son is married and independent and her two youngest children go to secondary school in the city. 

Thanks to her work, Maria has been able to build her own home. She has worked for fourteen years selling spare vehicle parts and running a garage. She works from 8am to 7pm, seven days a week. 

This is Maria's second loan with Huayna Capac. She will use this loan to purchase a battery tester. 
 
Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle and extend her house.

loans.use: to purchase a battery tester

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 75 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesora cesante, la socia también se dedica al negocio de manualidades, la socia hace colchas a croché y también teje pantalones para bebes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana e hilos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "AMAUTA", located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is 75 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with work as a substitute teacher. She also has a craft business. She makes crocheted bedspreads and also knits pants for babies. Through this business she helps her children to get ahead.

She wants to increase her craft business. She asks for a loan to buy materials like yarn and thread. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like yarn and thread.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es de clima frió, es la tercera de más importancia económicamente del país, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, esta ciudad tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Narcisa tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 18 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y estudian, su última hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Narcisa labora de lunes a viernes como cocinera y  su horario es de 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, después de su trabajo se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual vende recorriendo y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ceviches.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 14 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener un mayor surtido.

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the village bank Nueva Vida. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is the third most economically important city in the country. The people there maintain their culture and traditions. The city has a varied gastronomy that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners.

Narcisa is 43 and a single mother of 3 children ages 23, 21 and 18. Her first two children work and study, and her youngest daughter is studying in a local high school. They don't own a home, so they rent.

Narcisa works Monday to Friday from 9am to 3pm as a cook. After work she travels selling clothes and on the weekends she sells ceviche. 

She has been a member of the village bank for 14 years and will invest her new loan in the purchase of clothes in order to have a larger stock.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad  de Cuenca, sector donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, muchos encuentran en sus negocios las fuentes de trabajo y sustento para sus familias.

Doña María tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, tres de sus hijos trabajando para sus gastos personales, dos de sus hijos  estudian en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos están en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar. 

La Señora. María trabaja en la agricultura, lo que cosecha para su consumo y para la venta. También tiene una fábrica de ladrillos en la que trabaja hace 20 años de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arcilla para fabricar sus ladrillos.

Su sueño sería no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Nueva Vida village bank. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, an area where the people work in agriculture and animal husbandry, businesses which are the sources of work and sustenance for many families. 

Maria is 53 years old, married and has 7 children. 3 of her children work and are independent; two are studying at university; and the last two are in a local high school. Her husband has moved in search of better work. They don't own their home, so they live with relatives. 

Maria works in agriculture. Some of her harvest goes to feed her family, and the rest is sold. She also has a brick factory where she has worked for 20 years, Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. 

She finds herself re-entering the village bank and will invest her loan in the purchase of clay to make her bricks.

Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Verónica Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Verónica es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad  de Cuenca, sector donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, muchos encuentran en sus negocios las fuentes de trabajo y sustento para sus familias.

La Señora. Verónica tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como asesor de servicios, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Verónica por el momento está al cuidado de su hija pero pronto ingresara a trabajar, pero ahora aprovecha su tiempo para dedicarse a la venta de ropa, ella ofrece sus producto a sus amigas y conocidas.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa.

Su meta es de culminar sus estudios y llegar a obtener el título de Doctora en Bioquímica y Farmacia.
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Nueva Vida village bank. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a sector where the people work in agriculture and animal husbandry, businesses that for many provide jobs and sources of sustenance for their families.

Veronica is 22 years old, married and has one daughter who is 2 years old. Her husband works as a service consultant. They don't own a home so they rent.

For the moment, Veronica is taking care of her daughter, but she will begin to work soon. For now she is taking advantage of her free time to sell clothes to her friends and acquaintances. 

She is on her second loan with the village bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing.

Her goal is to finish her studies and receive a doctorate in biochemistry and pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 72 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. bisutería, ella hace aretes, collares y pulseras y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, la socia también es profesora y por medio D. este trabajo y negocio sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como plata para hacer aretes, collares y pulseras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "AMAUTA" located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is 72 years old, married and has 2 children. She combines her daily activities with her jewelry business. She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets and sells them on the street. She is also a teacher, and through her job and her business she helps her children to get ahead. She wants to improve her jewelry business. She asks for a loan to buy materials like silver to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like silver to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 31 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de molinera, el vende harinas de habas, maíz, y moraya y lo vende en forma ambulatoria y también a los diferentes lugares que venden harinas, por medio de este negoció el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de harinas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su molinera y para arreglar las molineras.
                                                                                                                                                                     
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “AMAUTA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

He is 31 years old and married with 3 children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his business milling flour. He sells flour made from dried beans, corn and potatoes. He sells it as a mobile vendor and also in the various places where flours are sold. Through this business, the borrower is helping his children get ahead in life. He wants to expand his business selling flour. The borrower is requesting the loan to stock his mill and also to repair his milling equipment.
                                                                                                                           
The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to stock his flour milling business and repair his milling equipment.

loans.name: Chacaritas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Chacaritas está formado por 4 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes son amigos y conocidos, viven en la misma comunidad en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugares en donde su gente aprovecha la tierra para dedicarse a la agricultura y cría de animales. Nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias. 

Una de las socias es la Señorita Elsa, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de un año y cinco meses. Vive en la casa de sus padres con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá labora como albañil y su madre se dedica a la cría de animales, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señorita. Elsa se dedica a la ganadería y comercializa la leche que obtiene de su ganado. También labora en la agricultura la que es para el consumo de la casa y el sobrante lo vende.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para iniciar en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
The Chacaritas (Small Farm) Community Bank is made up of four women and two men who are friends and acquaintances. They live in the same community in the outskirts of the town of Cuenca. This is a place where the people work the land by farming and raising animals. Our members work in different activities that allow them to economically support their homes and families. 
One of the members of this group is Miss. Elsa. She is 28 years old, single and has a son that is one and a half years old. She lives with her parents. She shares the cost of living expenses with her parents. Her father is a bricklayer and her mother raises animals. They rent their house. 
Miss Elsa works with cows and sells the milk that she gets from the cows. She slso works in agrictulture. They grow what they eat in the house and sell the rest.
This is her first loan with the community bank. She is going to use the loan money to buy pigs as she would like to start this new activity.
Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lubricentro, la socia vende aceites, lubricantes y repuestos para carros, la socia también es profesora, por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de lubricentro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceites y repuestos para la lubricante.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the community bank 'Amauta'. This bank is located in the Cusco district which belongs to the province of Cusco in the Cusco department.

This group member is 42 years of age and married with three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business running a lube centre. She sells oil, lubricants and spare car tyres, as well as working as a teacher. Between teaching and running a business, this group member has been able to bring her children up. 

She would like to expand her lube centre, so she is requesting a loan to purchase oil and spare tyres. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments diligently.

loans.use: to purchase oil and spare tyres for her lube centre

loans.name: Adriana Ximena

texts.es:
La Señorita. Adriana es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

La Señorita. Adriana tiene 18 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al negocio de venta de helados, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a estudiar, se encuentra cursando el último año del colegio y cuando no está estudiando se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Miss Adriana is a member of the “Sentimiento” (Feelings) Community Bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is a place that is visited a lot, thanks to its good food, beautiful architecture, business people, farm animals and agriculture. The area’s best feature is the warm and friendly people. 
Miss Adriana is eighteen years old. She lives with her parents, who work selling ice cream. They rent their house. 
This member is still in school. She is in her last year of high school. When she isn’t studying she sells cosmetics and clothes. She has been doing this business for the past two years. She sells to her friends and acquaintances.
This is her first loan with the community bank. She is going to use the loan to buy cosmetics in order to grow her business.
Her goal is to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Laura Imelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

La Señora. Laura tiene 44 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 24, 23, 18 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su tercera estudia en la universidad.  La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Laura se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Forever, también vende ropa, joyas y realiza bufetes, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales, ropa y joyas para seguir creciendo en sus negocios.

Su meta es ponerse una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura is a member of the “Sentimiento” (Feelings) Community Bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is a place that is visited a lot, thanks to its good food, beautiful architecture, business people, farm animals and agriculture. The area’s best feature is the warm and friendly people.
Mrs. Laura is 44 years old, and a widow. In her marriage she had four children, ages 24, 23, 18 and 3. The oldest two children are married and independent. The third child is studying at the university. She owns her house.
Mrs. Laura sells natural care products called “Forever”. She also sells clothes, jewelry and office supplies. She works from Sunday to Sunday but she doesn’t have fixed work hours. This is her first loan with the community bank. She was invited to join this bank by her neighbor. This loan she will use to buy natural products, clothes and jewelry in order to grow her business.
Her goal is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy natural products, clothes and jewelry. .

loans.name: Laura Mónica

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

Doña Laura tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 21, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y  le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de helados, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Laura se dedica a la venta de helados, esta actividad la desempeña hace 14 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo y su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de azúcar, leche, frutas y saborizantes para elaborar sus helados.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the community bank 'Sentimiento' and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in an area which is often visited for its excellent cooking, its beautiful architecture and its people who raise animals and work in commerce and agriculture. They are best known for being very warm and friendly. 

Laura is 40 years old, married and has three children who are 21, 18 and 13 years old. Her eldest son works and supports her financially, while her two youngest children study at a secondary school in the city. Her husband works selling ice cream. They don't have a home of their own so they are currently renting.  
 
Laura has worked selling ice cream for the last 14 years. She works seven days a week with no fixed schedule, selling ice cream all over the city. 
  
This is the first loan that Laura has taken out with the community bank and she will use it to purchase sugar, milk, fruit and flavouring to make ice cream.
 
Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, fruit and flavouring to make ice cream

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 27 years of age, is married and blessed with one child. Their family lives in the village of Calaocan. Emma has had a retail store in their village for almost one year. Her net income monthly is 9,000 PHP. Due to insufficient capital, she's asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP. The business has been a great help in developing their living conditions. She is thankful to those Kiva lenders for their previous financial assistance to her business. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 57 years of age, is married, and blessed with five children. She's engaged in selling fruits and vegetables in their village. She's been doing this business for almost 20 years. Her net income a month is 8,500 PHP. She's asking a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits/vegetables to sell even in other villages. She hopes that lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato, 38 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. He has a rice farm, which he has owned for almost 17 years. Last cropping, his net income was 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Renato who sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his agricultural business and financial security.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widow. She sells women's clothing at one of the markets in Zaporozhye city. The clothing she sells is of a high quality. Her net income is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Elena has been in this business for 10 years. Her kind and open personality helps Elena to serve and retain her clients. Elena has formed her client base and has many repeat clients who come to her when they want to purchase new items.

Elena would like to receive 15,000 UAH to purchase assorted merchandise. She needs to restock her inventory to be able to offer good choices for her clients. Elena is helping to support her niece who is like a daughter to her.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 52 years old, married, and doesn't have any children. He is a farmer who has owned his rice farm for almost 30 years.  He's asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He feels glad that his income from farming is enough to support his immediate family. He hopes to continue to access loans in the hopes that he will be able to achieve his dreams for his family through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd who sells perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products in the town's central marketplace. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnyas in this business; her profit is 5,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda came from a small town and started her enterprise three years ago. Today, Nadezhda is an independent young lady. She owns a container-store, as her shop is housed in a large metal shipping container often used for transporting cargo. Containers can also be used for storage, and make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise.

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and to increase her working capital. She hopes that increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to continue to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en: Teofilo is 47 years old, married, and a responsible husband/father to his wife and four children. He's has been a rice farmer for almost 25 years. He's asking a loan for 25,000 Philippine pesps to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for his rice farm. Teofilo hopes to raise his family's living standards through hard work and would like to be able to earn more so that he can supplement the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for rice farming

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 41 years old, married, and has one child. She and her family live in the village of Namnama. Her net income is 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.  She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles and bread. With the profits from her business, Daisy has been able to feed her family and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles and bread to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, who lives in Al-Matalleh village in Jenin district in Palestine is a father of one son.

Bilal is a Palestinian National Authority employee and has a small piece of land where he grows fruit to support his income. Bilal took out a loan from FATEN to fix the problems in his house like plastering the ceiling and painting the walls.

Bilal is photographed in FATEN's office in the picture here.

loans.use: to pay for plastering the ceiling and painting the walls

loans.name: Kawkab

texts.en:
Kawkab is a 63-year-old widowed woman with three sons and two daughters. Kawkab lives in Qalqilia city in Palestine and owns a shop selling computers and computer accessories.

Kawkab wants to expand her shop by purchasing a variety of accessories.  As Kawkab doesn't have the liquidity to pay now for the accessories, she came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for them. FATEN's loan will help Kawkab expand her business and attract more clients without exhausting her financial situation.

Kawkab is a conservative woman. Therefore, her son is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories to sell

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 30-year-old young man who is married and has six sons and three daughters. He is a school guard and a farmer. Naser took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a vehicle to use for transporting fruits and vegetables as well as family use. 

Naser, who is photographed in the picture, saved a good amount of the vehicle's price but lacked the $3,000 that he took out from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur was born in 1962 and he lives in Ijevan. He is married and has two sons, who are both police officers.  Since 1993 Artur and his wife have been breeding pigs and farming.

Artur works very hard and sells his output, such as string beans, vegetables and pork, in the Ijevan market and makes enough money to support his family. With some of his profit, he has been able to buy a truck, which he uses to get good from his farm to market.  This is Artur’s third loan from Nor Horizon, and he plans to use the 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy more pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Tiran

texts.ru:
Тиран родился в 1988 г. в городе Капане. Сейчас он живет в селе Доврус, которое находится в 25 км от города Капан. Тиран окончил сельскую среднюю школу и на данный момент живет один. 
Сельским хозяйством Тиран занимается уже три года: разводит крупный рогатый скот и свиней. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (говяжье мясо, свинину, молоко) скупают скупщики из деревни и продают на рынке города Капана. 
Сумма кредита в 300.000 драм необходима Тирану для покупки комбинированного корма для свиней  и для организации работ по уборке сена, т.е для приобретения топлива для трактора и веревки для перевязки сена, для аренды самого трактора и для осуществления выплаты трактористу за проделанную работу.
texts.en: Tiran was born in 1988 in the city of Kapan. He currently resides in the village of Dovrus, 25 kilometers away from Kapan. He has received a middle school education and lives alone. For the past three years, Tiran has run a small farm: he breeds pigs and large cattle. Middleman from the village buy the products of his business (beef, pork and milk) and sell them on the market in Kapan. He's asking for a loan of 300,000 drams to purchase formula feed for his pigs and to pay for a haymaking process, which includes: renting a tractor, obtaining fuel, paying a tractor operator's salary, and buying rope for binding hay.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his pigs and to organize a haymaking process

loans.name: Gagik

texts.ru:
Гагик родился в 1963 г. в Капане. Он женат, имеет двух детей: дочку, которая уже замужем и живет отдельно от родителей, и сына, которому 24 года и он помогает отцу по бизнесу. Жена не работает, занимается домашним хозяйством.
С 2000 года Гагик занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов в арендованной лавочке у городского муниципалитета в центре города. Продукты Гагик закупает 7-10 раз в месяц у дистрибьюторов. Гагик с сыном по очереди закупают овощи и фрукты и при необходимости заменяют друг друга за прилавком. Они работают без выходных и на полученную прибыль содержат свою семью. 
Сумма кредита в 450.000 необходима Гагику для приобретения арбузов, дынь, черешни, винограда, персиков, баклажанов, огурцов и помидоров для своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gagik was born in 1963 in Kapan. He's married and has two children: a married daughter who lives separate from her parents, and a son of twenty-four who helps his father with the business. His wife takes care of the household. In 2000 he started renting a small shop by the city council building in the center of Kapan where he sells fruits and vegetables. He restocks 7-10 times a month. Gagik and his son rotate purchasing fruits and vegetables from their distributors and replace each other at the counter. They take no days off work and feed their family with the profits. Gagik's requesting a loan of 450,000 drams which will aid him in purchasing watermelons, melons, cherries, grapes, peaches, aubergines, cucumberes and tomatoes for his business.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, melons, cherries, grapes, peaches, aubergines, cucumberes and tomatoes for his business

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.ru:
Меружан родился в 1974 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Нижний Хотанан. Он пока не женат и проживает один. 
Более 1о лет Меружан занимается сельким хозяйством: разводит крупный рогатый скот. Полученную сельскохозяйсвенную продукцию (говяжье мясо и молоко) он продает перекупщикам, которые продают ее на рынке города Капана. 
Меружану необходим кредит на сумму 730.000 драм для организации работ по уборке сена, т.е для приобретения топлива для трактора и веревки для перевязки сена, для аренды самого трактора и для осуществления выплаты трактористу за проделанную работу.
texts.en: Meruzhan was born in 1974 in Kapan and currently lives in Lower Hotanan village. He's not married and lives alone. For more than ten years, Meruzhan has run a small farm, where he breeds large cattle. Middlemen buy his produce (beef and milk) to sell at Kapan's market. Meruzhan's asking for a loan of 730,000 drams to organize a haymaking process. He must rent a tractor, obtain fuel, pay a tractor operator's salary and purchase rope to bind hay.

loans.use: To organize a haymaking process

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.ru:
Багдасару 40 лет, он живет в селе Гегамаван (Geghamavan), Севанской области, с женой и тремя детьми. Старший сын учится на первом курсе Севанского техникума, младщий сын и дочь учатся в средней школе. 
После полученя среднего образования Багдасар занялся животноводством. Жена и старший сын помогают Багдасару в животноводстве и благодаря совместным усилиям они разводят коров, телят и бычков. Полученное молоко Багдасар сдает перерабатывающим компаниям в пунктах приема, которые находятся в соседних селах. 
Багдасару необходим кредит на сумму в 1.050.000 драм для преобретения корма для скота. Данный кредит является седьмым кредитом, полученным Багдасаром из Нор Оризона (Nor Horizon).
texts.en: Baghdasar is forty years old and lives in the village of Geghamavan, Sevanskaya region, with his wife and three children. Baghdasar's oldest son is a freshman at Sevanskii college, his youngest son and daughter attend middle school. After receiving his primary education, Baghdasar began breeding cattle. He's assisted by his wife and oldest son; together, they grow cows, calves and bulls. They deliver milk to drop off points in local villages; the milk is later taken to refining plants for processing. Baghdasar is asking for a loan of 1,050,000 drams to purchase animal feed. This will his seventh credit from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is a 30-year-old mother, and she has one son named Rayan. Inas has been selling kitchen utensils such as plates and trays for almost two years now. 

She feels she knows what is best for a housewife to use in the kitchen and that has helped her earn her customers' trust. Now after two years Inas wants to expand her small home business by including other home products than kitchen utensils to what she sells, and that why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add more home products to what she sells other than kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 56-year-old divorced woman. To have a basic income she started selling clothes and blankets as a small home retail business four years ago, and she was able to serve a good number of customers in her neighborhood.

While her customer base is growing by word of mouth, Samia has applied for this loan to get more goods to sell. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To add more goods to what she sells, such as new models of clothes.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 26-year-old young man who is married and has one daughter and three sons. He has a public transportation taxi and work as a driver. It is the only source for generating income for the family. Because Ahmed doesn't have enough cash money to repair his taxi, he needs a loan of $1,200. While Ahmed is getting FATEN's loan, which is repaid on monthly basis amount, it will able him to preserve the validity of the taxi, which means generating a better income.

loans.use: to cover taxi maintenance and regular checkup fees

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 52 years old, is married to a driver, and a mother of two. She has been in the livestock business for almost 15 years, particularly hog raising. She and her husband also owned a jeepney and they used it for a transportation business. Evelyn's net income every three months is 22,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise. 

She hopes that lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie, 41 years of age, is married and blessed with one child. She's into livestock business, particularly hog raising.  She's been in this business for almost four years. Her net income every three months is 20,000 PHP. She has also been selling vegetables in their village for almost three years and she has a net income of 5,000 PHP monthly. She's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase sacks of feed for her hogs.

Lailanie would like to continue requesting loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI so that she can work towards her goals.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: For almost three years Cristina, 46 years of age, married, and blessed with three children, has operated a food stall in her village selling fruits, vegetables and some grocery items. Now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles and bread, Cristina would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and bread to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson, a 49-year-old married father of four children, earns about PHP 32,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines. Nelson has been growing rice for 20 years and is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers necessary for farming.  In the future, he hopes to generate more income to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers necessary for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fashionable shoes and clothing requested by her customers.

loans.name: Yaneth Maria

texts.es: Yaneth vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 20 años, con quienes tiene planes de apoyarlos hasta que sean profesionales exitosos y este es justamente su gran anhelo.  Yaneth inició su negocio impulsada por su espíritu independiente y emprendedor, pues quería ganar su propio dinero sin depender de nadie, así fue como hace 15 años inicio su negocio de vender productos mediante guías especializadas en conexión con empresas globalmente reconocidas e importantes, con ello gradualmente ha crecido impactando a su mercado por su gran vocación de servicio.  Su sueño más adelante es lograr tener un almacén como punto comercial especializado, para que la gente compre a buenos precios las ofertas, a las cuales Yaneth accederá porque conoce la buena rotación de estas mercancías,  que tienen estas mercancías cuando llegan en su catálogo  con descuentos especiales. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado, jeans, bolsos, inversión n que será exitosa, porque está haciendo sus compras sobre los pedidos de sus mejores clientes y en una época en que usualmente sus ventas repuntan.
texts.en:
Yaneth lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and their 3 children between the ages of 8 and 20, whom she plans to support until they are successful professionals, which is her greatest desire. 

Yaneth was moved to start her business by her independent and entrepreneurial spirit, since she wanted to make her own money without being dependent on anyone. So 15 years ago she began selling products from specialized catalogs in connection with important and world-renowned businesses.  Gradually her market has grown due to her knack for customer service. 

Her dream for the future is to have a store for specialized merchandise so that people can buy it at good prices and on sales, which Yaneth will have access to because she knows the rotation of the merchandise and when the catalogs will arrive with special discounts on the products. 

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan, with which she will buy shoes, jeans and bags, an investment that will be successful because she's making her purchases based on the requests of her best customers and during a time when sales are usually up.

loans.use: to buy shoes, jeans and bags ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Rubylin

texts.en:
Rubylin is a married mother of four children, three of whom are currently studying. With her husband, Rubylin works hard to maintain their farming business, which they have been operating for 10 years.

Currently earning PHP 20,000 each cropping season, Rubylin is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive and facilitate growth in their operations. In the future, she hopes to generate more income to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Hermencia

texts.es:
Hermencia está aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual compró accesorios para motociclistas como chalecos, reflectivos letras y adornos que vendió rápidamente y logró utilidades importantes que reinvirtió y ayudó mayormente en sus gastos familiares. Con su nuevo credikiva invertirà nuevamente en cascos, chalecos, letras y reflectores pues son la mercancía de mayor salida en su mercado. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a Kiva: “Señores fondeadores, en nombre de mi familia cordial saludo de gratitud, por todos los beneficios recibidos a través de sus préstamos, y que Dios los siga bendiciendo para poder ayudar y hacer felices a más familias.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Hermencia ingrese al siguiente enlace:


http://kiva.org/lend/207335
texts.en:
Hermencia is applying for her second Kiva loan. The first she used to buy accessories for motorcyclists such as vests, reflectors, letters and decorations that sold quickly, and she made important profits that she reinvested and which helped greatly with her family expenses. With the second loan she will invest again in helmets, vests, letters and reflectors since those are the products that sell the fastest at her market. She sent the following message to Kiva: "Founding gentlemen, on behalf of my family I send cordial greetings of gratitude for all of the benefits we've received as a result of your loans. May God continue blessing you to be able to help and to make more families happy." If you want to know the story of Hermencia, follow the link:

http://kiva.org/lend/207335

loans.use: to buy helmets, vests, letters and reflectors, which are her best-selling items at the market.

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Gildardo con su anterior credikiva compró cueros, reatas y herrajes y fabricó sillas para caballos y elementos de ganadería que vendió y reinvirtió ayudando así con un ligero incremento de su capital de trabajo. Con su nuevo credikiva planea comprar nuevamente materias primas en mayor cantidad, para disminuir los costos de producción con los precios en volumen ofertados por sus proveedores, con ello impactará en un mayor número de clientes y logrará que su inversión sea exitosa. Su mensaje a Kiva es el siguiente: “Muy agradecido con ustedes por el gran apoyo recibido y que continúen con esa gran labor de apoyar al microempresario en los países subdesarrollados.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Gildardo ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/188473
texts.en:
With his previous loan from Kiva, Gildardo purchased leather, rope and iron fittings to make saddles for horses and livestock implements which he then sold, reinvesting the profits in his slightly increased working capital. With this new loan, Gildardo plans to purchase supplies in bulk to reduce production costs, taking advantage of the low prices his providers offer for bulk purchases. This will result in an increase in customers and he will be able to make his investment pay off. 

Gildardo would like to give Kiva the following message: "I am very grateful to you for the support you have given me and continue to give with this great labour of love that supports micro-finance entrepreneurs in developing countries".

If you would like to know more about Gildardo's story, go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/188473

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es: Julieth con su anterior credikiva confeccionó uniformes y compró sabanas, cubrelechos y calzado, con el cual aumentó un poco su capital e incrementó el potencial de clientes con sus ofertas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará carnes frías, calzado, ropa para damas, y materias primas para confeccionar uniformes para los cuales fue contratada. Su experiencia en el mercado y en la confección, hacen que esta inversión cuente con una alta probabilidad de éxito. Julieth envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva:“Agradecimientos por la confianza en mi negocio, responderé con responsabilidad en el pago puntual del crédito.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Julieth ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/219029
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Julieth made uniforms and bought sheets, bedspreads and footwear, with which she increased her capital a little bit and expanded her customer base. Currently she is applying for another Kiva loan, which she plans to use to purchase cold meats, footwear, women's clothing and materials to make the uniforms for which she has been hired. She has experience in sales and in sewing, giving this loan a high probability of success. Julieth sends the following message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for your confidence in my business. I will respond by responsibly repaying the loan on time." If you wish to know more about Julieth, follow this link: http://kiva.org/lend/219029

loans.use: to purchase cold meats, footwear, women's clothing and materials to make uniforms.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 43 años vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 8 a 22 años, y un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, allí vende todo lo que le encargan: camas, comedores, juegos de sala productos de madera en general y hasta ropa y calzado. Su negocio inicio como muchos otros por la necesidad de generar ingreses mediante una actividad independiente ante el desempleo reinante, pero principalmente porque siente un gusto especial por el establecimiento de relaciones comerciales y ha descubierto su gran potencial a través de su trabajo en él. Su meta   principal es incrementar su capital de trabajo para hacerlo más eficiente y ayudar al desarrollo personal y profesional de sus hijos.  Su mayor desafío ocurre cuando ha tenido inconvenientes con el sistema de financiación de su negocio. Mientras Jorge se esfuerza por lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio maneja una rotación de inventarios de 27 días, y una utilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 44% . Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancía encargada como juegos de camas sencillas, juegos de comedor, y ropa, aprovechando que este segundo semestre se incrementan las ventas en los sectores productivos y espera que èl también sea impactado con buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is 43 and lives in southwestern Barranquilla. He has five children between the ages of 8 and 22. He has a business where he makes a living selling a variety of merchandise, from beds, dining room sets and general wooden furniture to clothing and footwear. His business started like many others, out of necessity to earn income through an independent activity against the prevailing unemployment, but primarily because he feels an affinity toward commercial relations and has discovered great potential in himself through his job. His main goals are to increase his capital by becoming more efficient and to help the personal and professional development of his children. His biggest challenge is when he has inconveniences in financing his business. While Jorge works hard to make his business sustainable, his inventory turns over every 27 days and his profit margin is no less than 44 percent. This loan is his first with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to use it to purchase items such as bed sets, dining room sets and clothing so he can take advantage to improve his second-half sales and make good revenue.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bed sets, dining room sets and clothing.

loans.name: Habit

texts.es:
Habit de 35 años vive con su cónyuge en el suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, oficio en el cual sus principales clientes son mujeres amas de casa, a quienes descarga del desafiante oficio de lavar manualmente bajo el candente sol del Caribe Colombiano. Hace 10 años decidió iniciar su ejercicio emprendedor, cuando con el producto de su trabajo como celador decidió comprar 8 lavadoras de contado y desde entonces se afana diariamente por lograr sostenerse en el mercado, con calidad y oportunidad en su oferta. Su meta más adelante es adquirir una motocicleta para lograr un transporte más efectivo, desde el sitio donde está ubicado su negocio hasta donde lo requiera  cada cliente. 
En la actualidad Habit está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque quiere continuar creciendo, así es que con con su credikiva, planea aumentar su cobertura comprando 3 lavadoras más, que le ayudarían a generar mayores ingresos, pues pierde clientes porque las máquinas con las que cuenta, se mantienen de servicio en casa de sus clientes y su creciente clientela requiere mayor atención y ser más oportuno,  para seguir perfeccionando su trabajo. Mientras se esfuerza por mejorar, maneja en su negocio una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 40%  y una autonomía de 91%, y con ello cada día   pretende aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en: Habit is 35 years old and lives with his wife in southwestern Barranquilla. He makes a living renting washing machines. His main customers are housewives who no longer want to manually wash items under the hot sun in Caribbean Colombia. He decided to start this business 10 years ago when as a product of his job as a guard he decided to buy eight washing machines with cash, and since then he strives daily to satisfy his market. His goal for the future is to acquire a motorcycle so he has better transportation from where his business is located to where each customer needs him to be. Habit is applying for his first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because he wants his business to continue to grow. With the loan, he plans to add three more washers to his inventory, which will help him generate more revenue, since he has lost customers because the machines he has are loaned out to other clients and his growing customer base requires more attention so he can keep perfecting his craft. While he works hard to improve, his business handles a return on sales of no less than 40 percent and an autonomous consumption rate of 91 percent. He works every day to improve his welfare and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase three more washing machines.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married with five children. He has been a farmer working in the Philippines for 20 years. Victor is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds for his farm. He hopes this loan will help grow his operation. He currently earns PHP 15,000 each cropping season. In the future, Victor hopes to earn consistent profits in order to send his children to school continuously to get their degrees.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo is 45 years old, married to Imelda, and together they raised their three children. Edgardo is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 13,000 each cropping season. He is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides necessary to ensure a better yield. Edgardo raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been doing it for 10 years. In the future, Edgardo hopes to educate all his children and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds,  fertilizers and insecticides to ensure better yield.

loans.name: Alex Jesus

texts.es:
En Soledad, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico, a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, habita Alex de 37 años, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años respectivamente.  Allí tiene su negocio de marroquinería,  mediante el cual  confecciona  bolsos. 
Alex hace muchos años comenzó una experiencia emprendedora y de mercado, vendiendo pudines de tienda en tienda. En esta actividad conoció a una mujer que le enseñó a fabricar bolsos,  Alex se interesó mucho en aprender y por eso practicaba esta tarea, con mucha frecuencia en la casa de esta señora, con quien finalmente organizó su hogar y con la que trabaja persistentemente para salir adelante, cada uno con su propio negocio, pero eso si unidos para lograr bienestar en su hogar. El negocio de Alex tiene  10 años de haber iniciado, sus bolsos son  comercializados en las ciudades  de Barranquilla Santa Marta y Cartagena, tres estrellas del mar caribe que descansan en la orilla de las playas;  cuenta  con 3 empleados incluyéndolo a él, el cortador, el costurero y él que engoma; anteriormente estaba ubicado en el centro de Soledad y desde hace un año funciona en un barrio de este municipio, más cerca de Barranquilla.
Su meta más adelante es abrir nuevos mercados, para ver crecer a sus hijos prósperos y potenciarles su éxito, ayudándolos a que se conviertan en profesionales.  Mientras esto ocurre se esmera trabajando y buscando la forma de aumentar su capital de trabajo, para responder a su creciente clientela, razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina plana y materias primas para fabricar un buen numero de productos, porque planea  e producir más e incursionar en los mercados de Sincelejo y Valledupar otras ciudades de la Costa. Sus estados financiero están acordes a la actividad que desarrolla Alex y reflejan el buen momento que está pasando el negocio, sus ventas   cubren  todos los gastos y maneja  un  margen de utilidad neta no menor del 6.85%, mientras sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 5 días y  inventarios cada 20.
texts.en:
In Soledad, a municipality of the department of the Atlantic, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla, lives Alex, age 37, with his spouse and 2 children, aged 3 and 6. In this place he operates his business, a leather goods shop where he makes purses. 

Many years ago, Alex began his first experience with the market and entrepreneurship, selling puddings from store to store. In the course of this activity, he met a woman who taught him how to make purses. Alex was very interested in learning, and because of this he practiced the skill with great frequency at this lady's home, ultimately moving in with her and working with her on an ongoing basis. They strove to get ahead, each with their own business, but united in the effort to achieve well-being in their household. Now, Alex's business is 10 years old, and his purses are sold in the cities of Barranquilla, Santa Marta and Cartagena, three stars of the Caribbean Sea which nestle by the beaches along the coast. He has 3 employees, including the man who cuts the leather, the designer and the man who glues the pieces. He was previously located in the downtown area of Soledad, but since 1 year ago he has been working in a neighborhood of the municipality, closer to Barranquilla.

His goal for the future is to expand into new markets, so he can see his children become prosperous and provide them with chances for success, helping them to become professionals. In the meantime, he is continuing to work with dedication and looking for ways to increase his working capital in order to serve his growing customer base. For this reason, he applied for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials to manufacture a range of products, because he plans to expand his production and enter the markets in Sincelejo and Valledupar, other cities of the coastal region. Alex's financial status is consistent with the business he operates, and it reflects the good times his business is experiencing. His sales cover all expenses and give a consistent net profit margin of no less than 6.85%, while his accounts receivable turn over every 5 days and inventory every 20.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is 53 years old and is married to Jesusa who operates a retail store in their village. In order to make additional income, Leo is engaged in farming. He raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually earns PHP 40,000 each cropping season. Income generated from the business has gone on school fees and investment in the retail shop. Leo is now asking for a loan of PHP 29,000 to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers necessary to ensure better yield. He hopes this loan will help grow his operation to increase his profits. In the future, Leo hopes to make consistent profits and maintain economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers necessary to ensure better yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and raw materials to increase her production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 51 años es una mujer casada que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 24 en un barrio ubicado en el sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su negocio es la preparación de alimentos, especialmente de picadas, pasabocas y  deliciosos pasteles típicos de la región (amasijo en hoja de bijao a base de arroz verduras y tres tipos de carnes). Ella empezó su experiencia con la preparación de comidas rápidas para fiestas, como deditos de queso, y empanadas pequeñas en eventos especiales como primeras comuniones, cumpleaños de familiares y algunos amigos;  gradualmente fue creciendo y ahora trabaja con mayores resultados pues ha logrado una creciente clientela que planea ampliar,  inyectando un capital de trabajo proveniente de su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará utensilios como una batidora y moldes, además de materias primas en mayor volumen para ahorrar en las compras y traducirlo en buenos precios de sus productos para su clientela. Su principal sueño es tener una casa de banquetes en un local diferente de su casa, donde todos la conozcan y logre  realizar sus eventos grupales y pueda a su vez ofrecer un servicio confortable que se replique. En la actualidad enfrenta un gran desafío que debe resolver prontamente para lograr cumplir su sueño de crecer  y es el de no tener un congelador para guardar los pasabocas,  lo hace en una nevera familiar y por eso debe preparar sus productos y venderlos rápidamente y esto le genera menos efectividad.
texts.en:
María (51 years old) is a married woman who lives with her husband and their two children, ages 18 and 24, in a neighborhood south of the city of Barranquilla.

Her business is food preparation, especially snacks, appetizers and delicious pastries which are traditional foods in this region (a mixture of rice, vegetables and three types of meat in dough, wrapped in "bijao" leaves). She began this experience by preparing fast foods for parties, like cheese straws and small empanadas for special events like First Communions and birthdays for family members and some friends. Gradually her business grew, and now she works with better results because she has a growing customer base that she plans to expand by injecting the working capital from her Kiva loan, which is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy equipment like a mixer and baking pans, as well as bigger amounts of raw materials to save on her purchases and translate those savings into good prices for her customers. María's main dream is to have a banquet hall somewhere in a different building from her house, where everyone will come to meet her and have their group events, and where she can offer comfortable service that she can replicate.

Currently she faces a great challenge that she must resolve soon in order to fulfill her dream of growing, and that challenge is that she does not have a freezer for storing appetizers. She keeps them in a family refrigerator, and because of this she must prepare and sell her products quickly, and this makes her work less effective.

loans.use: to buy equipment like a mixer and baking pans, as well as larger amounts of raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more prime materials and supplies to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Rafael Andrès

texts.es:
Rafael es un joven de 23 años de edad  que inicio su vida productiva trabajando en  varias agencias publicitaria y ganando un buen mercado logró independizarse y emprender su propia aventura de negocio de publicidad, donde se  dedica a realizar asesorías de imagen corporativa, mercadeo, campañas publicitarias, organización de eventos, tipografías, diseño gráficos, dotación de artículos para oficina y en general venta de material  publicitario.
