Inició este negocio  hace 4 años, sus clientes son, agencias de viaje, personas particulares, y otras empresas que recomiendan sus servicios, porque reconocen la calidad con la cual Rafael trabaja. Los estados financieros de su microempresa están de acuerdo con la  actividad que desarrolla,  sus compras las hace  de contado, y maneja un margen de utilidad neta no menor de un 39,80%, mientras sus inventarios representan un 17%, sus cuentas por cobrar no superan el 60% y rotan  cada 13 días mientras , sus inventarios lo hacen cada 6.   
Su mayor sueño y mayor desafío es abrir sus instalaciones en un lugar más estratégico, él sabe que esto lo logrará  por su gran esfuerzo cuando este aún más posicionado.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con su credikiva logrará mayor disponibilidad de efectivo, para  poder realizar mejor su actividad y cumplir con sus pedidos, mientras recibe el pago de sus clientes que lo hacen cada 30 o 45 días. Aplicará este financiamiento a la elaboración de afiches, materiales publicitarios y una campaña que tiene planeada en la Costa Caribe de Colombia, para la cual fue contratado y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para este gran propósito.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 23-year old young man who began his working career at various advertising agencies.  Gaining a good market share, he managed to go off on his own and start his own advertising agency venture.  He dedicates himself to creating corporate image campaigns, marketing, publicity campaigns, event planning, typography, graphic design, allocation of office supplies and general sales of publicity materials.  

He started this business 4 years ago and his customers include travel agencies, individuals, and other enterprises that recommend his services because they know the quality of the work that Rafael produces.  The financial state of his micro-enterprise goes according to the amount of activity he carries out.  He makes his purchases in cash, and manages a net working margin no smaller than 39.80%.  Meanwhile, his inventories represent 17%, his accounts payable do not exceed 60% and rotate every 13 days; he does inventory every 6 days.

His greatest dream and biggest challenge is opening his installation in a more strategic location.  He knows that he will manage this with a great amount of effort when he is better positioned to do so.  Currently, he is applying for his first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With his Kiva credit, he will have more access to capital to better carry out his activities and fulfill his orders, while he waits for payment from customers every 30 or 45 days.

He will use this loan for creation of posters, publicity materials, and also for a campaign he has been contracted to do along the Caribbean Coast of Colombia, however his working capital is insufficient for this grand undertaking.

loans.use: create posters and publicity materials, as well as carry out a campaign he has planned throughout the Caribbean Coast of Colombia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabrics and supplies to augment production.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde desarrolla una actividad comercial y vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años. Su negocio lo inicio hace 13 años vendiendo mercancía variada con un mínimo capital. Gradualmente con el apoyo de un familiar logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y fue agregando poco a poco otros productos como dulces y  artículos para el hogar, perfumes, accesorios femeninos etc., con los que también fue incrementando su clientela.  Judith mediante su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha logrado fortalecerse como emprendedora, mediante programas de capacitación en los cuales ha participado,  formalización empresarial y sus créditos le han permitido incrementar su capital y todo ello su  visión empresarial. 
El sueño de Judith ahora se concentra en continuar  trabajando fuertemente en su negocio, para lograr tener su  casa propia y para eso planea su postulación al macroproyecto Villas de San Pablo en la ciudad,  promovido por la Fundación en el cumplimiento de su misión de desarrollar comunidades sostenibles.  Su mayor desafío es el manejo del tiempo pues también debe responder a sus responsabilidades de madre y esposa.  Mientras sus sueños se cumplen Judith continua esmerándose por sostener una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 29%, que planea aumentar con su credikiva con la cual inicia su trabajo y lo dirigirá a la compra de cubrelechos, perfumes y accesorios femeninos, que tiene encargada y generaran muy seguramente una experiencia exitosa debido a su disciplina y gran experiencia en la seleccion de clientes rentables, para lograr ventas a crèdito sanas.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the city of Barranquilla and this is where she carries out her business.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 3 and 5.  She started her business 13 years ago, selling a variety of merchandise with minimal capital.  Gradually, with the support of a family member, she managed to increase her working capital and she gradually added other products such as sweet treats and home products, perfumes, ladies' accessories, etc.  At the same time, she increased her number of customers.  Through her links to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Judith has managed to become a stronger entrepreneur, through the training programs which she has attended.  Her loans have allowed her to increase her capital and her business vision.

Judith's dream is now focused on continuing to work hard in her business so that she can manage to own her own home.  She plans to apply to join the Villas de San Pablo macro project in the city which is run by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of the fulfilment of their mission to develop sustainable communities.  Judith's greatest challenge is managing her time as she must also meet her responsibilities as a mother and a wife.  While she achieves her dreams, she continues to ensure that she maintains a profitability on her sales of no less than 29%.  She plans to increase this figure with her Kiva loan.  Judith will use her loan to buy bedspreads, perfumes and ladies' accessories that she has orders for and this will be a successful experience thanks to her discipline and her great experience in selecting profitable customers, in order to achieve healthy sales on credit.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, perfumes and ladies' accessories that she has orders for

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago de 54 años es un hombre que se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento y reparaciòn de vehículos motocicletas y bicicletas, además de vender repuestos para su mantenimiento y reparación técnica y mecánica, en su taller ubicado en su lugar de vivienda ubicado  en el municipio de Soledad, cerca de Barranquilla, donde muchos lo conocen y habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 21 años, con los que sueña ver prósperos y desarrollando su propio éxito. 
Su negocio nació hace 16 años, cuando se instaló en el departamento del Atlántico, procedente de su pueblo natal  y debió entonces buscar la forma de sostener a su familia,  generando  ingresos autónomos.  Al principio en su negocio solo cargaba de aire los neumáticos de motos y algunos vehículos, posteriormente su capacidad observadora le facilitó captar la oportunidad de vender accesorios como guayas, llantas, neumáticos, codos, tensores, con los cuales aún sigue trabajando  y ha logrado un M. creciente. Santiago   muchas veces siente que le hace falta capital para responder  oportunamente a todas las  necesidades de sus clientes. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, con él comprará variedades de rines, neumáticos, y guayas de moto.  Con esta inversión tendrá en su negocio de todo un poco y resolverá el tema de respuesta efectiva a sus clientes. Su gran sueño y desafío es tener una serviteca en un local bien ubicado, donde diversifique totalmente su oferta y logre con su negocio ser reconocido cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 54, provides maintenance and repair services for motorcycles and bicycles.  In his workshop he also sells replacement parts for technical and mechanical maintenance and repair.  His shop is located where his home is.  It is in the Soledad municipality close to Barranquilla, where a lot of people know him.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 21.  He dreams of seeing his children prosper and develop their own success. 

His business was born 16 years ago when he left his native town and set his business up in the Atlántico department.  He needed to look for a way to support his family and generate income on his own.  In the beginning he only worked on air in tires for motorcycles and some other vehicles.  Later, his observational ability helped him seize the opportunity to sell accessories like control cables, tires, rims, elbow adaptors, and turnbuckles.  He still uses them to work, and he has managed to get a growing market.

Santiago often feels that he does not have the money to opportunely respond to all of his customers’ needs.  This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

With this investment he will have a little bit of everything in his business .  This will be an effective solution for his customers.  His biggest dream and challenge is to have a service station in a good location.  That is where he will totally diversify his services, and he will make his business increasingly well-known.

loans.use: to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

loans.name: Las Aurelianas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Aurelianas está formado por 7 mujeres y un hombre quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de  clima frió, se caracteriza por la belleza natural y arquitectónica, tiene una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente es amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. Nuestras socias son personas muy amables y alegres, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. 

Una de las socias es la Señora Patricia, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, tienen 33 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión vendedor, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Patricia por el momento y debido a que sus hijos son aun pequeños se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero este crédito que es el primero que realiza en el banco comunal lo va a invertir en la compra de calzado para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es hacer realidad su negocio y crecer en el mismo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Aurelianas" is made up of 7 women and a man, and they live in the city of Cuenca. This is a cold climate city which is known for its natural beauty and architecture. There is a great variety of traditional recipes and its people is kind and they maintain their culture and traditions. The members are very kind and happy people who work in various activities. It helps them to contribute to their household economies and to support their families.

One of the members is Patricia. She lives in the city of Cuenca. She is 33 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived 2 children. They are 8 and 5 years old and they attend school in the city. Her husband is a vendor by profession. They don't own a house of their own so they live in a family house.

Patricia takes care of the household work given that her children are still small. But this loan is the first that she accesses with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of shoes, to start up a business. 

Her goal is to implement her business and to make the business grow.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Enma Lidia

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que cuenta con una hermosa estructura arquitectónica,  su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

Doña Enma tiene 34 años, es casada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 13, y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de la madera, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Enma se dedica a la cría de pollos, esta actividad  la realiza hace 5 meses. También labora en el negocio de su esposo.
 
Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
Enma is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. they are very kind and charismatic people.

Enma is 34 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived 3 children. They are 17, 13, and 11 years old. Her two eldest children are in high school in the city and her youngest daughter is in primary school. Her husband is a lumber merchant. The house in which they live is their own property.

Enma raises poultry and she has had this activity for the past 5 months. She also works in her husband's business.

This is the third loan she has with her communal bank and she will invest them in the purchase of poultry and their feed.

Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and their feed.

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que cuenta con una hermosa estructura arquitectónica,  su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de un año y siete meses. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Elsa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo por lo que aun esta pequeño y tambien en su casa cría  pollos, en esta actividad  se encuentra hace un año.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es  tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Elsa is 27 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived a son. He is 1 year and seven months old. her husband works in the field of construction, as a bricklayer. They do not own a house of their own so they rent.

Elsa dedicates her time to the care of her son because he is still little and she also raises poultry from her house. She has had this activity for the past year. 

This is the fist loan that she accesses with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of poultry had their feed.

Her dream is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and their feed.

loans.name: María Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que cuenta con una hermosa estructura arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señora María tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 25, 22, 18 años de edad, sus dos hijos mayores trabajan y  le ayudan  económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, ha migrado para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia, la casa en la que habitan es de propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a cuidar de su criadero de cuyes en el cual lleva 14 años, en sus tiempos libres se dedican a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes.
 
Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Maria is 43 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived 3 children. They are 25, 22, ad 18 years old. Her two eldest children work and help her financially and her youngest son attends school in the city. Her husband is out of the country. He emigrated to provide his family with a better future. The house in which they live is their own property.

Maria dedicates her time to taking care of her guinea pig farm. It is an activity she has had for 14 years. In her spare time she sells Yanbal brand products.

Her has rejoined her communal bank and her loan will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs.

Her dream is to travel the world.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Celinda Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora. Celinda es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de Nabon,  esta comunidad  es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

Doña Celinda tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 9 y 2 años y un bebé de  9 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Celinda se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas. También se dedica a la cría de animales los que vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas.

Su sueño es estudiar en el colegio.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the communal bank "Neuvo Bankito La Ramada" and she lives by the community of Nabon. This community is of cold climate and its people work in agriculture and livestock farming. Much of the population works in the city. 

Celinda is 29 years old, a single mother, and she has conceived 3 children. They are 9, 2, and the baby is 9 months old. Her eldest son attends school in the city. The house in which she lives is her own property. 

Celinda is an agriculturist and she plants vegetables. She also raises livestock and she sells them in her community. 

She is on her fourth loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and seeds. 

Her dream is to go to high school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: María Ercila

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de Nabon, esta comunidad es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 23, 19, 17, 14, 11, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, sus cuatro hijos siguientes sufren de discapacidad ya que son sordo mudos y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, tienen casa propia pero ya está muy deteriorada.

Doña María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, lo que siembra es para su consumo y para la venta. También se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y ganado a  los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes gallinas, ganado y alimento de animales.

Su sueño es tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Maria is 41 years old, married, and from her relationship she has conceived 7 children. They are 23, 19, 17, 14, 11, 8, and 6 years old. Her eldest daughter is married and independent. Her next four youngest children are disabled, being deaf mutes. The two youngest children attend school in the sector. Her husband is a bricklayer. They own their own house but it is much deteriorated.

Maria works in agriculture. And the harvest is for their consumption and to sell. She also raises guinea pigs, poultry, and cattle. She sells them in her community. 

She is on her third loan with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs, poultry, cattle, and livestock feed.

Her dream is to have a better home.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, guinea pigs, cattle, and livestock feed.

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramad, vive por la comunidad de Nabon, esta comunidad es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

Doña María tiene 49 años, es casada y ha concebido 9 hijos, sus cinco primeros hijos son casados, dos de sus hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedica a la agricultura, sus productos los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la cría de borregos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y también para arreglar su casa.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Bankito La Ramada. She lives by the community of Nabon. This community is of cold climate and its people are agriculturists and livestock farmers. Much of the population works in the city.

Maria is 49 years old, married, and she has conceived 9 children. Her eldest 5 children are married, two of her children are in high school, and her two youngest attend primary school in the neighborhood. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the house in which they live is their own property.

Maria is an agriculturist and she sells her products in the community. She also raises sheep, guinea pigs, poultry, and cattle.

Her dream is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to carry out maintenance repairs on her house.

loans.name: Nueva Integración (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Nueva Integración. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio en general. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  para poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Delia, tiene 46 años  de edad, está casada y de esa relación tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos independientes y dos de 18 y 8 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que tambien se dedica al comercio, vende productos tanto para el hogar como personales (planchas, licuadoras, zapatos, colchones, teléfonos, entre otras cosas), todos esos productos por el sistema de cartillas. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana deja a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Nos cuenta que en la actualidad quiere empezar también con la venta de toallas, ella lleva dedicada al comercio 8 años y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar toallas y empezar con este nuevo negocio. Este es el primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal,  es la presidenta y espera desempeñar una buena gestión en el grupo y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.

Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y tener buenas ventas.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Nueva Integracion" meets every two weeks in he locale of Los Rosales in the city of Portoviejo. They undertake various activities, such as agriculture, livestock farming, and general commerce. A short time ago, after coming to know the benefits offered by the institution, they decided to come together to access loans through Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner). It is their first loan cycle and they hope to perform well and to continue to work with the institution. 

Here we met Delia. She is 46 years old, married, and from her relationship she has five children. Three of them are independent and two are 18 and 8 years old. The eldest of these two is in high school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. 

She is a great housewife and she is also a merchant. She sells products for the home as well personal use products (irons, blenders, shoes, mattresses, telephones, and other things). She sells items using the “cartillas” system (similar to lay-away; customer signs up for an item and makes small payments toward it until payment is complete and item is handed over). She works four days per week and she completes her sales on credit, taking payments every Sunday. She tells us that she wants to start selling towels. She has been a merchant for 8 years and it has gone well for her.

Her dream is to keep going with her business and to have good sales.

loans.use: to purchase towels.

loans.name: Frella Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Frella, tiene 46 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad, pero aún viven en su casa. Ella tiene su casa propia la en la cual vive con sus hijos. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho y además porque dan los créditos sin tantos requisitos

Ella para ganarse el sustento diario y para que a sus hijos no les faltara nada desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en una casa realizando quehaceres domésticos y como esto no le era suficiente para poder la carga de criar a tres hijos una amiga un dia la incentivó para que se dedicara a vender ropa, ella ahora comparte el tiempo entre su trabajo y  las ventas de ropa la cual las realiza de casa en casa. Lleva dos años con este negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The credit group named "Palabra de Mujer", meaning "A Woman's Word" meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. This locality is known for its traditional culture and because it is a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, being San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we met Frella. She is 46 years old and a single mother of three. Her children are grown but they still live at home. She owns the home where she and her children live. She has been with the credit group since the beginning and she enjoys it because the loans have really helped her, and loans are granted without so many requirements.

She has been providing private cleaning services for many years to earn a daily income and so that her children will not need anything. But because this was not enough to support three children, she started selling clothing following a friend's incentive. Currently she divides her time between her employment and her clothing sales, a business she carries out from her home. She has two years in the business and she tells us that it has gone very well for her.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and kids' clothing.

Her dream is to have a store from where to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and kids' clothing.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 9, 7, 3 años y un bebé 6 meses,  los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer de una volqueta.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local y hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja de lunes a viernes más que todo por las tardes y en su casa cuando sus clientes quieran ir ella con mucho gusto las atiende, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Nos cuenta que lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien a pesar de la competencia.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y ropa interior.  Lleva seis ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos a vender a otros lugares.
texts.en:
The credit group named "Palabra de Mujer", meaning "A Woman's Word" meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. This locality is known for its traditional culture and because it is a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, being San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we met Maria. She is 26 years old, married common-law, and she has four children. They are 9, 7, 3, and 6 months old. The two eldest are attend school. Her husband is a dump truck driver.

She sells all types of clothing, and her sales method is to travel from door to door and to sell from a small store in her house. When she receives new merchandise her clients come to visit her. She works from Monday to Friday mostly in the afternoons and whenever her clients want to come to visit her she is glad to attend to them. She completes her sales on credit and she takes payments every eight days. She buys her merchandise from Guayaquil every two weeks. She tells us that she has been in business for seven years and it has gone very well for her, despite the competition.

This loan is to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, kids' clothing and undergarments. She has been with her credit group for the past six loan cycles. She appreciates it for the quick loans that greatly help her with her business.

Her dream is to purchase a car to be able to take her products to other places to sell.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, kids' clothing, and undergarments.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Ana es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una preciosa hija de tres años  de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y ropa en general. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6H00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupado, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que con la tienda lleva un año pero que en lo que es venta de ropa hace ya cuatro años y que poco a poco con ayuda de los créditos ella pudo poner su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en adecuar un local donde muy pronto va a poner otra tienda.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio, que su tienda crezca cada día más y que la otra sea mucho mejor
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Palabra De Mujer [Woman's Word] credit group meets every two weeks. The community is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ana is a founding member of the credit group and she likes it because its interests are lower than other lending institutions. She is 31 years old, married, and has a beautiful daughter who is three years old. Her husband works as a bricklayer.  

She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, as well as certain variety items, paper products and general clothing. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes later. Her husband helps her at work when he is otherwise unoccupied. She tells us that she has had the store for a year but she has been selling clothes for four years and little by little, with the help of the loans she was able to open her store.

She is going to use the loan to outfit a locale very soon in order to open another store.   
 
Her goals are to continue with her business and for her store to grow more every day and for the other one to be a lot better.

loans.use: to equip a locale for a store.

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Norma, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es agricultor.
 
Es una gran ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella también vende a base de encargos que sus clientes le piden con anticipación. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en las mañanas ya que a esta hora hace menos calor nos cuenta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez  al mes. Lleva dos años que dedicada a esta actividad y nos cuenta que fue con el primer crédito que  empezó su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y ropa interior.  Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito ella pudo empezar con su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y que este crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Palabra de Mujer' loan group meet in the town of Charapoto which is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 50 year-old Norma who lives with her common-law husband.  She has six grown-up children, two of whom live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.
 
Norma is a great housewife who also sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door.  She also sells based on orders that her customers place with her.  Norma works mornings, from Monday to Friday.  She tells us that this is because it is not so hot at that time of day.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.  She has been in this business for two years and she tells us that she started the business with her first loan.

Norma will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes and underwear.  She has been a member of her loan group for two years and she likes it because she was able to use her first loan to start her business.

Norma's dreams are to continue in her business and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Norly requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle. Norly has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Norly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Poun

texts.en: Poun is a shoe seller with her husband; their income is $15 per day. She has two children, aged 10 and 6, both of them in school. There are five members in her family including her mother. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $17 on electricity, $22 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy shoes to sell. Since she started this business, she has dealt with a lot of problems; sometime she can’t find any customers, but she is still trying. Right now she can make a good income because of help from her husband. With the income she makes, she will save for her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha is married with 5 school-aged children. She is 45 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She sells snack items to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years, earning PHP 2,000.00 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to buy more snack items to sell. Bernadetha has been a member of GDMPC for a year and hopes to expand her snack-vending business in the market and have a food stall of her own.

loans.use: to buy snack items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years-old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 

Jocelyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She earns PHP 15,000.00 a month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000.00 from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to purchase more fish varieties to sell in the market and her rental stall.

Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her rented fish stall in the market and obtain another stall in an adjacent town.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is married and has five school-aged children. She is 52 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Cerela grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She earns 2,000 PHP a month from this business. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for her vegetables. Cerela has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, Cerela hopes to expand her vegetable garden in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for vegetables

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 39 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-aged children. Josie is a farmer. She owns and operates a business planting and selling peanuts in the local community .She has been engaged in an inter-cropping system, growing coconut and fruit trees while, at the same time, planting peanuts for over five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay labor costs for land preparation and to purchase peanut seeds and fertilizers.

Josie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Josie hopes to gain more income from this production and purchase more space for her plantation.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to prepare the land and to purchase peanut seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-aged children.

Mariliza has a retail business to earn a living. She sells personal and cosmetics products in the local community. She sells items like shampoo, toothpaste, powder, lotion and perfume. She has been engaged in this business for over three years. She earns PHP 2,000 a month from this activity. She has requested a loan of 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase cosmetics products to sell.

Mariliza has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Mariliza hopes to gain more income and expand her cosmetics business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
A beautiful businesswoman, Vanessa is 28 years old, single and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vanessa has a retail business to earn a living. She sells beauty and cosmetics products like lotion, powder, cologne and perfume to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 5,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase volumes of cosmetics products to sell.

Vanessa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Vanessa hopes to expand her cosmetics business and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna has a retail shop at home to make a living. She sells different food products in her community. Johnna is 28 years old and lives in Calamaba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She has been in her business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. 

Johnna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Johnna hopes to expand her retail business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married woman and a mother of three adult-aged dependents. She is 54 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Nilda has a retail store at home to earn a living. She sells basic food items in the local community everyday. She has been engaged in this retail business for 10 years. She earns a monthly total of PHP 7,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase soft drinks to sell for refreshment.

Nilda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Nilda hopes to gain more income and extend her store for refreshment.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Man Maya

texts.en:
Man Maya is 40 years-old. She is married and has three children aged 22, 14 and 10.  In 2002, she established her grocery shop business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Man Maya plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

If a borrower is to improve the living standard, extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of  the small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married lady and a mother of four adult-aged children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosa has a food vending business to earn a living. She also has a second business in retail. She sells freshly prepared food by peddling in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 7,000 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

Rosa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Rosa hopes to gain more income so that she can establish a food stall in the town.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three grown-up children. Lourdes runs a small market from home to earn a living. She also has a second business in backyard pig raising. The main source of her income comes from selling assorted food items in her community. She has been selling for five years. She earn a monthly total of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from these activities.

Lourdes has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase swine feed to sell. She has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Lourdes hopes to gain more income and purchase more available products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase swine feed  to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married and a mother of two school-aged children. She is 41 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Jessica has a small market at home to earn a living. She is engaged in selling basic food items in the local community. She runs her business for ten years. She earn a total of PHP 2,800.00 a month for doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase a volume of fried fish to sell.

Jessica has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase a volume of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tissie is married and a mother of four adult children. She is 54 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Tissie has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She is engaged in selling different food items like food in pouches, candies, biscuits and canned goods in the local community. She has been running her business for ten years. She earns a total monthly of PHP 4,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase rice and corn grain to sell.

Tissie has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future,Tissie hopes to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grain to sell.

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha is 39 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 12.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to to buys seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.  

In the future, Matha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. As a borrower to improve living standard extra trainings needed. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-aged children.

Nora has a small market at home to earn a living. She also has a second business of selling snack food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling assorted food and personal products. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,800.00 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional products to sell.

Nora has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her retail business and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 28 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-aged children. 

Marichu has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She has been engaged in selling basic food items for three years. She sells products, like rice and corn grains, dried fish, coffee, milk and canned goods. She earns PHP 2,800.00 a month from these business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Marichu has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Marichu hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a food vending business to earn a living. She prepares and sells her products by peddling in her community. She sells snack foods like pancakes, peanuts, baked goods and refreshments. Lilian is married and the mother of three grown-up children. She is 62 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been in her business for five years. She earns a total of 3,000 PHP from these activities. 

Lilian has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lilian hopes to gain more income and purchase a vacant space in the market for a snack stall.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is 25 years old, single, and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jessica is a fisher. She raises fish in a fishpond to earn a living. She raises fish like milkfish and tilapia. She has been in this business for two years. Every quarter, she earns a total average of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fingerlings and fish feeds. Jessica has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jessica hopes to raise fish large-scale and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings and fish feeds.

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Cheri Mai is 52 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 30 and 19. In 2000, she established her business making brass religious statues. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Cheri Mai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila is 31 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 5. In 2003, she established her furniture-making business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood and timbers. In the future, Sarmila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timbers.

loans.name: Santu

texts.en:
Santu is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 25 and 18. In 1999, she established her business making brass religious statues. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials. In the future, Santu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin. Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for making brass religious statues

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is 32 years-old.  She is married and has 3 children ages 14, 11 and 8.  In 2003, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Tara plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys materials for her tea shop business

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
The Sumbersari Permai group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp.10.000.000, and each member will receive Rp.1.000.000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement their family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their third loan with MUK.

Kadek is the head of the Sumbersari Permai group.  She is married and has one child. She will use the loan to buy three piglets.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months of fattening.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genera is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Genera has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and beverages and for making home made sausage.
Genera is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Genera hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages and to make home made sausage

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 
Letty has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Letty is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business of driving. With the loan, he will repair his taxi car, which will allow him to provide better transport services to his passengers.  

Surriya is a widow and spends her time at home doing her household responsibilities. She is the mother of three other children. Both of her sons are drivers while her daughter is studying. 

She is very hopeful about the future development of her son’s business. He has been operating it for the past 10 years and Surriya is confident that he will be able to increase his income after repairing his transport, which will help him also save his business asset. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To repair a taxi car

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 49,500 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her pottery business. Cynthia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening. Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her pottery

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
59 year-old Carmelita is a farmer working in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice since 2002. She earns about 6000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Carmelita is single and has no children. She supports her parents financially. Carmelita requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Emerilou

texts.en:
Emerilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Emerilou has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Emerilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emerilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 62 years old and married with 10 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Josephine has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling seaweed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 42 years old and married. He has 2 children aged 18 and 17.

Leonardo is a seaweed farmer. He has been growing and selling seaweeds since the year 2000. Leonardo works hard to provide the needs of his family. He requested a loan to purchase straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming. Leonardo is hoping that this loan will help improve his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase straw, rope, bamboo and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Felipa has a food shop that sells rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making rice & cassava cakes.
Felipa is a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Felipa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making rice & cassava cakes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old and single. He is a farmer who tills a land in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice for sell. Michael earns about 6000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Michael requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. He hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

In the future, Michael hopes to improve his house and have his own family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor
